review: As it stands now I personally cannot reccommend this game in good faith as the game currently stands. Now whether or not the problems that led are my fault or the games fault I am writing this with my experience in the game thus far in mind.Pros Plethora of weapons and customization Very tactical combat due to Arma heritage Does the "Battle Royale" style of game very well Can go in alone or with friends or play custom games Very pretty environment (should you have the horsepower to use those graphical settings)Neutral You will die a lot due to being surprised ambushed or picked off from someone who is half a mile away and there is nothing you can do about it The controls are somewhat clunky and take a little time to get used to (Thanks Arma...) The Blue Screen of Death is fast as hell and you better have a good head start or you will be hurting (or dead) Cons*NOTE* These cons are subjective as I do not know if this happens much to others or not. These come from my experience over the 30+ hours playtime. Your experience may differ from mine Lag. I am not sure if they have yet to really get the kinks out server side or it's just my side but LAG is all too prevalent in the game. It is frequent and bad enough to bring the flow of the game to a screeching halt and break the immersion. On top of this it has led to my death multiple times and having to start a new match without even getting to actually play that round. Graphics. Now remember how I said that the environment was pretty? Well it can take quite a while to load all of the assets and that can break game immersion too. My computer is no slouch either. It's a decent machine with a 6th gen i5 8GB of Ram and a GTX960 but the game only runs smoothly on the lowest settings. Like the lag the graphics can (and most cases it will) halt and freeze the game until it is done loading and can lead to you dying before getting the chance to get going. On top of this while loading the assets the buildings look like a 4 year old tried to waterpaint each one but kept sneezing on it with each stroke. Stress.HO BOY is this game going to stress you out. Now to be fair some might enjoy the heart pounding and stress that comes with playing this game but for me it borders on anxeity. When you are running around doing well and surviving you feel great. When you start having to be careful trying to sneak around everything makes you jump. EVERYTHING. Then add someone who kills you since they were behind you the entire time and ends it all for you. Repeat that 30x and you will forcefully say you need to stop for the day. It doesn't feel good. This can largely be avoided if you play with friends but if you play solo better start going to the therapist amigo.TL DR The game is good but lag graphical work load and stress ruin it. I will update this when these issues are or are not resolved. I will also continue playing the game since let's face it I'm a game addict at times. The stress can be handled with various means on the player side but network lag and the graphical workload need to be optimized before the game can reach its true potential. There is a lot to like about the game but the main issues are too big to ignore.

review: This game is to be short purely based on RNG.RNG on how the plane flies over the map.RNG on how many people decide to drop out when you do.RNG on where the loot is.RNG on what loot it is.RNG on the circle.RNG on the red zone (which usually ends up right where I'm stood with my squad).RNG on vehicle spawns.RNG on loot drops.Simply put it's an FPS style lottery game.To end up with good gear and on the good spot for ambushing is based luck not on skill.The only skill you need is aiming hoping the enemy doesn't outgun you due to lootluck.Add on top of that that the game recently came out of beta and still is littered with bugs.The "rubberbanding" that occurs shortly after landing is simply spectacular. You'd expect them to have fixed this BEFORE going live as it was present during the beta as well.The game has been live for weeks and it's still littered with bugs... are the devs 10 year olds with their very first game making experience or something...? 30 for this game? not worth it....

review: This is the first Hentai I've seen that doesn't make me feel a slight sense of shame just for liking it. It's so well done the relationship between the two main characters is actually believable. Their thoughts behavior even the dialog is relatable if slightly exaggerated. This is a story of two people a student and a teacher who are falling madly in love with each other and are afraid of the consequences a relationship like theirs will have on their life.Most importantly the sex is passionate. The kissing is the best I've ever seen in hentai and they are just all over each other. It kind of reminds me of a high school relationship. Sex is new hormones are raging and the two just can't stay away from each other. They seemed glued together and all they want to do is which is exactly what I get from our two main characters. Since a student/teacher relationship is so taboo they don't know how to proceed or what to do with their feelings. Again just like a young and newly sexually active couple. It also doesn't waste too much time with the plot yet still gets you interested and the character development often occurs during the sex scenes. It some how manages to have an engaging story without interrupting the mood. Especially when compared to a lot of other Hentai the ratio of erotica and plot/character development leans greatly towards the former.

I personally enjoy it more with friends appropriate mostly for teenagers. This game is much better optimized and you need a fairly decent computer to run it. review: Just got this game for Christmas. As a FPS it's pretty sloppy. Everything handles like it's coated in butter. Expect a lot of sliding. I frequently place in the Top 20 not because I'm good but because that's how long it takes me to locate another player. The timers really need to be shortened. Once you're in the middle of the circle and you have all the gear you need there's nothing to do for the next 20 minutes except sit in a bush and go grab a sandwich. It's mostly wait wait wait wait wait die to camper. I can't give it a thumbs down because maybe some people like that sort of thing. Basically the game goes like this when you teleport to the airplane a bunch of Asian people shout in your ear. Then you find one gun and a bicycle helmet and spend the next 20 minutes holding down sprint. Then you get killed by someone who has been lying prone in a bush since the game started. Restart.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've sunk about 10 hours this past week into Pubg when the 1.0 released and I must say to the devs well done.Pros Gameplay is fun and addicting I get over 40 FPS on my crappy computer Squad and duo feature allow for even more fun with friends The new map Miramar is a great addition to the game and is way better in my opinion to their first map A lot of guns(AKM Scar M416 M16 etc.) keep the shooting fun but challenging Not too expensiveCons Servers are laggy as balls as of this moment(12/24/17). I rubberband constantly until the player count drops to under 80. Makes it almost unplayable Not relatively cheap either Game is kind of optomized but not to the level it should be atOverall the game is really good but my major complaint as of right now is the lagging. If that would be fixed I would love the game even more.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG is the type of game where it starts off with not caring too much if you die in the first few minutes (approx 90 players alive) after a little while and some reasonable loot and gear has been found you would prefer not to die at this point but still not too fussed if you die (approx 60 70 players alive). After the 3rd/4th blue circle You start to believe that you can achieve the impossible...you could possibly win...you'll taste the sweet fruits of victory...(10 players remaining)...you've made it to top 10....but you still want more....no more mistakes or joking around now...you're close....(last 2 players)...you believe in this...you can win! But alas...you make an idiotic mistake. You end as #2.....that moment will haunt you forever...This is what will happen every game you'll feel rage anger and above all serenity when you die because you know that the game is over....until you start the next one. Pros1. Extremely active and communicative developers. This is vital for an early access game. PUBG is being constantly updated every month. I would speculate that this is one of the major factors in PUBG's success. Other battle royale PvP games are mostly in Early Alpha for years and their devs are too focused on gathering as much money as they can from the current players without making any real development progress on the game PUBG is exactly the opposite.2. Great gameplay concept. No pay to win and no grind to win. Apparels are only cosmetics. The only thing you keep from playing PUBG is your skill. The PvP is thrilling and definitely fun to play with your friends.3. Non toxic community. Simply because there is no chat function. Switch your voice channel to team only and you're good to go. I wouldn't recommend teaming up with strangers because of obvious reasons.4. Highly demanding on teamwork and strategy. You can't just hop off the plane and recklessly run around the map no scoping bozos. You have to plan out your movement very carefully and quickly since time is of the essence. Difficult decisions comes up often especially in squad play (e.g. risk your life to revive your mate or run like hell to safety Kill someone and give out your position to nearby players or stay quiet Deciding your next 'safe spot' etc.) An enjoyable learning curve definitely exists not too steep and not too lean. 5. A shooting game that applies semi realistic weapon recoil bullet travel time and bullet drop is always appreciated.6. Various vehicles weapons weapon mods clothings and equipments are scattered all over the battleground to aid you in your quest of survival. The weapon stats variety amps up the gameplay It can be quite a challenge to engage in a firefight when you got the wrong weapon for the situation.7. Although FPS is not recommended due to limited POV the game supports both FPS and TPS.8. Minor performance improvements can get quite noticeable after several updates. Devs truly are working on the optimization issue. We can look forward towards better performance in the future.Cons1. Currently very performance demanding. The game isn't optimized that well yet and runs on very unstable fps even on high end rigs. The minimum 6 gigs of RAM is an absolute minimum virtual RAMs can't help your 4 gigs RAM PC. In terms of GPU one of my friends that is using a GTX980 is suffering from &lt 30fps and extremely slow loading progress. Another friend with a GTX1060 suffers from fps drops during rain/smoke.As a response to comments' feedback for my 1st cons list The game is still playable on all those mentioned GPUs. I just want you to know that the game is not optimized well. FPS drops crashes and screen freeze will sometimes happen even on high end rigs. It happens randomly I don't measure the frequency.UPDATE Although the game is still quite laggy minor performance improvements are already noticeable after the latest updates. I no longer suffer from fps spikes with my GTX1080. Most performance issues are related to server lag instead of PC after June 27 update.2. Server is lagging badly due to high player base. I would speculate devs didn't expect a huge sale boom and didn't have the resources to support all the players. As an example you were running to cover when under enemy fire. You already reached the cover but 2 seconds later blood spurts out of your chest you fell down to the ground gasping for air as your vision starts to blur. You scream for your squadmate to magically heal your bullet wound by rubbing the grass around you but then...okay you get my pointWelcome to the battlegrounds. &amp &amp &amp &amp &amp

We also noticed getting the animation for getting injured including all fancy sounds but not actually beeing attacked or losing health.The one thing which needs to be done is optimization. review: Runs like absolute trash. Dont believe their minimum specs. To run this game decently you at least need a gtx 1050 ti. Not to mention the servers are awful. It can take up to 1 seccond for a shot to register when you try to shoot someone. So far range moving targest and quickscoping are almost impossible. That 1 seccond also doesent count for your ping aswell. If you have slow internet (200 ping) you will not and I repeat NOT be able to be competetive in this game or even play at all. One other awful thing is landing. Once you land you cant get any weapons because the weapons take 15 SECCONDS TO LOAD IN. My only reccomdation if you get this game is update your graphics drivers to the latest version. AMD and Nvidia updated their drivers to make their cards run this game slightly better. And believe me slightly better is better than nothing slightly better doesent mean good either. I want to manually make this game run better myself because bluehole games wont do it. Ill basically sum down everything they said into one sentence they stated "If you try to change the game file you will be banned" So bacially I cant go into the textures folder and change it so my game runs better. On the subject of getting banned There are so many hakers on this game its insane. So Yes Hacking wont get you banned But changing the Texture file of the game to make it run better will. Like really bluehole games? Anyway back to the hackers. Every other game it seems like you are getting killed by one. There anti cheat system is garbage and does not work at all. Next I need to tallk about physics. These are the worst physics of any game ove ever played. The parachute is impossible to control and marking a place on the map and flying to that exact place is extremly hard. The gun play is trash aswell All the guns feel the same weather it be a pistol or an ak47DONT GET THIS GAME
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: love this game so much it can get so intense. I once avenged my 2 buddies who went down in battle. they had pushed towards a small town on the shoreline just next to the major military base. I was lurking behind to cover out backs as we proceed to take the town. As my buddies pushed in they were picked off one by one just on the outskirts of the small village. but i was still a ways away so i couldnt get to their aid quick enough to revive them.They hide died.I made my way to their death sites. I was on the outskirts inbetween their graves. i knew there were stil at least 3 enemies hiding waiting for me but in my grief i did not care about caution with my double barel shotgun and enough ammo to kill 10 people i began hunting them. i find one enemy inside a building looking away from me. i shoot him through the window from outside. i reload and turn the corner to the otherside of the house to find his buddy who fell to my shells. two down one left. i turn 2 more corners to find their car so listen for the last man. he comes up along side it not knowing im waiting on the other side of the car when he met his demise... It felt good to avange my fallen comrades. But none the less i was alone and sad.i ended up placing 6th that game. Not bad for my 5th 6th game of pubg ever. lol.its moments like these that get me coming back.10/10. Game needs to be fixed in some aspects but i believe itll become amazing.

I ask when we jump no one answers of course&gt I say it and jump&gt They wait like ten more seconds before jumping so they're across the damn map from me&gt After walking and sneaking around for a while they all drive up in a jeep out of nowhere&gt I hop in&gt We scout out a nearby house and then hop back in our jeep to drive to the top of a mountain&gt "Guys don't do this." I plead&gt No response&gt They're gonna camp with snipers overlooking a town for the rest of the game probably&gt I get a devious idea&gt Nobody's in the jeep and the only way down probably requires fall damage&gt Hop in&gt Hear a frantic rustle&gt "DUDE WHAT THE HELL"&gt Drive off the mountain&gt "This is what you get for not using mics s."&gt Eventually hop out of the car while driving by accident and run myself over&gt Die10/10 would steal micless teammates car again.

review: An absolutely terrible game with awful servers and even worse optimization. You will be on your enemy's screen a solid second after you get behind cover and then die when they shoot your afterimage. Good luck having a close quarters battle because with the mix of particle effects tanking you fps and the server itself because two people next to eachother is more than it can handle you'd be lucky if you get a single shot off in the direction of your enemy. Matchmaking does not exist so you'll either fight a potato who has never seen a computer before this firefight or shroud level pro players who will kill you before they even register on your screen. This is an absolutely terrible game that is only successful because it came out during a time where it has no real competition for people looking for a realistic modern fps game.

Maybe it's the tight gameplay how the guns feel or the adrenaline rush after getting a chicken dinner who knows. Something just keeps me coming back. I've played it since first day early access and probably will continue to do so until the game completely dies. if you like BRs where you just pick up a gun and start shooting people PUBG is for you. If you don't care about monitization schemes and just want to play the game PUBG is for you. I love the crap out of this game. You will too.

review: The game is so good most will play the crap out of it til' they get tired of it and come on here and review that they don't like it anymore. Those people suck. Then you have another group who have played it so much and love it that they suddenly hate it now because the developers want to survive past early access by finding other revenue streams even though it is not pay2play microtransactions. They are the worst. If YOU are into shooters and love a competitive shooter this is for you and you will love and potentially hate it. But no doubt you'll love it at first until you get tired of it. That's how good the game is. The only problem I find with the game is that it's still in eearly access and that it needs new modes and new maps. But that requires the developers to scale their business which is very expensive. I want new modes that are just as fun and original like a zombie mode or a more confined version of a map that is action packed. I hope they include assasinationg animations and new features to wearble items like double pistol holsters for double pistol action with animation pistol whips. Features like these will prolong the gameplay years from now. So the game is fine. Buy it play it and if you get tired of it go play something else or get some friends because that's where this game shines the most.

review: This game has a bad rep from the few players who have been banned for no reason people who claim "there are way too many hackers" and poor optimization. The game is really fun though once you get used to the gun mechanics. I always find myself wanting to keep playing matches because of the new mini royale mode. I think they actually did a good job with adding Sanhok despite the mistakes Bluehole has made in other areas of the game like porting it to Xbox instead of further optimizing the game or addressing the bugs. PUBG really lacked the speed that their main competitor Fortnite had but Sanhok is a whole new map with even faster flow than the original mode. Had Bluehole fixed more bugs instead of taking time to develop loot crates than this might be my favorite game. After all the bugs aren't bad enough to make this game unplayable or even not fun. Its still an amazing game with the potential to rise back up to being the most popular game on Steam again.EDIT The Fix PUBG campaign is bringing this game onto the road of recovery. Really wanna see how it turns out and I think if you were skeptical of this game before the campaign will bring it to a much beter level of playability.

review: I got this game last year as something to play with friends because we all thought it would be fun. It was for a time but a lack of updates and microtransactions ruined it. This game had so much potential and it has been a shame to see it go to waste. Instead of listening to their player base Bluehole listened to their marketing team. They added crates and made the majority of them need a key that costs $2.50 to open they ignored optimization problems fixed bugs only when nessesary told the playerbase that it would update these concerns in the future and with the new update added a $10 battle pass. The damage has been done and they will never have as many people playing the game as they used to but if they want to try and make an honest effort to rebuild that playerbase they need to start acting like a game that you have to pay money for. They complain about Fortnite copying thier format but they do the same thing with their battle pass. You want to bring players back give them a game that is worth $30.

review: I was tired of hearing about all the hype so I took a chance and spent some disposable income. Wow I was blown away. The first time you get shot at is an experience. I almost jumped out of my seat and immediately afterward was still slightly shaking. Fast forward a few games I'm the one doing the killing and joining up with decent squad mates hellbent on murdering every single player on the map. I died I killed it was fun. There were some bugs but nothing to completely turn me away from it.But then one evening I attempted to log on and play but no servers were available. "oh well let me wait a bit and try again."I was greeted with the same message. days have passed and I haven't been able to play. Trying to log in at different times doesn't seem to help the issue. Until more servers are bought/created/crafted/brought forth from the depths of hell I will remain a former gamer of PUBG. It was fun while it lasted and I don't feel like I can give this game a good review seeing as how I can't actually play it.

review: I give this game a positive review but it is borderline negative. First of all it is still a fun game. The game mechanics are cool and the gunplay ist extraordinary. I like the notch of realism this game provides albeit spraying an m416 real life will not provide the same results as ingame. Same is viable for the other Assault Rifles and Light Machineguns ingame. Ballistics and also the "time to kill" is balanced quite well altough they should remove the limb hits if you hit someone with 5.56 or 7.62 both will penetrate the Hand/Arm etc. and will result in a body hit. Well I guess it is as realistic as I would take it in a game. For the gunplay remove the spray'n pray make single shot more viable and make continuus full auto not sustainable because in real life it isnt it takes an excessive amount of force to control an full auto spray on an assault rifle and it is still pretty hard on a sub machinegun. 2 5 bullets full auto burst are pretty much doable for a trained soldiert. Real life you get the best results with double tapping followed by a head/pelvic shot. knock the vest penetrate the vest kill. But all in all I like the mechanics. I also like the smaller map sanhook because you get in a game have loot and also action thats the best part. Also the update with private servers for everyone ist cool. But why not implement the war mode all the time which is great for training aim and guns. The negative part which is why this review has a wee bit of a negative lean is the server/client/client synchro. It happes far to often that you get shot behind walls or else. And its not all because of cheaters mostly it is due to the bad sync. It can be pretty depressing to survive a hot drop have like 2 8 kills or sth and then just die to a guy in a house sitting in a corner and the best part about that sometimes its so laggy that you dont see him on your screen but the other player sees you bam dead where was he? darn. You guys should probably add something like a faint breathing sound or occasional rattling from clothing. Because no one is dead silent or can move dead silent. It'll but another flavour in the game.

review: So you might wanna take a look at my gaming hour 1100+ hrs. Yea I'm absolutely a veteran.I had so much great memories on this game not because the game itself but meeting people around the world..With that being said it's still a game. Graphic is great and detailed However with GTX1070 it still sometimes drops to unacceptable 30FPS. I do know frame drop is common in battle royale game even in COD Black Out but frame drop in this game is way too common. Devs make changes in this game way too often adding non sense weapon and functions adding unnecessary textures which people even wont notice.. Because of the Unreal Engine eveytime a small change in game leads to a huge update like 5 12 gigs. I know in the states or south Korea the internet is fast but there're lots of people playing with network. Cheating No more need to say. STILL a serious problem Crashing So common that sometimes you literally just cant tell what the cause is. It happens so much. Lack of respect to Chinese players who devote more than 60 precent of PUBG's selling. Physics is terrible player moves like a moron/robot You cant feel that sense of smoothness like playing COD/R6 Siege/Battlefield. I really want to see COD Black Out and Battlefield V beat PUBG down to Gamers today are too desperate for good games to play this never be fixed and poorly coded garbage. I'm one of those players and I'm done with it. DONT WASTE MONEY.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Log in Make a Bob Ross looking Mother F*****..... Jump online for intense fighting action........ Buncha people yelling nonsense pregame burning and shooting..... Now were on a plane about to jump in an epic fasion to prove whos number one Racist comments and insults from the plane. I jump and fall AWESOME!!!!!!!!!! im on the ground always watching my back finding new weapons I will surley win. A wall comes at me then through me? I cant keep up run out of health and die.... Will play this forever.In all seriousness I really like the flow of the game It reminds me of alot of Mod DayZ before standalone Games can last anywhere from 3 minutes to 35 minutes. where stealth and patience can get you really far showing how many people are left and how quickly they drop like flies is amazing and scary knowing that your in that group of players. There is so much cover and then adding in weather effects to enhance gameplay and keep it interesting. I guess I feel its like short burst pvp for dayz without running around for 2 4 hours not to mention you can run in groups. Its worth the money.Pros Solid gameplay for early release Gun mechanics are very smooth and accurate Movement is suprisingly fluent though it is slightly stiff Jumping from the plane is simply amazing choosing when to jump is scary. As of now its quick to get into a game. Your not forced to spectate after death you can jump into another game right away. Sounds are very good you can hear someone running around shooting driving etc not to mention where the sounds are coming from. Healing takes 3 7 seconds and you have to wait for it to finish makes the risk vs reward aspect so much better.Cons When the Fight area circle is going to be reduced the Blue wall is way to fast they should slow it down a little bit. It can pass you and goes faster then you while you loose health and die. no FOV option "Though you can see really far this could hurt lower end pc users" if graphics on low its hard to make out anything from a distance. When graphics are on low from a distance some of the taller bushes look like players "increasing AA textures helped with this". Some guns do very low damage even to unarmored players.I feel this game will improve in time its already very fun and feels rewarding even if you loose. I give it 4/5

review: OK so I broke down to buy this game after enjoying playing the mobile version for the past few weeks. Thinking cool this would be better. Actually the mobile game is better than the PC version. WOW... really? Yep.Let me explain. This is a VERY fast paced game which you need to spend time finding gear and killing others to survive. OK yeah that's a known right? Mobile version... I run over the gear and I pick up the best that fits what I've configured to autopick up. PC version... Oh look here... hmmm lets pick up this... and this... and crap I didn't want that... let me manually drop this... and crud I picked up a backpack v1 when I had a v2 equiped... GRRR!That's just one example. There are a lot more. The mobile version is more streamlined for good action focusing on the game play vs trying to manually inventory manage everything like the PC version.Also when you drop a gun in PC version it doesn't take off the mods you've attached. That's right you gotta pull them off before you switch to another gun then re apply them again (all manual)This is going to be one of the rare cases in which I'd say the mobile app is better than PC.

review: PUBG is one of the premier battle royale games available to play right now. Throughout this review I'm gonna do my best not to compare it to Fortnite too much.SettingsPlayer controls are something you need to be careful of. One way to describe controlling your player is that the player feels like it's running on ice. When you're sprinting and come to a stop the player slides a little forward. Perhaps PUBG wanted players to come to a gradual halt but they should definitely look at games like GTA V on how they do that with their in game characters. Graphically the game is just above average. It's nothing too amazing coming from the Unreal Engine. PUBG have come a long way with their optimisation though and I have to hand it to them for that.PvPCompared to Fortnite PUBG is the more realistic and strategic battle royale game of the two. It's the "Battlefield" of the COD vs BF comparison. You can't go into fights without a strategy. The PvP is often dominated by riflemen from long range or a shotty by a camper. You'll sometimes come by a handful of players darting through the houses with SMGs but that briefly sums up the PvP in the game.Player SurvivalPUBG's player health and perks aren't plentiful. All players have health (obviously) but one thing that PUBG has that's unique is the perk system. There are two perks you can get while in a match healing and speed boost. These perks can be obtained by taking energy drinks and supplements. These perks aren't permanent either and will gradually go away throughout the match. Sometimes you may come across situations where you need to dive and swim. The oxygen system keeps you from staying underwater forever but it can be a bit glitchy at times as you may still lose oxygen even when your head's above water. For obvious reasons don't swim too much in a match.Weapons &amp ArmourThe weapons are in a weird place at this current time. On paper two of the game's shotguns are the least powerful weapons in the game. I'm not sure about you but you'd have less chance of survival after a point blank shot in the chest from a shotgun shell than a pistol bullet. One of these weak shotgun's is the S12K and I guess PUBG decided to make it weak because it's an automatic shotgun. You can only imagine how powerful an automatic shotgun would be if the damage count was increased. Speaking of shotguns all of them are terrible to use and take considerable amounts of luck and skill (yes luck) to use. The only one worth having is the S1897 because the rest are either too weak or require decent accuracy before having to wait around to reload. The pistols aren't worth using unless you really can't find anything else to use. They're incredibly weak and rightfully so. The SMGs can be used as a close range substitute for a shotgun. If a whole clip lands on another player chances are they're dead. An assault rifle is perfect for mid long range as their firing modes can be toggled. The snipers of course require absolute precision and skill. Perhaps save them for when you have more experience and time played in the game. Overall the weapons aren't too bad with the exception of shotguns being unreliable more often than you think. Half the weapon attachments are useless only go for the sights/scopes suppressors and magazines.The armour and equipment in game is sorted by levels. All your clothes come with a capacity amount so it's necessary to keep your clothes on. It's also a bonus if you've won a jacket from a crate drop as it allows you to carry more items. A little naughty of PUBG to have a cosmetic item provide a capacity advantage over newcomers. Back to the equipment levelling system the backpack vests and helmets all range from 1 3. To be honest I've been in too many fights where I felt like having armour on made no difference.The looting system in game has improved. Most of the time when I've looted an area I'm kitted out with the necessary gear.MapsErangel is a forest map that's based in Russia. It's a map that has plenty of opportunities to hide and take cover. If you're in the middle of nowhere and you're being fired upon chances are there's a tree next to you that you can hide behind. If you wanna hide from someone and you're in an open field of grass prone. Surprisingly it works far too often. You also have plenty of towns to loot from as well as a whole prison island to hunt other players on.Miramar is a desert map based in Central America. It's a lot more open than Erangel but there are more towns and villages for you to loot in. Early complaints about how open the map was made PUBG add more buildings and places of interest to loot from.Sanhok is a jungle themed map set in Southeast Asia. It's half the size of the other two maps which makes for fast paced battle royale. It's something that's necessary to cater for the market with Fortnite dominating. It feels like Erangel but shrunk down it's an excellent map with tons of looting opportunities and great areas to fight other players.Out of the three maps Sanhok is my personal favourite. Unfortunately PUBG has removed map selection with the release of Sanhok and you'll have to select regular battle royale maps (Erangel/Miramar) or mini royale (Sanhok). I personally prefer map selection because who doesn't wanna play on a map of your choice?GamemodesYou have the options of solo duos squads and x man squads (x number of people in your squad). You also have the option to select whether to play in third person or first person. Third person allows 360 degree camera rotation and wall peeking. First person only allows 180 degree camera rotation and is challenging because it doesn't allow wall peeking so you need to be more aware of your surroundings. PUBG have also introduced limited time modes which are usually featured on the weekends only. These LTMs have variables such as a particular map squad amount weapons to use and player perspective. They're quite fun but it'd be better if PUBG allowed more time for these modes.Levelling SystemPUBG introduced a leveling system and revamped how you can receive rewards in the Sanhok update. As a casual player it's extremely difficult to level up daily. You have 3 daily missions you can do to try get more experience but they don't provide enough experience in my opinion. The leveling system heavily relies on paying for the Event Pass. There are way more opportunities to earn experience and rewards by paying extra money for a game you've paid for which isn't exactly polished. It's a bad move by PUBG who are a multi million dollar company already from game sales alone because it makes Fortnite a more viable option for the consumer. I really do like the idea of missions because that's something I liked about Fortnite. It allows me to try new things and makes games more challenging.SummaryI only recommend this because there's no better realistic battle royale that requires thorough strategy. While it's a game that still feels like it's in early access PUBG is definitely doing their best to listen to their playerbase and honestly their only direction from here is up.

review: This is hands down one of the most addictive games I've ever played. Although the game lags in my Laptop even in the "Very Low" setting I didn't stop playing this game. I overclocked my CPU &amp GPU to play this game a little bit faster. The concept of this game is amazing and there is something about this game that keeps a player play again and again and again until you get that win that you wanted. It's definitely a must buy game for anyone who wants/likes to play Battle Royale type games. Even if you do not know the concept of the game I definitely think that anyone who plays this at least 5 times would be hooked onto the game. Heck no you just need to play this game 3 times and you'll be hooked.I would give 5/5 for the Game Developers who developed this game but I would still like to see it get optimized for low end PCs/Laptops so that we the people who have potato rigs can get that extra FPS boost and thereby we can also play the game smoothly.

review: WOW. This game really is difficult and truly challenging I haven't really played that much but I haven't come across any cheaters just obnoxious voice chat users. If you want an immersive unspoken rule filled game then this is for you it really is great to not play for a few days hop back on and parachute down (probably die) and just play a for a little while. Playing with friends is even better something i haven't done much though but it is really great to work with a team and mess around. 8.9 out of ten. The game takes time to pick up but you never forget your basic knowldege e.g opening doors how to use scopes what guns are the best and how to use them. There is also a lot of stuff that i just learned (that you can go into first person while playing in third person how to lean and even how to zoom in scope. Watching YouTubers play the game also improves your play so I would advise watching JackFrags or Pewdiepie or something. Overall this game is great for a challenge so I would advise buying it.

review: I have seriously had enough of the is game. Its like most of the people I m trying to kill are either invincible or when watching the death cam it like I m not even shooting in their direction. Seriously I can t even get a single hit on most people. I have tried and tried and tried. WTF is is going on!!! The only way I can kill is by hiding and getting an extremely close up stealth kill e.g. by waiting for a long time behind a door and killing from within the same room from behind giving me 1 to 3 seconds head start shooting on the enemy. Even then many still have time to see where the shots are coming from turn around return fire and cause me serious damage. I wait for several minutes to line up the shot shoot them from near zero range and still they do not drop!!!!!!!!WTF IS GOING ON WITH THIS GAME!!!!!! Im fine playing other games and am "average" but when i cant get a single kill from zero range shooting people in the back and others can kill me with one shot to the head from half a k away while im driving in a vehcile I have serious concerns. Am i missing something because my enjoyment of this game is being seriously ruined. I sent a message to steam about the game several weeks ago and still no reply.

review: This game is amazing. Does it have its share of issues? For sure but no other game on the market gives you the gameplay fun and excitement of PUBG. Give it a shot! Don't complain about the Battle Pass you don't have to buy it. You're going to desync and lose a match or two it's a game with 100 people from around the world sharing a map and hunting one another that's some amazing future Most importantly though give constructive criticism to the devs and help them help you make the best game possible. I've gamed for years and have never met something like this. It's addicting in the best way and you'll want to play it every day glitches bugs desync skin drama intense fire fights hot dropping amazing kills and more wtf moments than you could imagine!

review: Honestly this game is a great idea....but ruined by a massive hacking community. ESP and aimhacks abound by the thousands (millions according to BattleEye) making for an unfair and unfun experience. I've been here for over 300 hours so understand that I love this game and want it to be good but you can't do it this way. Well actually you can and here's the disappointing part Hackers are only banned by user account so they just re buy the game when they get banned. When they do this BlueHole banks another copy of the game removing their incentive to stop the hacking. With 1.5 million hackers banned by BattleEye (nowhere near the actual total that use Windows 7 and go around BattleEye) Bluehole is making millions allowing them to ruin the product. When they region lock this game and when they get the hacks under control it will be a good game. Until then don't give them your money.***UPDATEHacking is still rampant and server performance has somehow gotten steadily worse. Desync and disconnects run rampant and the game just isn't fun anymore but hey they released a HUGE PILE of pay for cosmetics that function flawlessly...not questionable at all. I recommend staying away.

review: Dear reader at first as I'm writting this review i currently have played the game for around 16 hours. Overall I do recommend the game to anyone who enjoys battle royale styled games. There are many positive but also some negative points to it which I will come back to later.General The game is one of the if not the most most played games on Steam in the end of 2017 and that is in my opinion well deserved. The graphics are very neat to look at but for a price if your PC isn't at least somewhere around the highend class you'll probably not going to see much from those. The optimisation is indeed terrible. From crashes to horrible lags and even bluescreens. If you do have a nice PC you may very well play on Ultra Settings at around 90 100 FPS. (I'd recommend playing on medium Players are better visible and make easier of a target.) The sounds are well made and do help alot with orientation. (Supressors finally make sense to use &lt 3 but more to that later.)Weapons First things first every weapon has its place in the game and is useful in certain situations. None of the weapons are useless and none (as far as I can tell) overpowered. There is plenty of customization oppertunities which all are atachable to a certain gun. The good ones are rarer than the others. (obvoiusly) But still none of them give you an unfair advantage. There mostly fair distributed.Gameplay The gameplay is impovable. There is rubberbanding all over the place. Even if it's just in the beginning phase it's very annoing and can lead to certain unfair deaths. Lags and Crashes are definetly part of the game. But thankfully you may reconnect after a crash but still needs to be fixed. Glitches with fullscreen bugs that make you do stuff you don't want to etc. Fall Damageglitches. They are so annoying. You can manage to die from sliding down a little ledge or a little hill just because your feet somehow don't touch the ground by walking of them... Please fix!But there is also positive things about it! Bulletdrop and velocity is something that I personally really enjoy and it works. Many sights are ajustable on different ranges. Great Hitboxes as far as I can tell. Fair distribiuted goods all over the map.As a conclusion I give PUBG a solid 7.5/10.

If you believe in game statistics the best players here do not do heroes at all the kill / death indicator on the top lines of the rating ranges from 1 to 4. As Green himself says PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a game primarily tactical. Here you are not a shooter.

review: This game is 100% Worth its price tag the amount of laughs you will have with friends and the amount of anger at the same time yet keep going back and playing another round... LMAO ill give some early access pros and cons!Pros!________________________Great Fun!Solo/Duo/Squad Play with friends its easy and lots of laughsIn my opinion the servers arent as laggy as people say they are if your ping is rather well in other gameMany guns! attachments! and Cosmetics!NO PAY TO WIN ANYTHING ITS ALL SKILLBasically keep playing and get better to get more Credits to have cooler starting cosmeticsYou will get better its not a someone is a god and i cant get a killVery great Graphic changing qualityEasy control customizations and much morewill have you laughing histaricly for no REASON what so everOverall if you can get over the fact that its still early access and there will be bugs here and there and yes it is possible to get kills so stop complaing everyone in the damn reviews. You will like this game and if you have a decent computer (Not the best) but somthing that can run games.Cons______________________________________________Poorly Optimized (THIS WILL CHANGE) its still in early access Devs cant just REVAMP the game in like a week or two its much more difficult than that but it is coming Server are a bit buggy in the lobby but the game is rather good i dont experience any rubber banding.Now hit reg ehhh somtimes it feels a bit wonky but i land basically everything normally without problemsLow spec pc's will have a tough time on this one but if you can get to 25 30 fps you should do just fineDevs are working hard on this game and im really looking forward to this games full release! again 100% worth the price tag would def reccomend to all of my friends!MY SPECS (if your wondering and read this far) Intel Core 15 6600 3.30 ghz 16 gigs of ram and a NVIDEA GTX 960I get 40 50 frames Medium to High Settings P XD

review: There's four people left. Your heart is pounding your hands trembling. You've never made it this far.Your partner died in a fierce firefight on the outskirts of Po i. You're on your own now. The circle is closing again. This time you have to leave your cover. 10 seconds now. You chug your last red bull check your magazine and know you have to move. You know where one player is but not the other two. It's time. You sprint for the nearest cover a rock in the center of the clearing. Immediately shots crack by your head. You see a player to the north peeking from a tree firing round after round trying desperately to end your quest for the elusive chicken dinner. You make it to the rock as a firefight erupts and a squad ends the life of your would be assailant. It's 2v1 now. The squad instantly switches to you and one player lays down fire while the other flanks your left. You see it coming. Leading your shots as you've learned you strike first and send him to the ground knocked out. This is it. The final two. You're sweating nervous. You tell yourself to focus. He moves first to a tree just 50 yards in front of you. You dash for the tree to your left so he can't get an angle on you. He peeks but you're ready. You take some serious damage but four of your well placed M16 rounds seal the deal. A wave of relief washes over. You stare at the winner screen with pride as your dead partner cheers for you over voice comms. You collect your points and retire to the menu. As you stare at the menu and finish coming down from the victory rush you know there's only one thing left to do. You and your friend hit the ready button and prepare for another epic entry into the fray of PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS. Quick review time! Pros A unique experience every match Gunplay feels great on par with Battlefield and similar games Fast paced quick to get into a match Vehicles aren't OP or necessary to win a match Cover works great and foliage is actually useful More fun (and more difficult) with friends Weekly developer updatesCons Optimization (Runs significantly better on Intel chips) Server lag issues sometimes making it nearly unplayable (Rubber banding dsyncing crashing) No rejoin option if your game does happen to crash Cheaters (I personally have only had a few "fishy" incidents but it does seem like a lot of people out there are affected by cheating.) While there is a ways to go on the optimization this game is remarkably well put together for an early access title. It's an absolute blast. Hopefully the hype train doesn't slow down for a while on this one and we see it turned into a finished well polished product that isn't a complete cash grab with neon pink and purple M16 skins and terrible mechanics. Jump on the hype train while it's here it's worth the $30 price of admission.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Instead of fixing some game breaking bugs and the massive server issues the devs have decided that adding paid loot crates was the best step to try and get even more money out of players!I can finish about every other game before a server drops everybody or until a bug randomly leads to my death. If the bugs were fixed and the servers stable this would be the best game out there by far but right now it's still another piece of early access (poorly made) game.

review: The core gameplay of this game is really fun. I'd like to be able to spend more time playing it but alas my damn kids calls for attention during daylight.However I cannot recommend this game just yet. Yesterday I played 5 squad matches where 2 of them were ruined by bugs. One game all of the building geometry vanished and in the other everyone just got disconnected. I wish this was infrequent events but unfortunatly they aren't. Don't buy this it's far from finished.Personally I'd like a more stable game before new features are added. And when they rolled out the first person update the game was just so broken it was unbelivable.

review: Settle down for the story of my first 4 games of pubg.Game 1. I find myself increadibly excited for my first game after seeing others play it and after i complete the character customization i hop onto a solo eu server (i am the UK). As i wait in the loading screen i can hear many foot steps and i understand this to be the game's lobby. i see this as a sign that the loading is almost complete as what happens for similar games such as rust. after a minuite of this i hear the plane but i am still veiwing the (responding) loading screen. i think by now you can guess what happens. i get the audio of falling of landing of a single pair of foot steps and finally being punched to death. all while veiwing the loading screen. eventually as if to rub it in i get the visual of the "better luck next time" screen and i am prompted to return to the main menu.ok im going to cut the now games 3 and 4 went the exact same way exept i ran it in roblox quality and in game 3 i managed to punch my attacker back through the loading screen and gained a score of 5 for hitting someone. ifound that hilarious for about 10 seconds. game 2 just crashed.conclusion is this game a ing joke?? and before you ask my specs they are decent enough and i shouldnt need to spend hundreds of pounds on some t to play a game that is overpriced in the first place.

review: Dang there is so much to say about this game right now. I can say that this game is fun but its so bland to just say that. I have like 3 reasons (I have more but I don't want to keep rambling).1. The game is so much fun to have friends because if your friends get winner chicken dinner you and your friends have the feeling that you are the best in this game and that will make you to play this game even more which this would lead to the second reason.2. How fun the learning experiences you're having when playing this game. One of the reason I liike this game is that it is a learning experience. For example learing the map so that you will know where to loot is and where people would go so that when you play you will know where you can land and you can have an idea what loot is. The weapons are also a learning experience also because you need to know that some weapons are better close range and some weapons are better for long range. With that in mind leads to the third reason which is the gameplay.3. The gameplay. I love the gameplay. Its like the hunger games and the controls to this game are easy and eaiser to learn than H1Z1. What pubg has that H1Z1 does not have it the the weapons shooting is more consitent than H1Z1. The shooting in pubg is more consitent what I mean is that you will know when you hit the person. While in H1Z1 its very inconsisent because your shots will shot places that you did not even shoot at and that makes people made when playing this becasue shooting in this game does not make sense at all. Overall. i would recommend this game to everyone that loves something similar to the hunger games and that the gameplay is better and not only that is just going to get better because its still in early access so they're improvements that can be made to this game. 9/10 rating
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game has taken me into a realm I wasn't sure existed. The developers have hit every note on the head at least for me when it comes to certain variables I look for when enjoying a game.Cons (personally i like bad news first so here ya go) server stability***this is already being addressed by the devs and is the target of the next big patch for june and they have constantly communicated and delivered accordingly*** some people have issues with fps***again this is something being addressed because of optimization the game is still early access currently on the community discussion you can see several posts how to help with said issues until patched*** super small con currency accumulation (the currency so far is used for loot crates that have an increasing cost capped at a certain point or appearance change. GRANTED the cosmetics gotten from said loot crates are strictly that cosmetic. usually I'll pick up a coat I fancy in match regardless but you get near no currency unless you place in the top 5 which at least with the current values it seems a bit steep.(but seriously the only 2 REAL things I have issues with are already being worked on as we speak)Pros multiplayer (play with some friends/randoms and make friends friendly community if you can handle how much you will be laughing pregame as someone with a mic TURNS ON "HOW ITS MADE HOT DOGS" or blasts music like Shooting Stars its so amazing) survival (this game is frequently an anxiety simulator with intense glory &amp rage DLC) comedy (when going full speed in any vehicle while in squad tell your team to press F whoever actually does is a noob and you never let them live it down) "one more match?" (you will say it over and over as the hours accumulate to yourself and friends as you try to get that top spot Mods (devs have openly said and it makes sense if you know the team behind this game they plan on making the game open to the modding community. I personally have not heard of timeframes but I dont want to rush this perfect product they are working tirelessly on OVERALL SCORE 9/10 graphics are very nice community is solid devs are super active and transparent game has so much on the way its exciting to have a new game that gets me and my friends up and on every day.PRO TIPSONE. JUMP. PUNCH. HEADSHOT.BE. THE. BUSH.

review: Thos game isnt for everyone and you know what? Thats perfectly fine. When i first hopped into it i didnt fully enjoy it but now im starting to love it more and more. Now i dont play it hours on end instead i play three rounds then thats it nothing more nothing less. The game is balanced since everyone starts with nothing but in the ens the entire game is based around luck and thats what makes it so interesting. If you dont see how people can enjoy this game thats perfectly fine but if you at the least no someone who owns it and is willing to let you try it out even for a round or two give it a go and decide yourself if you want to truely play it.Also yes the community is VERY toxic at the moment which is one of the things that would turn off allot of people from this game. If you do decide to get it juat remember you can turn off in game chat which personally makes the game easier to enjoy.

review: The hit reg has got to be some of the worst you will ever see in a game. Run around a corner shoot go back around the corner start reloading then you die from the guy that shot behind you 2 seconds ago. You genuinely dont need any form of aim in this game. Just shoot in the general direction and you will probably hit. Hackers are everywhere. There is no point trying to play to the end game as you will get taken out by a guy following you from miles away through walls/hills. If I ever complained about hackers in CSGO I take it all back. Pubg has 100000x more. Blue Hole are cashing in on the game. Weapon skins instead of fixing well known bugs. Randomly crashing off bikes and dying when on a normal piece of road Hit a building and flying halfway across the map. Getting stuck on the parachute and never being able to land. The game is fun but even after 16 hours I have had enough.

review: Bought this game mainly because it looked like a lot of fun. Turns out it is! Which didnt really surprise me much since so many people seemed to love it. Having no HUD for players around you makes this game a very stressful and intense game but that makes it so much more enjoyable compared to most shooter games. And with it still being in early access there is a lot of room for this game to develop into what i would consider one of the best games of its type out there. buy it. support it. give them your money.

review: At this point in time no. I've logged many hours on this game and have had more frustration than good times. It was ok when the game was early acess and I got hit with random lag dropped frame rate loads of objects appearing out of nowhere and loads of bugs but now we should be seeing improvement not things getting worse. By far the worst thing I have had to deal with is the hackers. I haven't went one night without getting aimbotted or shot through the map. When you're in shelter and people shoot you through the roof with a shotgun from the outside. This game has potential but at this point even if you have a good game your next 10 will probably suck do to hackers and issues. i keep waiting for the fan base to leave and all that's left is the hackers. I know of at least 4 people that have already stopped playing due to that very reason. If they don't fix the big issues soon I see players going to play the next game similar.

review: A great Battle Royale experience.Firstly it must be said that the optimization isn't fantastic and If you aren't running it on a fairly powerful rig you'll have to turn most of the graphical settings down. But the gameplay itself is fun. It can be very unforgiving at first but once you learn the best places to drop and the tactics you need to come out on top you'll have a great time. Gun play is excellent (except when you're too close to a wall and your gun goes haywire). Weapon variety is pretty ok with the devs adding new ones every month though usually these are restricted to crate drops.This is one of few Early Access titles that are genuinely making the most out of the platform constantly updating with significant improvements and bug fixes.

review: I'm going to be honest with this review. Before I bought this game I thought it was stupid I called it a running simulator I called it over rated i said it wasn't worth thity bucks and that it should be free to play instead. However after playing it for a bit of time my views have completely changed. I'm also rather surprised this game has such mixed reviews. My opinion does still stand that the game is slightly over rated but so are all the tiple A titles that come out in the mainstream game market. This game is worth the thirty dollars especially since I have made some of that money back even my brother has actually made a ten dollar profit from selling the in game items. As for the game itself it is extremely fun and doubles triples quadruples in value as you add friends and play in squads. The game mechanics have improved over time graphics have been optomized and with two maps in rotation now the diversity is getting much better. it's very easy to get lost in playing this game and is extremely rewarding to place high in the last standing and especially to win. for those who hate on the game I'd have to say they haven't taken it for what it is a challenge. Yes it's not easy and is slightly wonky but the concept the game mechanics and the direction the game continues to move in is excellent and promissing. I would definetly recommend this game to anyone.

review: I would recommend this game quite frankly I adore it for many reasons. The game is constantly expanding and the games are engaging and fun. Here are my divided advantages to disadvantages Advantages The large variety of weapons and attachments allows the player to choose which weapon to use depending on their preference and what for instance grips they prefer or scopes they prefer on which weapons. The combat and bullet time/drop system is great and is unique to each gun so its not just a copy and paste on each weapon. The maps are brilliant there are 2 currently and a third in development and provide us users with different combat situations (Miramar is the best map because it has the win94). The use of vehicles is amazing and thoroughly enjoy using them/ attacking them. The graphics are simply phenomenal if you have/are getting this game and can run it on max just go first person and look at the detail on the guns its amazing. I've seen plenty of complaints about the FPS i haven't got an issue with them but I'd say make sure your computer is good enough to run it so you won't encounter these problems.Disadvantages Vehicles are buggy. Although I said they are great fun they can be very infuriating when they glitch and break. For instance I recently had a game where my car got stuck on its back and hopped damaging the vehicle eventually killing it and me. I was not impressed. The game can crash. I won't tag on 'often' because its only happened to me 3 times and I've had it for some time but the crashes are undoubtedly there.In conclusion I would definately recommend this game IF you have a good computer to run it on.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: In my opinion 30 euros worth for this game even its in early access
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: As a lot of people here do I got the game under the influence of friends at first I was quite disappointed as well the server's laggy extremely poor optimization people said they encountered hacks and I've been lucky enough not encountering any. However over the time I did see the optimization getting a lot better the servers are getting a lot less laggy while hacks still exist it's not like there are no hacks in other games at all.To respond to my friend who thought at least 8 months back that he could do well in CS but cannot do so in PUBG here's my answer to him as well as to any other person who also has this confusion PUBG is an Army Simulation Battle Royale so everything counts towards how a bullet goes out wind recoil gravity ammo's velocity and speed ballistics etc. It's different from Counter Strike because in CS the ballistics are not affected that much since the entire map is only couple hundred square feet. This is also why games like Battlefield and heck Fortnite doesn't require much of skill from games like Counter Strike.To respond to why PUBG can be bought in Mainland China for so cheap my answer is that you need to know 1. what kind of a market MLC really is and 2. there are rumors that Steam is going to make MLC a seperate region basically like what every other gaming platform did. The second one is certainly not what we who have friends in MLC want to see but it's certainly a better solution to both sides.Overall play fortnite that's how they do it now.

review: This review is written in alpha stage 4 million copies sold. I've just read on forums that there's just 30 35 devs and so they have no time to deal with cheaters. So ... why the heck don't you hire hundred of devs more when we paid you so much money to do the game right? Isn't that what is early access for?The game itself is fun. Or at least it was fun until you realize how many people are cheating. These days you almost have no chance to make it to the end and not meet cheater who will kill you by one headshot from a pretty fast turnaround. You might say it's alpha right? Yes it is but it's multiplayer so it's basically unplayable without cheats. You need to count that like 60 percent of your time in the game will be a total disappointment and just 30 will be the usual one and the rest (about 10 percent) will be the enjoyable game you paid for.So let's forget about that 60 percent made by cheaters there's a chance you meet one early in a game so it won't feel that bad. The 20 percent of usual disappointment is pretty important too. Sure you can play alone but it's not that funny as playing in a group but there's no squad management at all. Basically you get to group with some random guys or worse with a group of friends who are on Skype so they don't communicate with you at all and when they spot you found some good stuff they just kill you and loot you. There's no penalty for teamkill and there's no way how to play in a squad unless you have a bunch of friends to play with (which I actually have so the game is not unplayable for me from time to time when we all have time).So if this is what you are looking for buy the game and enjoy. I must say the 30 euros I paid gave me a lot of fun but I can't play this anymore because it's too frustrating and the devs are concentrating more on twitch stuff and marketing then fixing what makes the game playable.

I still recommend this game because it is truly one of the greatest games I've ever played even with these insane bugs it is still in early access and it is all being smoothed out. Yes there is hackers like in every game to ever exist. Bluehole has more to do besides control the cheaters. Only reason I would not recommend is for the extremely rage inducing bugs like jumping out of a car when it is moving fast and dying or loot not showing up when you can clearly see that they have loot on their body. (Or the fact that you could get banned for "stream sniping" if you happen to kill some crybaby streamer).

review: At first I was trilled by the game the graphics seemed cool my friends were playing the game it seemed like a nice concept 100 players in a map seemed nice but like...the more I played this ..the more I found issues with the game.Mainly I think that theres a lot of issues with lag aim+where's your bullets are actually going and what appear on screen vs what should be seen on screen. As a free game it would be ok I guess but I don't think it's worth the price I paid for the game...anyway...It is just kind of frustrating...like... The 8x scope or even the 4x scope...unless the enemy is not moving much or moving toward you you cant hit with that you like need to aim ahead (cause bullet takes 4ever to reach) and above (cause bullet falls...) the dude...+the lag factor + the fact that the enemy is just moving in different ways + the over exaggerated recoil...it is just kind of lame... The aim system is kind of dumb...you move a bit and you lose like 30% of your aim easy...meaning that if you run to the guy while shooting with a rifle...you miss all your hits...which is annoying... You cant shoot though things...meaning like that you will miss all of you point blank shotgun hits if theres like a book in the corner of your screen or w/e... The non aim and aim is not at the same location (you need to re aim if you zoom). Some vegetation just kind of disappear if you are far enough (in a circle around you)...making people think they are hidden safe in the vegetation...while they are not... You can't use scope while in vegetation... (unless in a hill vegetation is in scope) ...but wait you can aim (with no scope) with...tapping right click...(...just what is the point of having a scope if you can't use it...) People just kind of blink around because of lag...(Very true at the start with 100 players. The lag becomes less heavy as the number of players dwindles.) (...w/e your settings doesn't drop the lag...) Shooting while jumping from a building and landing from that building is probably more accurate than running+shooting. You can't jump/climb...w/e... above stuff half your height...or like need to jump for stuff at your knee level...it is kind of exaggerated... You only see a small number of people parachuting with you (you don't see them all) meaning someone could land near you without you knowing at the start...even if you looked thoughtfully at your surrounding...(you need time to find a gun...so its really kind of annoying). To aim properly theres way too many keys to hit...crouch key + aim key + hold your breath key... and like just aiming longer at a target doesnt really makes you aim better... Shooting at a guy though a wooden lattice stair railing blocks all damage and you cant crouch + shoot though most windows cause you know...moving your gun slightly above the railing and through the window would be too hard for your character so most of the time it just hits the wall beow the window and that blocks all damage... There's a lag rush when landing with you parachute. And so on...

review: Honestly I don't know what Nintendo is doing anymore. This game is about as deep as a grated lump of cheddar cheese. The people behind this game must have had the brain capacity of a Tuna Sweetcorn Sandwich.TL DR Great RPG all around. The graphical performance of the game is terrible the performance of the servers actually decreased as time passed rather than improving and the amount of cheaters has been increasing exponentially. Barely any content was added in the seven months past early access release and now the developers are saying they plan to release version 1.0 and call the game feature complete in roughly 2 months which is obviously not enough time to fix all the problems in the game.

review: EARLY ACCESS REVIEW I get a huge migraine playing this game.Its lack of brightness/gamma sliders and the intense glare from the ground (why is the ground shiny?) gives me a horrible headache/migraine after playing for more than an hour at a time.The game is also very unoptimized. I'm running a decent rig that can run most modern games on ultra yet this game lags when there's an explosion (running it on low). I personally don't like the main menu but it is slick. I know many people who like that sort of thing. In its current state I would say DO NOT get it. When these problems are addressed I definately would suggest getting it.Current state 7/10. 3 points for poor optimization/graphics options.I will return to review the game when it is released. Stay tuned!FULL RELEASE REVIEW They have REALLY improved upon this game. The optimization/graphics doesn't suck anymore (with the exception of network lag which continues to be a problem to this day). PUBG is finally the game it should be and I'm happy they stuck with it. If I'm being honest I was expecting them to take the money and run but that is not the case with this game.I wish there were more modes though. The only mode available is being deployed across one of the two maps and scavenging homes to find weapons. What about a version of the game where you are spawned in with a pistol already in your hand? This makes everyone a threat. Or what about a close quarters game mode where you throw a bunch of people into a building and it's essentially a free for all until one man stands?There are MANY creative directions this game could have gone and they didn't really take advantage of that. I truly hope they do look into improving upon the game in the near future because what they have right now is great albeit repetetive.9/10 An awesome game still plagued by poor network structure and uninspired game modes. I cannot wait for the future of PUBG!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG is probably the most fun and the most frustrating game I've ever played. It is in theory a very easy game get guns shoot people don't get shot. But just like every shooter on the market usually it doesn't work out like that. Even if you are very good at PUBG you are still going to lose. A lot. As far as players of this game I haven't been playing very long but I am yet to win a game. I've gotten close to be sure but I've never gotten the coveted chicken dinner. And yet I still find myself coming back. I've never lost at a game so much and still loved it. As this game gets closer to full release I fully expect it to become better and better.

review: Now I'm going to get started by saying I really like this game. It's fun honestly it is.But it's a massive turnoff to do insanely well get down to the last 10 people and then have someone shoot you in the back. Now don't get me wrong it's PVP so what do I expect right? I just don't really like how unfair the game can be which by all means it really is. You spawn in drop from the plane and go to the nearest house. First thing you'll probably see (In my case) was usually just a P1911 or one of the two shotguns. Your neighbor who dropped into the house across the street finds a Scar L an AKM a Kar98k with x8 scope and three medkits. How am I supposed to deal with that? I don't I die. That aspect of the game just isn't fun. However say you kill said neighbor with your shotgun you'll have a blast. This game is fun if you're good at it like most games are but the problem for me is I'm just not. I'm gonna get shot in the back killed from miles away die to a kid with a machete etc. I'm not good at this so for me it's not fun.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Was almost an enjoyable game. I played it once with a friend that I had bought through my steam wallet. He made fun of me and called me a neck beard. review: This game is riding on the success created by the fact that it was "first" in something. ("realistic" battle royale shooter). Want to be "good" (high on the leaderboards) at this game then expect to camp in a bush in the middle of an open field for 10 15 minutes every game. It really is a camping simulator. Aim duels rarely happen and whoever spots the enemy first will prevail (if he is not terrible at aiming).Sure you can go berserk and land in the popular areas. But for what? For a much worse battlefield/cod fights With a 2 3 minute respawn timer. Game is SO BADLY OPTIMIZED too. I'm still having loads of lags with a 2000 gaming pc.Developers have also shown more interest in creating new badly implemented features rather than fix the existing ones.

review: I would not recommend it. It's a good timewaster and I would say you should consider buying it when it's on sale.The big issue I have with it is the game does a terrible job at explaining to you what's wrong with your games. I got to Level 2 and I was making millions of dollars per game but I hit a roadbump and all my games started to be (less than 6/10). Keep in mind I maxed out my game's development so I wasn't taking shortcuts. The game made 0 effort to tell me what was wrong. I generated game reports which told me that everything I was doing was good matching up the genre/platform/topics/audience etc. etc.I made an effort to switch up into new territory new game ideas I didn't develop and that just made it worse I was getting 3s and 4s. All the reviews are generic "meh" "uninspiring" "not bad not good". For the main focus of the game they should have done a better job at giving feedback.

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS or PUBG is basically comparable to games like H1Z1 King of the kill. It's running on Unreal engine 4 and is running really stable atleast on my PC. It's quite easy to learn and offers a lot of fun and is a game easy to find people to group up with. The game itself offers loads of equipment and features you won't find in other comparable games. After a short downtime of updates the developers started to improve the game again and added some new stuff such as the new map Miramar. I can definetly give this game a positive rating except a few downsides such as the hacker cancer mainly appearing when playing against asians. And no that's not racist just the truth. I would never say that every asian is cheating in this game but enough do it. Still a great game and definetly worth it to buy. Regards

review: It was great at first but replay value isn't too high. It's a lot of fun but very similar to a 'big map counterstrike' almost. Definite performance issues time to time. Been almost a year I think since I got it and only recently was the 2nd map announced and/or released.With over 10 million copies and at least 300 000 000$ they can't make maps any faster?Also the only in game customization is clothes. Of which there's quite a few but they all look similar.(white tshirt vs blue tshirt) And to buy these clothes you open chests. I believe I've received 10 15 duplicate clothes out of 30 35? Oh but you can buy these chests with some in game currency which you have to pay $$ more. There are often times when you enter a match and cannot find a weapon or a bag etc and it really reduces your chances of surviving against anyone. So you basically parachuted in ran around a little while picking crap up off the ground from building to building and then someone shoots you you can't even turn around you die. (hackers make this really annoying and there is a decent amount of them)The above example of a single round game just wasted 20 minutes of your life.Worth 30$? I would say 10.*Edit June 2018It's fun but only 2 maps in a year or more? Every other update is a make it or break it scenario. There's been a couple times where either myself or my gf have to take a week or two break from it as one of our computer configurations just causes random crashes. Since other games play ok we have to default to it being a problem with the update.Still fun they need to make the events permanent and make regular groups groups of 10 instead of 4.
