review: Here's probably the most balanced review of the game so far.Pros 1. The core game is there. There isn't any major flaws to the gameplay or core concepts.2. It's only $30. Yes it is an early access title but with the consistent updates as of now it isn't bad. (On a personal note it's not one of my favorite games but it's still a good game and I will continue to play it.)3. New content is announced monthly*.4. The developer seems to care about the well being of the game.Pros Summary There is no major issues to the game as of now and it's a perfectly fine game by today's standards.Cons 1. There are SOME minor connection issues and lag. HOWEVER do not listen to these people claiming to "have decent internet and I shot him in the head twice". I have 8Mb/s internet not bytes but bits. So I have slow internet. Technically speaking I shouldn't be able to watch 1080p videos on Youtube. BUT THE GAME IS PERFECTLY FINE FOR ME. I have however had a few instances where things shouldn't have happened (example getting shot while it appeared I was behind a wall or shots not registering) but it is debatable as to whether or not it was the server or my internet. Otherwise there's no lag with opening doors getting into vehicles or picking up items as other have stated on other reviews.2. Only one map. While the map is large it feels very empty. Two new maps have been announced but it sounds like they won't be released until the game is officially released.3. Poor optimization. My computer is close to high end. Not really but I can run ARMA3 on ultra graphics with a fairly stable 40fps. PUBG on medium low graphics also grants me 40fps.4. THE ING COMMUNITY. Everyone is a whiny little snot bag who can't read. The current fiasco as of writing this is about the new crates for unlocking COSMETIC items. Of the three new crates one requires you to purchase a key for $2.50USD in addition to spending in game BP (Battle Points) to buy the crate. Now the complaint people have right now about this is the developer PLAYERUNKNOWN said that no microtransactions with be in the game until the full release. So these whiny little snot bags I mentioned yea... they didn't read the developer's clearly written out statement about the new crates. PLAYERUNKNOWN said "Proceeds from the sale of the keys to open the Gamescom Invitational Crate will be used to provide funds needed to organize the event to provide a prize pool for the invitational winners to support a selection of charities."Apparently no one ing read that part and assumed the "godsend game developer" turned rogue all of a sudden for a ing cash grab. I choose to believe that they are staying true to this statement and honestly they could take a little bit of the money and I'd be okay with that too. Remember they are simply COSMETIC items. That and everyone seems to care about their "rank" which will guaranteed be wiped at the full release as it is already wiped every month. Whiny snot bags. (I only used this phrase because I didn't want my bleeped out) Sidenote to the crate stuff I feel people have way to much BP as of now so instead of wiping the BP at release I think it was a good call to introduce more crates to get people to spend some of it. Give them something to earn and unlock. Instead of useless rank. Cons Summary It's an early access game with the expected amount of bugs and glitches and server issues like every other game out there. But because people don't understand game development they assume that "since they sold like 4 million copies they should have enough money to fix everything". The community isn't nearly as trash as MOBA's are but it's not far off. Also the developer needs to grow a pair and not apologize for this crate fiasco. He did nothing wrong.General Summary It's a good game. Try it or watch stuff on youtube or twitch. If you're interested definitely get it.*Not entirely sure on the monthly thing. My friends made it sound monthly I just don't follow it that much.

review: PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds (PUBG) is a multiplayer online battle royale game developed and published by PUBG Corporation a subsidiary of Korean publisher Bluehole. The game is based on previous mods that were developed by Brendan "PlayerUnknown" Greene for other games using the 2000 film Battle Royale for inspiration and expanded into a standalone game under Greene's creative direction. In the game up to one hundred players parachute onto an island and scavenge for weapons and equipment to kill others while avoiding getting killed themselves. The available safe area of the game's map decreases in size over time directing surviving players into tighter areas to force encounters. The last player or team standing wins the round.

review: H1Z1!? Whats that game?! This is the game to play if you're into the whole battle royale scene! First off i would like to point out that yes this is an early access game there will be some problems with it. Its not finished by all means. But it does have a promising start. I am running on a low med end rig (Gigabyte GA 970A DS3P Motherboard AMDFX 8320 x8 core processor 3.5ghz Radeon HIS R9 280 IceQ OC 3GB GDDR5 Ram 12ghz). It runs very well with my settings at med to high. I am getting around 45 60 fps. here are some Pros and cons i feel thus far. Pros Can create your own character off the startLots of weapons to chose from all fully customizable with parts you find.Armor/backpacks are all over (find the lvl 2 + lvl 3s fast lol)Driving into someone with a vehicle actually kills them. You earn game points to spend on crates for cosmetics (instead of having to buy the currency)Its actually anjoyable being stealthy in this game. it can pay off if you find a supressor for a good rifle. There are alot more to go over i can't list them all. This game is worth it just trust me. Cons Game still needs some preformance tuning but will work on most rigs. Minor server lag issuesMust rebind some crutial keys. You can get hit with your own vehicle trying to get out. (WARNING...come to a complete stop)landing with your parachute can be a painOther than the very few cons i have i would recomend this game to anyone that asks. for me i would give it a 7.5/10 Yes this game is fun! Yes it has its flaws! BUT I will not be playing H1Z1 anylonger. This game will now be my number 1 battle royale game. Well worth the $30.00!

review: After 830+ hours (not counting time on the test server) I can fairly say this game is great. It is hands down the best battle royal game availble at this time. It's very sad to see this game's reviews go from positive to mixed. People complain about bugs but I rarely have large issues. Maybe an occasional small weird thing will happen but nothing that has ever made the game unplayable. No matter how many copies this game has sold It is still made by an indie studio. And at the end of the day its probably one of the most impressive games to come out of an idie studio. As for optimization I realize this game isnt the most optimized game on steam. As a programmer myself I can say optimization is extremly difficult. People think they arent working to improve it but they are constanly working to improve it and showing results with every release. (trust me Ive been playing since launch. It used to run like ) it runs 100% fine on my mid range gaming PC. If you're trying to run this on your 2010 business laptop you're going to have a bad time. I'm sorry but that's just how life is going to be and there's no amount of money that'll make that possible. Game budgets aren't everything. The game will continue to improve as time goes on. The devs DO care about the game and are constanly bringing new content in even ahead of schedule. They even listen to the fans and are doing things they didnt plan to do like adding a map selection option. (even I'll admit the desert map isnt that great.) I think the new smaller map thats coming soon will be extremely nice but I guess we'll have to see. My only complant about this game is that my social life has gone down the because all i do is work and play PUBG.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Great job developers and business peoples!Edited comment this game continues to astound me. I now run it maxed out and no issues experienced. Still no hackers experienced and I reviewed a lot of kill cam footage...just awesome players pwning me!Again now with a solid base of hours I can say my review stands as a solid game and something every FPS gamer should own and play. Finally the developers are running a FixPUBG campaign now and it is brilliantly transparent as well as organized based on user base communication. Everything about this game continues to be SOLID!

review: I tried so many times to like this game because friends of mine play it.Wait for the game to open... Game is open wait in queue to find a match match is found... Wait in game lobby while everyone mic spams obscenities and other nonsense and shoots everyone...Wait for the plane to reach the island as players shout last minute curse words and parachute down to the ground below. Attempting to find the right combination of graphics options that don't either result in weird shading or some other distracting visual artifact is near impossible and even when you finally nail it the game still looks sub par given the budget they have to work with from their more than successful early access campaign.This game inspired an annoying trend of "battle royale" type games and though it has produced a couple gems it's a genre I can't wait to see bite the bullet itself.Granted I'm not all that great at the game with only 7 hours behind the scope but still... I don't want to spend any more time forcing myself to play this.Lets imagine the following scenario..."I play video games." someone tells me."What do you play?" I respond."PUBG Call of du..." they begin to say.Then I cut them off with "Ah okay bye."

review: I'd love to recommend this game...because with friends it is quite fun. There are glaring CONS though... PROS Excellent Co op game many games you can play with friends requires you to 'compete' with your own teammates or rage at each other for simple human error...this game is more fun the more you stick together. Beautiful 'concept' the idea of the game is great and with some major server bugs and region fixes.... it could be 100x better. CONS Lag for gameplay 100% reliant on latency (shot placement) this is a game breaking flaw. RNG unless you have multiple monitors and do some hardcore homework/studying about spawn rates/locations... the chances of having better gear than the final 10 20 people is 1 out of (# of players in the game). That being said I have won solo games with literally 0 shots fired. It is frustrating to get 'winning' gear (ie. lvl2+ helm armor pack scar sks consumables) but simultaneously find 0 attachments (or ammo) for your weapons (get good with ironsights). BUGS OMFG THE BUGS where do I start.....? Everything from the very start of the game (parachuting/landing) til the very end (hitboxes/lag) and some wild in between (the comedy of driving)....this game is in worse shape than many early access games...yet they want full price for a "FINISHED PRODUCT" (if you've played at all this idea is laughable).**OVERALL** Wait for like an 80%+ discount AND make sure to have 3 reliable friends to play with. Solo IS fun for a bit but that fun dwindles incredibly fast. ....or just play Fortnite.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG is a thrilling battle royale game where it's kill or be killed including your teammates.Many chinese players in this game unless you're chinese you're gonna have a hard time playing in squads and most of my games end up with me being killed by my teammates in squad better off playing with friends.The gameplay itself is great though you go around looking for weapons and kill everyone in your sights the maps are great and the weapons are well balanced overall it's an OK game.7/10Also Many teamkillers BTW look at my screenshots.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Quite possibly the worst team and communications behind a game I ve EVER seen. BlueHole and their mascot PlayerUnknown have apparently acquired business degrees as LegoLand. $35 game with loot boxes similar to CSGO in the level of scummy borderline criminal percentages of getting good loot. Now they re adding a BattlePass oh no wait Event Pass. Which is a great idea! No idea why it is a paid DLC and not part of the game we paid decent money for but hey whatever to squeeze the teet of the consumer out of more money I guess.This game popularised the Battle Royale genre in modern gaming but that doesn t give them the ability to stop caring about their community no matter the size. They consistently neglect their product in favour of trying to monopolise the market. It s a gaming version of the Fine Brothers taking a claim and owning React . PUBG needs to stop riding their own crotch and puffing their chest out thinking they ve made it to the top. Attacking other companies for copying such as their lawsuit with Epic Games is laughable and shallow. Games came before this games will come after. Pubg just captured people s interest which is it slowly loosing with poor decisions.If any developer reads this play some Fortnite and chill out babe then start making unique things AND fix what s currently horrifically broken in your game xx.Minecraft hunger games did it first don t me
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Welcome to PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS! Or as I like to call it Loot and Die Simulator 2017! Seriously that's all you will do in this game. You spend 20 minutes looting the crap out of buildings MAYBE you encounter one or two enemies who you are able to overcome but as soon as the circle closes in you realise that you will not be surviving. This may not be because of your skill maybe you have played shooters before. No you won't survive because this game is OPTIMIZATION HELL.You want 60 fps? Too bad even when you set everything on lowest quality you still only get 40 50 except for when you use a 1080/1080ti and a new ryzen or i7 or whatever. Then you can MAYBE play the game on higher settings maybe even highest. Too bad that you will still have frame drops everytime you shoot and 9 out of 10 battles are decided by who had less technical problems. But that's all okay isn't it? PLAYERUNKOWN and Bluehole are working on the game right? YES! THEY ARE! So don't worry. The game will become better with new updates which are released weekly. WRONG! They apparently don't have motivation to work on important parts of the game anymore with all the money they now have. But here is something for you Loot Crates! Everyone loves Loot Crates right? Especially if you have to pay to open them and get that sweet sweet gamble. Will I get a 20 dollar jacket or a 10 cent hat? I don't know! What a fun experience!And when they are adding a patch that has nothing to do with loot crates? Yeah they implement the most important stuff. Your game runs on 30 fps because you can't afford a new 2000 dollar PC? No problem we got you fam! Here have this new vault animation! That's not enough? Okay here have this new foggy weather! We do stuff for the players!Don't buy this s h i t t y game before they try to fix anything optimization wise. Luckily I got my 30 dollars back through the crates I opened (hey just because I'm blaming them for implementing something like that doesn't mean I won't use it) and now this game will sit in my library until the game is a) improved quite a bit or b) I become desperate in what I want to play.

review: First Half of review August 2017Well Playerunknown must not know a lick about computer parts. I have a GTX 950 and Ryzen 5 1600 (well above the minimum requirements) and i run a solid 20 fps max on low settings. Even on high settings the textures look like garbage (however this may just be my pc). I am planning to buy H1Z1 king of the kill because on paper i would love to play this game.Second Half of review Feburary 2018After 6 months i was convinced to buy this game and whilest i was hesistant due to my previous experience i gave it another shot. And im glad I did. Thee optimization is some much better than 6 months ago i now get 60 fps solid on low settings in 1080p textures load in and dont look like clay. Only issue i have is that i wish the servers were a bit better but overall im changing my review to a reccomendation. (Oh and i tried H1z1 and it didnt serve as a replacement)

review: 挺好的游戏 现在整治外挂也有了明显有效的办法 办法虽然很蠢 但是真的有用 游戏机制也比较新颖好玩 地图就像以前玩LOL一样 虽然地图不多 但是总是特别的耐玩 最近的更新出了更多的高倍镜和新的跑车 让大家都能在战斗的时候能有高倍镜使用 可以说是相当的有趣好玩了 最后再来说说这次更新最不让我满意的点吧 5.56的枪基本上是全体大削弱 你要彰显7.62的好用 你加强他就是了 为什么要削弱5.56 照你这么玩的话 我M4费劲收集了那么多的配件 结果还不如只有一个枪头的AK AK是出了名的伤害高 后坐力巨大 那我5.56的系列枪支呢 后坐力改得和AK差不多 伤害却差了那么多 要真说M4还比AK优秀的点 那么就是射速快了吧 呵呵 你说你要彰显更多配件的玩法 在不同的地方使用不同的配件 这点我支持 但是为什么要让狙击枪也可以使用步枪的配件 总的来说 从去年开始 哪怕一直被外挂伤害 我也一直喜欢玩这个游戏 但是这次的枪支改动 让我失望 让我开始厌恶这款游戏的居然不是外挂 而是游戏本身

review: This is like the game itself an "early access" review. Outside of the ever present issues associated with meteoric growth and it being early access and being in BETA PubG is exactly what you see. Over 10 million people have jumped in with more than 2.2 million concurrent users this weekend (Oct'17) so it is obvious this game is a juggernaut.This game concept is in it's umpteeth revision by it's creator but this time this time! he made all the calls and started from the ground up to recreate the ultimate Battle Royal experience. The game play is fast intense challenging and offers opportunites for all levels of playstyles from a Leroy Jenkins to the slithering sneaky snake in the grass. Weapon selection is likewise vast and distributed is a unpredictable pattern over a player map that also varies in terrain. Solo's Duo's and 4 man squads compete agianst the same on an island chain where the play are shrinks continuously as the game progresses forcing remaing players into an ever smaller play area. The tension becomes thick and heart rates soar.You win? you Lose? You start over. Every time. Every time you jump from the plane that carries you to the island you are an equal. You have just as much chance of getting all the good gear as anyone else ( learning curve excluded because yeah it takes a while to get good at looting so there is a grind but not like a traditional grind). You also are initially able to go where ever you feel you can on the vast play field. Most games present a grind of hours and weeks to "get the good stuff" in PubG eventhe first time player can gather all the best gear in the game which the expert player will then thank them for after they kill them.Final words for now..... for goodness sake people lower your ecpectations about BETA and Early Access games. They will be buggy and problematic. It just is. Despite the rapid expansion and barrels of cash PubG has brought in that doesn't turn into a room full of programmers overnight or even in months. If the issues facing these EA games are apt to infuriate you I highly reccomend that you wait until the game is completed and ready for the market. However I suspect you are like one of the 10+ millions who have jumped and so will you eh? So just roll with it have fun... you will die most of the time. Chicken dinners are rare. I do reccomend but with that EA caution.( oh yeah one more thought... the one thing that will kill this game is the cheating... as said we're still BEAT but situation has gotten out of hand. The industry as a whole needs to figure out how to exclude the avenues used to create these exploits.)
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PLEASE READ EDIT BELOW AFTER READING THIS REVEIW THANKSOverall the game scores well in most areas. Lacks a little in graphics/FOD loading but its early access.I must admit i went into this game unsure to what to expect. First game after setting up graphics/controls etc. I was loaded in with 99 other players and dropped in by paracute with many mic'd players shouting and being childish but im sure you can mute them through options but gives more satifaction putting a bullet through their head when you get the chance. So decending down i opened my chute landed and went to the ground like a bat out of hell looting grabbed a pistol as another player ran into the same house after a fast load of the magazine the player dropped and here comes the adrenaline rush. And that's me hooked. Also 3rd game got me 2nd place which was very pleasing.Killing a player is satisfying and gun mechanics are really good for early access. Every weapon ive used has a good balance of rate of fire and bullet placement/handling due to the weapon your carrying. Looting is good also im sure this will become better over time. Only downfall i really dont like is the map shinks way to quick and would like it to be least double the amount of time or at least be able to choose a server that has different time locks for area depletion. As I'm a player that like's exploration before being forced to a choke point to fight. So to wrap up if you like open world 3rd/1st person shooters like Dayz or H1Z1 you'll like Player Unknown. Its loads faster than Dayz and better in PVP by far. Also the updates seem to be coming thick and fast from what I've seen and what I've read. I can see this game becoming big for 2017 and beyond.*******EDIT********There is a growing amount of AIMBOTTING already taking place and is destroying the gameplay. People are auto killing you with pistols over 100's of metres away with headshots. They also can track your location and shot you through walls. Ive found since playing its a 50/50 chance of dieing from an AIMBOTTER in a match. Its really tainting the game and this will sink fast as a game unless sorted by the devs

review: Lets be honest besides the things they still need to fix the devs did an awesome job so far.Sometimes in bad language sometimes fair and explainable.Devs made the good and realisable things come true (even it was "just" making Bullet Loops for the Win94)They work against cheaters had banwaves coming in always giving statements to the current situation.Giving everyone the chance to play on Testserver in every region is great. When i think of lol its just for invited players. Also u have to play on NA servers there with high ping (for me an EU Player)Besides the GC Crate they never tried to make skin money out of the game in EA.Always tried to fix reported Bugs asap even tho some of the reported bugs didnt get fixed yet it seems like they are doing their best.People complaining about Devs giving us new weapons but dont fix server lags should start to accept that there are different kind of groups of devs. Designer for Weapons are not the one fixing server problems.All in all u could say they made a very promising game coming out of EA into 1.0. Yet there are some things the need to fix but i have to admit id rather play PUBG (in EA and current 1.0) than playing a fully released game i need to buy DLCs all the time to get all the stuff i need. Id rather play PUBG than a game fully released for 40 60 bucks with a little less amount of bugs.They made IMO the best Battle Royal game ive played so far and i dont see anything coming to stop me from playing soon. I hope this game makes it through the next years giving me the fun and the salt i need to survive DIm always open for critics if u disagree im happy to hear what u think.Happy 1.0 release day guys )

review: heard so much about this game and all i can say is that i am dissapointed. The gameplay loop itself is pretty great but you have to embrace the fact that there is a painfully slow progression. And the gathering of cosmetic items is so unfair. First you need to grind and be able to pay for the crate then cross your fingers that you get an opened crate else you will need to pay extra real money for it to open. Then to add insult to injury the next crate you buy will be double the price and theres only a limited amount of crates to open. No ingame drops or obtainable cosmetics anywhere else. Yes its only cosmetics but for this game to be a early access title and have so many microtransactions and still look like a early access title it insults its all its players. You are paying for early access game with a TON of microtransactions with cosmetics that probably only with real money you will get. I thankfully bought it on sale but i feel that it wasnt deep enought.

review: This game is the single most addictive gamesince team fortress 2. I have nlot put so many hours into a game this fast since tf2 and maybe overwatch. Absolute blast. It has iots bugs but to be expected and the patches roll out like clockwork so no abandoned game here. Que times are nearly INSTANT and while launching the game may take a little bit of time for some (my friends have complained about it) i have relatively short boot ups but i have an SSD so to be expected. The game closes instantly not really a selling point but something that struck me as a nice detail. I have had some t network lag moments where i get hit after being behind cover. But considering I have easilly played over 300 games it has only happend 4 times max. You get HILLARIOUS moments with friends and enemies alike (voice chat is usually cancer at the start but turn it on once you drop in its worth it). Easy mute buttons CTRL+M mutes the game CTRL+T mutes players and same buttons to undo the mute. I will say there is definatly a learning curve for the controlls I was learning a new controlwhat felt like daily for a month i swear haha. Once you learn the controlls and the weapon attatchments and the amo the game becomes natural and sinmce yyou can instantly get into a game afte losing one you can rage for a minute after losing a close one then you are distracted ebcause you are back in. HAVE FRIENDS TO PLAY IT WITH this is a game best played in a team. I prefer duos but squads are so much fun as well. The feeling you get when you win is unsurpassed by any game. No other game makes you feel as accomplished when you win a game. Especially when you have a ton of kills and just outplayerd the hell out of the enemy. 150% recomended.

review: Ok before you let all the recent negative reviews deture you from trying this game I'd like to clarify some things about the game and the devs decision to add microtransactions. Yes it's an early access title so as expected there are issues however they not only add new content every month but they fix bugs and issues that are reoccurring every patch. I personally admire the direction this game is going and how the devs are using early access to listen to the community and what they want with the game and how to fix it. The devs also don't plan to keep the game in early access for years much like many indie titles we've seen in the past and have been keeping to a set release schedule (does change sometimes for a couple days occasionally if the update isn't finished) as well as an official release date that they will try to hit to the best of their ability. To knock the game and the devs only on the basis of adding a temporary ( 1 2 months) micro transaction to help them fund a tournament as well as support charity is wrong. While I don't support the decision entirely as they did promise to not add micro transaction untill the official release the game content and the devs on this game are golden. Like I said the case is temporary and they won't be releasing any more paid contents until release this allows them to test systems for the release of the microtransaction system. Plus this is purely cosmetic and doesn't change gameplay much if at all. If you don't like the paid content dont buy it don't leave a bad review complaining about a minor temporary addition that goes back on one promise made the game is still good and improving and the devs are loyal to the community. The devs will hear your cries with or without the reviews. In conclusion I disagree with the addition of the microtransactions partially as they did go back on a promise and many indie titles before now have caused many gamers pain from crashing the hype train and mistrust between the devs and community can ruin a game. However adding the groundwork now and testing the pay system will allow the games paid cosmetics and such to be better at launch and it is only temporary to fund a gathering for the gamers who love the game and would like to compete with others who are also passionate about the game. Plus some funds will go to charity the two combined reasons slightly outweigh the negative in my eyes.

review: First thing. This goes for most early access games. I support alot of these but they attract the worst type of ignorant players you can imagine. Game is broken scam unoptimized whatever they can think of. People simply don't/refuse to understand the purpose if early access. It's a sad fact and try to educate them. You can imagine the responses you'll get. Anyway on to PUBG. Battle Royale with 100 players dropped over an island. Grab weapons/armor/meds and then it's last man/team standing and you can choose between 1PP/3PP so whatever you prefer it's there. There is a circle that closes in to force players closer and closer. The game is an adrenaline rush like few games can offer. Granted i'm terrible but if i reach top 10 i consider it a minor victory. Game performs quite well if you got the pc to back it up. Keep in mind optimization is an ongoing process so think of that if you run a midrange rig. I highly recommend PUBG and again. Look around other early access titles and you'll see what i mean. Hope you get this and that you'll have a great time. I'll see you in my scope

review: Game is good solo. Game is fantastic with a friend+.While sometimes frustrating looting up is usually fun. Having good loot for engagements is a piece of the puzzle but it's really all about movement and doing what is unexpected. You'll win many games this way.To enhance your experience take shots on any vehicles you see Hear shots? Go find who is taking them.Passive play while still a valid option is the absolute worst way to enjoy this game.Also I have played around 375 hours of this game to date. I have encountered 2 hackers in this time. They seem to be on the leaderboards more recently but I'm not noticing in any games. YMMV.Recommend.Highly Recommend with friends.

review: After 70 hours of gameplay I have to write this review to warn poeple that think about buying this game.The game itself is the best Battle Royal game that is currently available. The gun handling the recoil the looting the weapon mods etc. Everthing seems to fit together and make a very competetive game at it's core. But there are some issues that lower the skill level and makes playing the game frustrating. I have done a PROs and CONs list for all the points PROs very beauftiful map and assets very good weapon handling many weapon mods and wepaons to use ranking system (hidden) different modes (1st Person only 3rd Person modes Solos Duos Squads) skill ceiling very high pretty realistic gameplay (but not ultra complicated controls like Arma)CONs desychronisation of player models lag (cheating)Now I will explain the CONs points since the PRO points pretty much speak for themself. Desync is pretty bad. You shoot an enemy but the game does not register the hit because the player model is different between the two clients. This is especially frustrating when using shotguns or high damage sniper rifles.The lag is insane right now (30.11.2017 EU Server). In the beginning of a round players teleport around because of lag spikes. Even when 80% of the players are dead the lag still continues to appear. Example I shoot at someone and the hit does not register the next second he disappeared. Another second later I die to the guy who now shoots me from the left 20 meters away. It is unplayable at this point. And the lag does not only occur while shooting. Sometimes the game just freezes and sets you back 20 meters while you are running. Doors don't react when you try to close them. It just sucks!I personally did not encounter a cheater in this game but many people talk about it. It also happens to many streamers. I don't know how much of an issue it is right now but the price of 29.99$ for this game favours cheaters a lot (because cheap to rebuy).I personally have given up playing this game. It sucks that the lag is such a huge issue and for me it makes it impossible to play. I would NOT recommend buying this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

The gunplay was phenomenal and you'd constantly learn new ways to outsmart your opponents. While some of these things still hold true PUBG has a bad habit of fiddling with things that they shouldn't be. Instead of focusing all their attention on optimization and fixing bugs they do things like develop new microtransaction crates or change their gun mechanics drastically.I'm bewildered as to why after going through an entire beta with hundreds of thousands of players putting hundreds of hours in as to why they would adjust such an essential part of the game.If you're looking for consistency in a game this is not the one for you.

review: Very fun game that doesn't deserve as much hate as it gets. Bugs are getting fixed and optimization issues are better. I've encountered a few cheaters which are annoying but there aren't many. Worth the price but you have to pay for keys for certain crates and the event pass if you want more cosmetics. Gameplay is fun and graphics and audio are good as well. Easy to learn but hard to master. Tricky for when you're just starting out but like I said controls are easy to learn. This game is probably also a lot more fun with friends (I don't know because almost none of my friends play this game). Also the queue times are low which is nice. All in all a fun game which is worth the money and doesn't deserve all this unnecessary hate. I highly recommend this game.

review: This is my first review of any game ever on steam. I think? I dunno. Its been awhile either way. So here we go Do not buy this game. Here is a list of reasons why Optimization is absolute garbage. People with i7s and 1080ti's have FPS problems The number of crates is insane to get skins. The drop rates in this crates is garbage. And the multiple keys you have to buy to get them open gets pricey especially when you get the same red shirt 4 times in a row or a dirty tank top 3 times in a row. The servers always go down during NA peak time for maintenance Cheaters are a massive problem still Desync on this game is a daily occurance. With 1 life to give it usually ends your game for that session. The dev chooses microtransactions over fixing the game $10 dollar Shroud and Dr.Disrespect crates $10 dollar event pass that is less bang for your buck than Fortnites Battle pass. The mobile version is infintely more optimized has more features (like a shooting range which people have wanted for ages) is free and is more fun to play.I have around 450 hours in this game. I played tons of it but always there was a glimmer of hope before the 1.0 release that would be "fixed". That never came. Just more crates and more disapointment.

review: I only managed to play one game of this with a friend before the problems started.First off the game should look fantastic but the terrible frame rate at higher settings forced me to drop down to Low before I could even get a stable 30 (running a AMD RX480 8GB) which massively took away from the atmosphere that should have been created.In my 30 minutes of gameplay I did have a lot of fun as I ran from buliding to building looking for weapons and armour before I went into an old school and was instantly destroyed by a group of 4 people constantly throwing grenades into the room I was in.After this game the problems started to arrise. I closed the game for a short amount of time whilst I waited for another friend to come online but when we were all ready to launch back up and play it again for some reason the game refused to launch for me. I was waiting for about 5 minutes with steam telling me that I was in game before it decided to launch. My sigh of relief was broken almost immediately as I realised that the game had frozen just after the Bluehole logo. I closed the game closed steam and then logged back in to try and run the game again only to have the same thing happen to me again I tried this 3 more times before restarting my computer and giving it another go. This time I managed to get all the way to the main menu of the game and join my group of friends and search for a game except it crashed the moment I entered the loading screen when we found a game. I thought that something might have gone wrong with files of the game so I uninstalled it and re installed it again only to have the game crash on me again.This is a real shame as the limitted amount of gameplay that I got to play was actually very fun and made me want to go back to it as soon as I had died. I would not recommend this game as it is now as some of my friends are having very similar problems to me with both bad frame rates or crashing when trying to launch instead I will wait a few months for the Dev to have more time looking at all of the problems everyone is having and try to fix them.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Player Unkown's "Battlegrounds" is a good game with a semi competent developer with a bad publisher and harbours a sort of awful community. Considering the game is publish and developed by PUBG Corp. (then Bluehole) I might have some explaining to do.Let's start with the good stuff though the game itself. PUBG is a very well oiled game. The guns are differnet the gameplay is exciting if at times a bit discouraging. It's fun. Apparently it's also deep enough for people to say they're really good at it. Apparently it also has a cheater issue though I don't know how you'd tell. The kill cams the game has are really janky and while you could spectate the person who killed you I don't really care to be honest. One problem with the game is that it is a kind of one trick pony. It does Battle Royale well but it does nothing else. There's no little deathmatch practice mode there's no racing component nothing. If you're a Battle Royale purist I guess that's fine but it gets a bit boring after a bit.As for story there is none. There's no reason why you're there and the game doesn't give you one. I like to pretend that my character is some school teacher that got abducted by these weird Russian guys to fight to the death in some forest in Eastern Europe. But now they have 2 other maps so whatever. The maps are alright as well big too. 2 are 16 kilometers by 16 kilometers and the newest one is 4 kilometers by 4 kilometers. They all have their merrits though I'd say the weakest one is the Desert one. Erangal. It's just too big. You see the Eastern European one that has a name that escapes me is a little smaller than the desert one but has 400 vehicle spawns wheras Erangal has 240 vehicle spawns. So I hope you like walking if you play on that map. As for how it runs I don't have any issues on my R9 380 AMD FX 8350 12 gbs of ram on an HDD. It runs fine for me on high as long as I have Google Chrome off anyway. The looks of PUBG aren't that impressive though. PUBG doesn't have an aesthetic really. It doesn't have an art style. Because almost every asset is bought off the Unity asset store. This isn't a big deal but compared to its brother Fortnite PUBG is an ugly game. It's pretty boring and uninspired in that regard. The cosmetic scene is a little weird. I'd say PUBG is a pretty bad company overall if you're a consumer anyway. They frequently go back on their word on how cosmetics will work doing frankly weird stuff like banning steam trading and selling keys when they said they wouldn't. Of course now they've copied Fortnite's battle pass system which seems kind of gross. It's their toy they can do what they want with it but it seems pretty odd to sell a game for 30 dollars and then to sell a monthly pass for 10 bucks to go with it. That's PUBG or at least what I think it is. Yeah that sounds about right.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have an i770 quad core 16 GB RAM GTX 1050 with 8 dedicated GB of RAM and can run any other game on high with over 100+ FPS... but as soon as I load this hot heeping garbage I cant even play it unless im on very low and even then Im lucky to get 60 fps solid. This game is horrible and has zero optimisation. During early access at least i could get 70 fps on medium. Im pretty sure optimisation doesn't go in reverse. your game is trash and a major cash grab. Do not recommend.I'd rather play minecraft than this

review: Fun little game. you and 90ish people get thrown out of a plane on a map. you land where you want. Once you touch ground everyone is against you or your team! search for loot and weapons in house/buildings/air drops. after while you need to relocate to the battleground. as time goes by the battleground limits get smaller until a player or team is/are last man standing.I like how the loot is quickly acquired you can manage to find good stuff at random locations unlike some games where the loot is at highly crowded areas.the gun fights feel realistic enough. the health and heal system is good in my opinionI think that the games are too quick sometimes... you barely got anything that you have to relocate non stop and you don't get enough time to make up your strategy. Some games you'll always be running/driving like crazy to make it in the damn white circle totally blowing away your cover.the driving controls also feel a bit clunky at the momentme and one of my friend played 5 or 6 rounds and made it to the final 4 once so you can manage to survive even if you're brand new at the game. I was expecting to get brutalized like crazy at first but it wasn't so bad.just make sure to not be seen and you'll be allright!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Empty a 12 ounce bag of fresh or frozen cranberries into a saucepan and transfer 1/2 cup to a small bowl. Add 1 cup sugar 1 strip orange or lemon zest and 2 tablespoons water to the pan and cook over low heat stirring occasionally until the sugar dissolves and the cranberries are soft about 10 minutes. Increase the heat to medium and cook until the cranberries burst about 12 minutes. Reduce the heat to low and stir in the reserved cranberries. Add sugar salt and pepper to taste and cool to room temperature before serving and thats how you make cranberry sauce!

review: Amazing Game!I run a GTX 670... yes a gtx 670 you can probably pick it up for 45$ used. The servers run perfectly and there is not much lag at all ( On Oceania servers Asia Servers are fine too just a bit of delay) My internet runs at best 900KB/s and upload is probs like 100Kb/s.The only problem about this game is loading in with these specs...The buildings dont load in straight away so easy fix just parachute to a location where noone else is parachuting too. Easy fix game is still enjoyable as loading only takes like 30 seconds to a minute. After that first 1 minute load after landing the game is smooth as butter.Would recommend.my best is 11 kills in one game without winning and ive won 3 games.

review: I can't say I'm a pro at this game but I can give some tips for it considering it is one of my favorite games. PUBG I have grinded hours on end. This action packed game can have many high and low ends but over all I would say its a great game. However however I would need to say that they need to make this game easier to run. (More Smooth) On top of that I feel like they should adjust somethings with the Regions. Team communication is crusial so I belive they need to add some feature that adds more of it. (Region Lock China) With that many things will change and lots of players I know will be very releaved. The cheating system is also pretty bad. When someone locks onto your head follows you with it and completly eats your with no recoil in top 5 yehh thats dissapointing. But for the most part this game keeps on getting better and better with every path they send out. The bugs can be bad indeed but i'm sure they'll be patched sooner or later. PS allowing you to choose which map would be pretty useful. D

review: Recently i've read a lot of negative reviews about this game. However i cannot confirm most of these reviews.. Most of the time people talk about bugs and bad server tick rates.. i have not really experienced any of those. Of course sometimes you're sitting in the plane and can't jump out sometimes your car is doing weird things but overall it's not as full of bugs as people say. I'm using a GTX 1060 (6GB Vram) and an Intel i5 8400 and most of the time i have more than 100 fps except for big cities like Yasnaya or Poch1nki (edit apparently this name is being censored by steam) ... And for those saying it was full of cheaters well.. you're probably just bad or don't have enough experience with weapons. PUBG is permantly trying to get rid of cheaters for instance you can't play PUBG with family shared accounts anymore. On the other hand its kinda true that it's still 30 and they probably added weapons to make more profit but this money can also be spend to reinvest on the game.. unlike fortnite they only get money when people buy the game or when you sell/buy a weapon skin on the steam market (taxes). They are currently working on a new map which again requires money. Speaking about Fortnite.. it has become a competitor to PUBG and therefore PUBG is constantly losing players earning less money. If you're thinking about buying this game you should only do it if you're certain about your CPU/GPU and believe in PUBG's developing progress. In my opinion there are a lot of games on steam which are being improved all the time and are worth buying for they are being worked on all the time.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: 总得来说 绝地求生 算的上此类游戏目前为止的巅峰之作了 这么说是单从游戏的可玩性与游戏操作性来说的 其游戏内容也很符合这款游戏的名字与内涵 但作为一款fps 游戏它所 应欲而生 的外挂脚本也是数不胜数 直接导致了一些不法分子以剥夺其他玩家游戏体验 破坏游戏坏境为代价牟取暴利 对此 游戏制作公司公司也只是被动的进行封号以此来打击开挂玩家 这种治标不治本的行为让广大玩家不能接受 而蓝洞也让玩家们看到了一个只顾圈钱跑路的游戏公司形象 外挂横行的问题没有得到有效解决或许可以归结为玩家基数大不好管控 那么游戏自身频繁的丢包和崩溃的情况从游戏初始到现在 2018年2月20日 为止问题依然存在应该怎么理解 是游戏公司没有人才还是资金不足 显然都不是 蓝洞有着很多优秀的专业人才并且只这一个游戏的销售量就达到几千万份来看 缺乏资金人才以致无法解决的理由根本不成立 那么只能再一次回到了蓝洞公司自身原因 他们并不致力于经营而只是设计游戏 赚钱 在设计游戏 再赚钱的长久利益流动链 作为一名热爱游戏的人来说我喜欢这个游戏 但对于一名消费者来说我抵制这个游戏
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is great even after all its problems.Some of my most enjoyable moments are in this game.However for me personally this game is not for me. Its too slow paced and RNG based. That doesnt mean its not for you though I am glad I bought this game and its here whenever I want to pick it up.There is indeed hacker problems syncing problems etc. But all games have their own problems this game is still great and fun especially when you dont take it seriously and just enjoy it.If you ever find this game annoying or tilting then go try Fortnite and enjoy yourself there.If you just dont enjoy this game at all and hate its problems and get tilted too much then maybe this game is not for you.There is no need going around hating a game that isnt for you just because others play it doesnt mean you have to as well just play video games you enjoy. Thats the whole point of video games.This isnt a bad game and doesnt deserve the hate it gets if you hate the game then just play something else. More than anything when you are playing a video game focus on one thing Enjoying yourself.

review: This game is horrible. I've played in multiple tournaments and put a good amount of time into this game. The lag at the beggining makes it take four tries to pick anything up and everyone will be teleporting around the area. The desync is so bad you'll be fully behind cover for a full second and then somehow die from a shot that already went past you. I've killed so many people that were behind cover its incredible. The parachute mechanics are so bad that you'll often find yourself stuck in your parachute while someone has enough time to pick up a gun and shoot you or possibly just punch you out. There is a cut shoot mechanic which would solve these problems if it 1) gave you the option or 2) took less than about 3 seconds of floating before the shoot was actually cut.The aim and gun mechanics are fine however the vehicles are hot garbage. I have plenty of clips of me driving on the road (you know the flatest surface in the game) going directly straight and flipping out of no where as if I ramped off of an invisible rock. Sometimes they just glitch back and forth and explode for a little extra flavour and variety in your gameplay experience. Hackers aren't nearly as big of an issue as people make it out to be (I've only seen 2 in my time) but it seems like people are hacking all the time because of how terrible the mechanics and lag is that most of the time you end up just never wanting to play the game again.

review: Awesome game! Over 500 hours in it and could easily play it over 1000 hours. Would have easily paid $60 NZD for this Pros Devs know what they are doing and are constantly communicating with their community which is amazing. Easy to learn hard to master. Constant content and optimization being added just about every month Bug fixes mostly every week Every game is differentCons Some game breaking bugs RNG of the game can be very annoying in looting and border placement Some sound issues Full optimization still in progress (But is being worked on)Overall this game has amazed me and I have continued to play it nearly every day since the OCE server release. For an early access game this has far surpassed thousands of games in uniqueness and quality. The devs have constant communication making it easy for the community to voice any concerns and for the devs to release any information about the game. I look forward to what the devs hold for the future of this game (like the newly announced map!) and would highly recommend to anyone looking to buy this game.

review: Ever go into a game and hear some chinese narrator ususally a guy with a deep voice or woman saying somthing in chinese?These are bots that are advertising cheats for the game. People were happy when Bluedick said that they would consider region locking china and said that they implemented a 'ping lock' but they really didnt. Every game people with names like 19285083719836 or Qi_Fong_dong3 get 40 kills and win They probably have good gaming chairs because they just kill you from 10 kilometers away through the ground. Bluemicrodick is also milking their player base for money with the battle pass and weapon skins that you buy. They focus more on introducing cosmetics then they do fixing netcode and bugs that the game has. Although I do enjoy this game the only thing that can save it is not adding new maps or cosmetics but fixing the core problems and region locking China.The player base is quickly declinging and if Blue doesnt do anything their game will soon be dead... https //steamdb.info/app/578080/graphs/

review: Unfortunitely I cannot recommend this game as of now. Yes I understand it is early access and it is enjoyable and addictive but unfortunitely it runs very slowly. I know what you might think. My computer can handle the game perfectly since I have a core i7 a GeForce GTX 1070 and 16 gigabytes of ram but the game seems to have incredible frame lag even in "very low" settings. It also shifts preformance at random sometimes being able to handle "Ultra" graphics but other times it is at two FPS on "Very low.'It also does the same for server lag but I will admit it may be due to my location.All it needs in my oppinion is something ANYTHING that could make it less laggy both frame wise and server wise. That is all.

review: If a game was only rated on its potential then this game would be the best. However a game is about lots of pieces how is the gameplay what is the connection like are their cheaters etc. That is where this game loses big time. Once the hype wears off and the honeymoon period is over you realize you're just spending hours NOT playing a FPS. This is just an over hyped parachuting running and looting simulator. They have been improving the game which could be good. They also just came out with a new map. But same as I said before once the honeymoon period wears off everyone will realize they need to change the maps name to CampTown. All that being said there are lots of games out there and this is better than most so have a ball.

review: what game is everyone playing? is my copy from steam just different? have i not sunk enough time into it to have a decent experience? it's exactly like every other early access survival shooter game. your character looks awful the textures are awful and the controls are awful.regardless your experience will probably follow this formula 1. pick a place on map whilst dropping in via airplane2. dropping out and taking six minutes to parachute down (sometimes longer if you accidently open your chute it's okay these controls are and it happens a lot.)3. finally landed now you'll pillage around for supplies4. you'll find some supplies but it won't be enough to get you prepared enough to actually combat anyone. so you'll look elswhere5. now you look on your map for a nearby cluster of buildings to loot hoping someone isnt there first who will kill you because the RNG gods were on their side.6. no one there AWESOME! but all of the buildings are picked clean.7. about 6 more minutes have passed now the circle starts to close making the area of play much smaller and you still have nothing to really defend yourself with except a sub machine gun 30 shots a motorcycle helmet and maybe a flash grenade8. you get shot at from somewhere that is impossible to tell because the draw distance is 2 feet. luckily you escape and find a pack of bandages in a shack you sought shelter in.9. about 20 minutes have gone by collectively and now there are 40 people left out of the starting 100. somehow you're still alive.10. sweet a huge bunch of buildings that are ripe for picking. time for some loot!11. you find an assault rifle tons of ammo a sight a high level vest and a military grade helmet. you're ready for anything.12. oops looks like the circle is right behind you and is closing in fast. you shuffle to outrun it but you can't on foot.13. taking ridiculous damage outside of the circle you barely make it over with half of your health gone time to heal.14. 30 minutes have now passed in this single match. you've only found one person and that person was shooting at you from an unknown area around you. player count is down to 20 and you wonder how you made it this far.15. it's around this time that players are closer in proximity of each other so more bloodspill is imminent. you get shot at from points you can't see from people you can't see.16. almost 40 minutes pass and you get shot into a 'down' state and wait for death.17. 42 minutes of your life are wasted doing absolutely nothing. congratulations you played yourself"it's okay it's in early access." no it's not okay when you are trying to justify a 30 dollar price (and in a worse state 40). with other games around that are finished at 10 dollars less or even half this price i don't see a true justification for this price tag.WITH FRIENDS the game can be okay. mediocre at best. the most fun i had was actually enjoying the ridiculous glitches and early access bugs that are sure to come with this mess.for 15 bucks okay. for 10? sure. for 30? off.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is very fun one of the best Battle Royal games I have played. It has a lot of items and weapons that you can use along with a lot of attachments for the guns. However despite meeting the min system requirements I still only get about 35 40 fps on very low settings and view distance at medium. I should be able to run Medium or High easily so it does need some optimization. But besides that this game is great and can't wait for future updates. DI do recommend this game

review: Flying down into an unknown area for the first time is intimidating and you will die within the first 10 minutes because you didnt know what your team mate meant by "hes at 210" but you eventually learnt the area learn where the good loot is and learn that its "the games fault that you couldnt hit that guy". As far as early access games go PlayerUnknows BattleGrounds is one of the best. From the developer that brought you all of your favorite battle royale mods... he knows what he is doing. Now to say this game is free from bugs would be a lie but the ones that exist are being fixed quite quickly especially when you compare it to other titles in the EA area such as a certain zombie survival game that we wont name. I believe this game to be something we will see ourselfs playing through the next couple of years and i will be here as it grows from just one map with some painfull sound issues to many maps with hopefully no more sound issues that cause me to have tinnitus when loading into the game

review: After 500 Hours I am still very much in love with this game however out of pure frustration it it time to uninstall for a few weeks or months until Bluehole gets their together. The game right now is not worth the stress if you are thinking of buying it for the first time please wait. Major problems affecting the game right now This last update wrecked the gameplay for me everytime I go into a building or get into a firefight the game lags Used to win a game every day or two with the current surge of hackers and people using macros it is near impossible to win nowadays. Three games in a row I was killed by cheaters before posting this review. It is impossible to find people who speak english on NORTH AMERICAN servers they are filled with chinese who have 3 regional servers to choose from but pick ours insteadI can deal with crashes low FPS getting killed 2 seconds after taking cover whatever. The game has always been broken which is part of the appeal. But the influx of chinese players on our servers coupled with the cheaters has made this game *literally unplayable*.

review: Player unknown has been making this kind of games for other companies this being one of the first games that he has done by itself has been one of the best games i have played i replaced csgo for this but if youre looking by the reviews trying to make a decision for buying it there are going to be some problems you need good internet and a good computer i doesent matter what kind of pc you have you MUST play this at low or very low for having a "good" expierence. The lag that everybody talks about its real doors open a second later after you press f granades are worst. another point is cars cars in this game are one of the most important things after guns and where you land but mr.unknown made this game SUPER REALISTIC but not with cars SPECIALLY MOTORCYCLES see this 2 wheeled kind of cars in this game are pure trash lets imagine that youre driving and you land normaly in any other game you would just keep going but in little battleground if you land a motorcycle IT FLIPS FOR NO FRICKING REASON and then well cuz gravity u fall down the bike and die this will be one of the biggest problems in this game but cars have SPECIAL POWERS like if you crash and your car flips well thats the end of the story cuz this game needs to be realistic so you cant unflip cars by pure force like in gta BUT LISTEN TO ME IF YOU HAVE A MEDiUM PC AND GOOD INTERNET BUY THIS GAME IT IS WONDERFUL U GET ATACHED TO IT AFTER A FEW KILLS AND WHEN YOU START KNOWING HOW TO PLAY AND THE STRATEGIES YOU WILL HAVE THE TIME OF YOUR LIFE.(sorry for bad english and puntuation and caps. cuz really this game is good if you learn how to have fun with it) )

review: Before 1.0 and the mass ban wave PUBG was unstable slithering with cheaters full of game breaking bugs and overall a game that you wanted to enjoy but simply couldn't. After all the recent patches and improvments almost all of those problems are gone. FPS can sometimes be a slight issue but that is expected for such a large map with millions of interactable objects being loaded at once. For reference with a (nothing overclocked) i5 6600k 16gb DDR4 and a 1060 6gb running Windows 8 I can cling on to 60fps without v sync but at times especially in the first 5 10 minutes of the match it can drop to around 30 for a few seconds every so often. I can't complain though it used to be a hell of a lot worse and it seems to be improving every patch so If played right it is a really enjoyable game with tons to do and so many opportunities to kill. In your first few games you'll probably want to drop somewhere remote to gear up and then approach people once you are ready bad idea. You'll end up finding almost nothing and then you won't see anyone until the last 20 people. The best way to learn to play this game is to throw yourself head first literally. Drop into the most populated spots (usually just the biggest areas on the map) and get straight into it. You'll get far fast.You have the ability to make the match what you want it to be just by dropping in a certain area and that's what makes this game stand out.

review: This game is super unique and it's always fun even when it's punishing. The strategy involved for such a game is much more interesting then what you commonly see in first/third person shooters.The early access version definitely has some bugs in spots but it's pretty polished overall and feels like a complete game already. If they released what's currently out as the full version I wouldn't be too upset so don't go in thinking it's super broken or anything.It's something that I keep coming back to as well so they must be doing something right. Highly recommended.Edit Now that the full version is out a lot of the bugs have been fixed and the game looks &amp feels a lot better than it did in early access. The features they've added are also especially cool such as being able to vault over walls and fences and being able to climb up short ledges. You can use this to climb on boxes (or other things in the environment) to get to higher locations or you can use it to jump out of windows for a quick &amp easy escape from a building. It changes a lot of the dynamic of the game in a good way and makes things a bit more interesting.Another new feature they've added in the full version which I really like is the replay system. After a match is over you can see a recorded version of the match. The recording is limited to a radius around your player but the radius is pretty large and it feels like you can see everything you would want to see in reference to how you did vs. other players.You're also able to see the location of all players on the map which is cool for seeing how popular certain areas on the map are becoming. for the players in your range you can spectate their gameplay or you can choose to "follow" their character (allowing you to rotate the camera). There is also a free look option if you hit spacebar.One of my favorite things in the replays would be all of the iconography on the map. You will see lines drawn whenever players fire their weapons seeing the exact trajectory of the bullets and when somebody takes a hit you'll see a red aura pulse from their icon.The replay system is very useful especially for new players who are looking to see what they did wrong and how to adjust their strategies.Overall aside from these new features the game is still very much the game it was in early access except it's more polished it runs better and there's also now a second map. The game just seems to be continuing to grow and expand and I would consider it even more highly recommended now than ever before.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is an amazing game. I have found myself completely addicted to this game and I'm not even mad. My favorite feature about this game is how realistic it is. I highly recommend this game I personally love the 3rd person aspect and playing solo but first person and squad gamemodes are super fantastic. 10/10 would recommend and would love to argue with anyone who thinks otherwise. xD &lt 3

review: So as it seems there have been a lot of people reviewing the game stating that the performance more specifically the lack there of is seemingly sub par. I for one don't find this too be true with my rig running a 4790K/ gtx780 and 16gb of ddr3 clocked at 1600. The game runs at over 60fps in open areas and a little over 30 in highly populated areas such as cities and the developers have already addressed the issue with being a high CPU overload that the GPU could easily take on. The performance I get is already more than playable and very enjoyable with the game being in its beta state. The developers will be rolling out updates in the following months that should move more of the CPU front load to the GPU and make a much more silky smooth expierence for us players. I would highly recommend purchasing this title if you are a fan of the batlle royal or fps survival genre. Please don't be discouraged by the reviews stating they refunded due to unplayability on their so called high end machines because my mid range machine can run the game at ultra with decent performance. Great job bluehole keep up the good work listening to the community.

review: I'm new to PC gaming in general. Most of my ps4 gaming career was on Call of Duty and Fortnite but I'd always seen gameplay and reviews of this game. I felt like it was something I'd enjoy but wasn't sure. First I can say week I didn't like it much and would play about 3 or so matches quit play siege and maybe play again for al little later. Took a break came back now I'm hooked on it. Just gotta get some people to play with I've enjoyed it more than Arma 3 which was my first pc purchase and I regret that Shooting takes some getting used to and it's more technical than fortnite but it's good. Shots feel better placed than a lot of those BR games but sometimes I feel like lag kills me. All in all it's a good game for people who've came from something else and looking for a game to break the ice as far as PC games. Drop school and hacienda every single time you'll get wrecked but it's what gets you good. Went from getting 0 kills to like 3 on squads doesnt sound like much but thats a lot in this game. Just stick it out you ll enjoy it in the long run.

review: Lots of fun but is pretty buggy. If you intend on buying this get ready to be extremely mad at times and really happy other times. It's very promising that it's in early access while still running fairly smoothly. You will encounter FPS drops (with my GTX 1070 and i7 6700k I usually average 80 100 FPS on high settings 50 70 FPS on Ultra settings. However this does not prevent it from dropping to 40 or lower in some situations) and you will encounter awkward vehicle mechanics buggy spectating the rare cheater and netcode/lag issues. Sometimes you will be killed and you confidently feel like you should have lived. That being said this game is incredibly fun. Playing solo or with friends is a great experience and getting Chicken Dinners is very rewarding. This game has the potential to become a very mainstream PC game for the foreseeable future. Keep in mind EARLY ACCESS there are bugs and various issues but they will be sorted out eventually. Would recommend however recently there have been stupid bannings for their new strict cheating rules.

Squads are a blast as long as you use the multiple discord channels to meet partners of your own skill rank.

review: A solid game countered by flaws which can ruin the games fun. Here are two of the major ones that need addressing Area of Play Both maps are rather large which is a good thing. The bad thing is that players are given too large of a range to drop from. This leads to a lot of fighting within the first few minutes amongst those who land close together then almost no fights because the survivors are so far apart. Not as much of a problem in Erangel but in Miramar it can be difficult to run into people for a large portion of the game.My way to fix it would be to limit the drop range by having the plane travel less of a distance on the map rather than have the plane cross the entire map.Hacking This is something many people complain about often followed by region lock China . But I m not here to moan about Chinese players. What the game lacks is a strong regularly updated anti cheat.I personally run into hackers quite often maybe 1 every 5 games which is a lot. I usually encounter them when I manage to make it into the last 10/20. The ones using aimbot are very blatant. The ones using wall hacks are easy enough to spot once you look for the right things.I still enjoy the game but these are two issues that I think need to be looked into ensure players have more enjoyable matches.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have only played this game for 35 hours as of writing this review though it has quickly become a one of my top 5 favorite games of all time. It has everything you could want from a battle royale. Good loot big open map and great gunplay. I have had many laughs with my friends from the vehicles (the boat being my personal fav) and ive had a ton of fun testing out different strats. I recommend this to everyone who has even a decent pc I play this on a measly gtx 765m and i still enjoy the heck out of this game. I run it on 750p at low settings and it still gives me endless enjoyment. An absolute 10/10!

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PLAYERUNKOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is an amazing take on the battle royale genre. This game requires lots of skill and strategy in order to even get close to a victory. You can play solo duos squads or no fill ssquads which alll are fun in their own right. To add on to this there are also seperate gamemodes which are events like 50v50 or 5 teams of 10 which is on right now or the zombie gamemode. There is a lot of versatility in the game. The game has weapons for every playstyle all the way down to the sights and attachments on the guns. This realistic shooter is amazing but has many bugs and glitches that do not impact gaming that much though my only problems are that there is no region lock and that the servers have poor netcodes both problems have an easy fix.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So i took the plunge since it's on sale despite the onslaught of hate behind the ground breaking title PUBG.I fail to see everything i read about this game beforehand.Game runs smooth with medium presets on my mediocre 2017 Budget build PC with just a 1050 ti g4560(i3 6100 equivalent) and 8gbs of ram.And yet people complain that they cannot run a 2017 game on their dated hardware??? i mean wtf this is the most graphically impressive game iv'e seen in terms of Details and "Draw Distance". Consider that it's running Unreal Engine 4 it also has very good physics.Cheaters i have encountered none so far and i'm used to playing against them since ive tried many Chinese Knockoffs such as Rules of survival Knives out and Ring of Elysium/Europa.Game is dying they say?? takes only 3 seconds to fill a 100 player game on 5 00 am in South East Asia.And there are no filler bots.Game Mechanics is very challenging and amazing i dare say CS GO feels arcadey after playing this. There's bullet drop Crosshair Zeroing and the guns are all useful.You could even kill someone from afar with a handgun if you really know how to use it.Bugs no there are no game breaking bugs that causes you to lose.A little glitch here and there like every open world game.The servers though aren't as consistent when launching the game.But in game it's smooth sailingBest Battle Royale game
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Man people keep ing about this game 'dying' 1M+ online players everyday &amp the developers pushing out updates on regular basis what more can people want? Game isnt optimised? stop playing on a piece of garbage then i remember half a year ago when i had slight FPS drops with my 1060 now it runs flawlessly. Game is amazing especially with friends. If youre reading this deciding if to buy this game then totaly do gunplay here is one of the best ive ever seen.

review: Got this game today and I was so excited. I died instantly on my first game and I though nothing much of it since I did expect it to happen. My second game I got my first kill but then another person came into the room I was in and was totally blind because I shot him instantly making him die to his knees.I actually like this game some people put against it but I do see why they do because there are a few issues here and there. I came across a crash from my game when I played my 4th match after that happened I just went back into the game and went back into the match. I really liked the feature were you can go back into a match you were on before you quitted/crashed the game. Anyways this game is good personally and I would highly like people to actually try out this game.I am giving this game a 8/10 big boy pyjamas.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Well where to start? A story...I finally grabbed a weapons drop and got a real sniper rifle with an 8x and a ghillie suit (from the drop). Went on top of a mountain started looking for people. Someone drove up right below me and got out to start sniping themselves. Perfect! I moved up to the ledge sighted in held shift on their head to steady it and... The game freezes and then crashes. I didn't even get to one shot off!! That about sums it up for me. Play this game if you want to get angry and fill your system with rage on a regular basis. Close range action is just plain aweful. The game is so choppy and jumpy when you first parachute in. Instead of trying to punch someone you might try yelling at the person through the mike. It's probably more effective.

review: PUBG is a walking or working simulator at its core but I don t wish to go against the grain too much here. In any case you better have friends to become head Slav of the bunch. Drop in alone with a friend or three and fight to the last man/men standing. Simple as that. My tirade with PUBG has mainly to do with the fact that it is still in an alpha state. Still. Through several recent updates developers have tweaked some latency issues and hit registration but the game is desperately incomplete with choppy frame rates and an egregious amount of cheaters. But hey at least there s less people botting. Don t let that all fool you into thinking the game is anywhere near being dead (au contraire). Chicken dinners are decadent meals sought after by hundreds of thousands. A new desert map is on the horizon in addition to a deadlier blue circle of death. Despite the alpha state the devs care to make this game playable even if it means igniting debate over paid cosmetic crates.In summary play with friends. Get your best bud or a group of three together with yourself to scour a fantasy Ukraine. Otherwise you ll be wasting your time running around alone with a pan to cover your

review: They definitly gave it a try but a small dev team and a game engine that doesn't support the style very well. Fortnite did exactly what they didn't they took suggestions from thier community and didn't dedicate 80% of thier focus to lootboxes. The small dev team is swimming in cash and could probably care less about the game itself and more about the money made off lootboxes and Chinease hackers. Everyone asked for a region lock and its a simple concept that aparently isn't comprehensible. I played this game for 30 hours and did enjoy some of it but with hackers and bugs everywhere in a game that's been out for almost a year this is unacceptable. I play fortnite now becuase they don't have lag and hackers everywhere. Now whatever you try to change is too little too late. Other companies have capitalized on your mistake you are now the next H1Z1 of the battle royal genre. An attempt was made.

review: I wish I could give a mixed reviewThis game seems to be walking backwards I supose it's already made more money than they ever expected and you can tell. They don't seem to be interested in imporving the game there are a litany of bugs and technical issues. I have to open task manager just to play the game otherwise it tries to do first time set up every time and gets stuck in a loop. The servers are not up to standard and honestly I wish they would stop messing about with stuff for streamers (stuff in custom) and get the basics sorted. Also f*** microtransactions.I loved this game because I love the concept and they were the first to get the formula right also I don't particularly like fortnite. There will be loads of battle royal games though so I'll look forward to the next one with a modern military setting.Originaly I recomended it see original review below It's been review bobmed twice incase you havent heard it's a good game but it was first review bombed because chinese players got an ad for a third party VPN as the chinese servers are really slow and laggy. Now that chinese players go on other servers (for better lag) the americans and the aussies are reviw bombing because they dont want th chinese on their servers. Long story short the review score has very little to do with the actual game which is a good game that is not well optimised and does have bugs but creates tension like nothing else.

review: Recipe for Disaster is the 100th quest released by Jagex being a sequel to the Cook's Assistant quest. It is composed of 10 subquests. The subquests range in difficulty from easy to very hard. It is intended to be a quest which nearly any member can start but which only the most accomplished and willing players can complete.The cook in Lumbridge has a surprisingly small number of ingredients to hand in his kitchen possibly as a result of an endless stream of newcomers with light fingers taking anything that isn't nailed down from his kitchen.Luckily in the past a kind Cook's Assistant was willing to help him in his culinary duties but a problem has now appeared that could spell... a Recipe For Disaster!Almost all members may attempt to solve his tricky predicament and be rewarded accordingly but only the very elite of Questers will be able to put an end to his problem permanently!Note Make sure you have at least one inventory slot free before the Culinaromancer dies. If you have a full inventory on finishing the quest (i.e. in the unlikely event that you kill the Culinaromancer without having to eat any food) you will not receive the reward item. It will simply be destroyed.Length Very long
