review: Not only 2/3 weeks ago I gave this game a positive rating because I could see the reviews plummeting. Somehow in those 2/3 weeks the game has hit a brand new low for me and I feel inclined to change my recommendation. The servers are performing terribly lots of rubber banding having to vault over things several times getting caught on terrain. Vehicles perform much worse now than they did a year ago? In the update that comes tomorrow they are removing map select for Erangel forcing me to queue between a map I don't want to play and a map I do. Every single time I land on the map I don't want to play I'm going to consider if I even want to continue playing PUBG at all since I can't even play what I want anymore. They are introducing a "battle pass" which is a system suited for a F2P game into a game that cost $30. So they are expecting you to PAY to grind for cosmetics. Yes the progression system is locked behind a paywall. There is absolutely no other way to look at this new venture than as a cash grab on Bluehole's behalf. I love the game but forcing ppl to grind for cosmetics purely because of the sunken cost fallacy is a low I didn't think Bluehole would stoop to. Whatever price the pass costs would actually be acceptable if the new cosmetic crates released would retain value like they used to. I could have just sold crates to cover the cost of the pass but now the crates are worth .04 so its not possible. Really upset with the direction the game has taken. Right now is soo not a good time for BH to be pushing people's buttons due to the sheer lack of games out right now. No reason to play this buggy problem filled mess over just about any other game now even if it is the best BR on the market.old review Played since closed beta quit for a while because of the crazy desync/lag. Came back for 1.0 patch and things arn't perfect but they have certainly improved. I believe this game deserves a positive rating because the game itself is actually fun as hell and even if nothing got better from this point forward I've had a lot of fun with the game made money and learned quite a lot about tactics. Still the best BR on the market right now you should buy it.

Unfortunately some in game rules and mechanics don't seem to work 100% of the time. Such as getting shot or runover through building walls and trees and the damn level 3 helmet not doing what it says lol (protecting you from insta headshot kills). That one just bothers me the most as I just finished a game in which I had a full level 3 helmet with full health and a Kar98 headshot took me out.Overall great game to play I highly recommend if you're into intense shooters!

review: Okay you've heard the hype.You've read that people are loving this game.You've read the console port isn't up to snuff.You've read and you watched and you've heard.But until you play and get into a fist fight over the last rifle in an abandoned warehouse into a firefight across large fields and rocky hills making the shot of the century or just plain dying at the hands of double team crossfire.You haven't actually experienced the game.PROS Team based gameplay at its finest. Fun (For the most part) gameplay. Rewarding (You aren't given anything the other players aren't and due to that you rely on your own skills)CONS As of now it's a bloody mess to run properly between weird glitches rubber banding lag and odd occurences (Gun damage not being read properly and so on) it can be difficult to accept some of it's oddities. But if you can get over that it's my main drawback. Frustrating for those looking for something easy (This is not an easy game be ready to die... a lot.) Somewhat chaotic and toxic community (I would recommend finding a group to play with if you want to do squad games because playing with randoms isn't ideal for people uncomfertable with language both profane and racist in the worst degree... But this is the internet we are talking about you probably already knew that.)OVERALL I think for $30 you are not going to find a better Co op shooter this side of Steam (Besides more intense titles such as Arma and so on)It's simple plain shootem' up fun and I wouldn't have it any other way.I'll see you on the Battlegrounds with a pan in my hand dressed only in my underwear and a motorcycle helmet and a smile on my face.

review: I've tried many times to like this game probably gonna try it again in the future but i just can't reccomend it.It's a buggy cheater infested poorly optimized mess with frequent hiccups both from the game itself and from the servers. And it doesn't even have the qualities to justify these performances the graphics the models the animations are all average at best so it's not like it has to load some overcomplicated stuff.The movement is slow both walking and aiming it always feels like you're contantly moving through molasses shooting feels like a dice roll sometimes the shots register sometimes they don't CQC fights are a nightmare due to these factors.Even when it works it has the alluring chance of you getting into an exciting gunfight or sniping a guy from a long distance but these moments are rare most of the time the fights are one sided as you're dead before you even realize where the shots are coming from and the fights generally last less than a minute the remaining 30+ minutes that you don't spend looting you spend running from point A to point B hoping not to get sniped by a guy camping on a hill since the start of the game.I regret giving this game more than one chance i cannot reccomend it unless you have friends to play with and are fine with potentially walking around for 30+ minutes only to get killed by things you had no control over. Even then try other battle royales that are FTP before spending 30 on this.TLDR Game is a mess controls like and is boring unless you have somebody to play with or are a masochist try other FTP BR games before deciding to spend money on this.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So first things first. If you are reading this then you are at least considering this game. Don't believe all the negative reviews. People upset over something really dumb that has no actual impact on the gameplay IE crates. Thats what all the negative reviews are about. This game especially when played with a squad reminds me of old school socom on playstation 2. Tactical. Hair raising frustrating. Socom in an open world while scavanging your weapons. This game doesn't do much new or bring a ton new to the "survival" type games except one thing the circle. A circle appears randomly on this huge island and you have to stay in it. Sounds simple and it is. But its genius. I hated the other survival type games because well everyone camped. Now there is certainly camping here too but the circle that is ever moving makes the game move along and makes the players funnel from all over this massive island to get into the circle or they die. For being an alpha it runs pretty damn good. I have a newer gaming laptop and it runs on ultra holding 60fps just great. TL DR Buy it it will be fun frustrating enfuriating and exhilerating usually all on the same map!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've been playing PUBG for a while now on and off. It's a tricky one to review because it's never going to be a GOTY contender but then again few games can get the heart racing like PUBG does. The game itself is a lot of fun. When you get that chicken dinner it's a great feeling but even coming in the top 10 can give you satisfaction. Some of the most enjoyable games i've played are ones when i didn't win the round. The gameplay is fun and addictive whilst each round feels unique and plays out differently. there's a lot to learn and skill forms a large part of being a successful player but each round requires good luck and favourable drops from the RNG gods. At it's core PUBG is a game of decisions the way you react to situations is often the deciding factor to how the round will play out for you. Some parts of the game are still a bit clunky and performance issues seem to persist for a lot of players. I ll often be enjoying a silky smooth game only to run into rando lag spike and frame drops despite my PC being more than capable. I've recently started having issues where i get stuck in the load screen whilst in the lobby and the plane which is frustrating. the loot boxes are dog crap. the chances of getting anything you want is far too small and they seriously need to up the odds. All in all PUBG is a great game thats fun to play and will have you putting your fist through the monitor in no time at all. it can be rough around the edges but it will keep you coming back time and time again.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is actually trash again. How does it go from fixed to back to broken in such a quick moment? I have no idea but it did. I adore this game in a sense for being such a good example of Battle Royale done right but when you not only begin charging microtransactions in an early access game let alone go back on your word about not doing it you don't deserve any more money. Meanwhile the game is buggy and glitchy as hell. Games crash frequently every patch brings a gamebreaking update in some way that doesn't get patched for a day and I've played games where textures never fully loaded for a high of ten minutes meaning I couldn't loot let alone walk or see much since it lagged like hell. And no I don't have a toaster GTX 970 i7 6500U 8GB Ra. A common fix is install PUBG on a flashdrive or SSD but I shouldn't have to do that to enjoy the game when they could optimize it properly. &lt This worked for the time being if you still have issues running it.

Servers in the United States are typically down for maintenance durring peak hours and every time there is a major update there are almost always complecations the next day or more. The game is terribly optimized the kill cam is so bad it makes it look like many people are hacking and trying to play games with your friends is often more trouble than its worth.

review: bugs/optimization problems that have been here since day one added microtransactions before the game left early access cheaters are less of an issue but way more prevalent than any other "esports ready" game lack of good content updates instead of using their time and money to invest in good talent to improve their game they are suing epic games players are toxic AF (although pretty much gaming as a whole nowadays) after about 60 hours it feels pretty repetitive at least for me. drop in have some team members who go solo in squads last a long time and either die or win at the end. no real point of playing as you only get rewarded with points to buy loot crates+big open maps+every building is enterable but some are blocked off at the upper floors+can either be action packed or played slowly depending on playstyle+both sniping and close range combat is useful although late game everybody shoots at distance+/ no building mechanic which is good if you hate spam building in fortnite but bad if you prefer that type of playoverall I would say no to this game. I played the Arma 3 mod before h1z1 was even considered and that was fun because it was free was a mod and had no microtransactions. nowadays it feels they are more focused on squeezing pennies out of every possible avenue (including bullsh*t lawsuits) then actually making the game good. had a LOT of potential that I feel they just dropped the ball on. If listening to little kids and grown men scream like little girls at you for "not shooting right" or "not going to school" then this game is for you.

review: Since the newest update I got four 24hr bans continously. I reported my situation to Blue Hole and they told me the reason is 'Please know that if a particular account or player is been reported by multiple players the account gets a temporary ban for an investigation. If the player is found to be actually cheating the ban becomes permanent and the same is notified to the player as well. If everything seems to be fine the tempory ban is lifted.'And at this very moment I got the alarm yellow letter from steam another 24hr ban.Ok see ya.Black mission 4 is coming up soon. The way you punish those cheaters should be an improvement of your game not to kill thousands innocent people to catch one.

review: 14/01/18 Incredibly fun for casuals pros and for anyone looking for something like Arma but with a little bit of flair. Hackers and FPS dips are frequent but this is to be expected for a relatively new game. A region look would not go unwanted as the EU servers and NA servers are being bombarded with loads of players with insanely high ping.23/04/18 Bluehole have failed to add much to keep this game fresh causing a significant but not detrimental dip in the player base they add a few new game modes every now and again but they are only available for a short time. Now they seem insistant on fixing something is not broken. 05/07/18 The game has become a in game purchase mess and continues to spit on its fanbase adding pointless attachments and threatening to completely de balance the game. The crate system was ok to begin with as it was not integral yet the money grabbing is becoming more and more apparent. The problem with hackers and low optimisation for some has still not been addressed with game mode and map development consistently being slow. I no longer recommend this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Don't buy this. This is a kidnapper. You will get stockholm syndrome and won't give up on it. This game constantly betrays its audience but most of us keep coming back. I think I'm finally about to give up on all the time I've put into it and move on there's going to be a million battle royales to choose from soon.Here's the thing They fix one thing after a year of asking for it to be fixed and they break three other things. The ARs are at such a unusable place right now it's depressing. Why use this AR used by the ing military when you can get this little 9mm gun that does its job 5x better? Their most recent sin was removing item trading. I bought my friend a $20 gold plate SKS skin since it's his favorite weapon and then they immediately remove the ability to trade it. Why punish your whole community for something other people are doing? For 's sake Brendan Greene PLAYERUNKNOWN has run this game into the ground. Never addressing the problems at the game's core lying to his fanbase ( https //www.pcgamer.com/paid crates continue to be a contentious issue for the pubg community/ for reference ) and calling people who don't want to play against 400 ping Chinanumbaone monsters who shoot you through walls "xenophobes" this game is a tragedy. And I'll use that to segway into my video recommendation https //www.youtube.com/watch?v Ns3bp2yWA1MDo not give these people any more money. Please.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Overall this is a fun and intensive game. It takes a while to get used to but once you have gotten used to it all is dandy and you should be able to survive and pull off kills. Don't expect to get Pro and be winning games left right and centre with like 10 hours gameplay since it is quite challenging and it beats every other BR out there. It's better to play with a squad since playing solos can get boring and i would say it is easier to learn with squads since you don't have to watch every corner for people since you have other eyes. 10/10 Would recommend for the average player. At the start i thought the game was complete utter dog but now i enjoy it. )

review: If your computer can run it get it however there are a few other things that you should keep in mind when buying this game it's an early access title so your going to encouter bugs from time to time however the devs are working hard to fix these for the final release. Since there is so many people playing it the server's in NA are always full so your going to get matched with people from China and have a ton of ping however this will probably be fixed by the time you read this reveiw. some of my friends bought this tittle just so they could play with all low settings and have 100 fps witch is playable but I don't think it's worth it. On the lowest settings it looks like and it can be hard to see people far all way from you if your going to get this tittle I would recommend investing in a new GPU to get the full experience (I have a gtx 1060 and I can run it at 200 300 fps on all of the highest settings)Overall this is a great game and though it's had some road bumps along the way the devs are working hard to make it the best possible experience for all palayers )

review: As of this review I have around 10 hours played and no game other than maybe vanilla WoW has had a first impression like this one on me. It has messed up my sleep schedule and I spend a lot of my day excited for my next play session. Yes it earns it's Early Access status but the moments it delivers are incredibly intense and satisfying and it can only get better from here. Every match is different and the "one more match" factor is through the roof. The devs have laid out a detailed plan to improve the game throughout it's Early Access phase and I don't see any reason to think they won't fulfill their promises given what the game already is.

review: PRO I enjoy the tactical survival gameplay. If you enjoyed other games like Counter Strike or Search and Destroy game type for Call of Duty then you should consider this game. The other half of the game is a loot hunt sort of like Left 4 Dead. Relatively bug free. My KDA is garbage at 0.5 but every game feels rewarding and fair. My aim is just garbage.CON There's a cosmetic loot system in the game that looks really halfbaked. Some people complain about FPS drops and server instability. I usually get 40 100 FPS running on a GTX 970 with graphics on Low (for competitive reasons).
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: 加油做优化吧 看好这款游戏 After playing over 400 hours of this game I have a lot of things to say. First of all the game itself is definitely the best battle royale game on PC and I can tell that Bluehole is working on the game really hard and trying to make it better but the work they've done are not enough. As a Chinese I'm very sad that all the cheaters now are basically from China and I understand why people would want to region lock China. There are still a lot of improvements need to be done like game models vechicles weather system safe zone etc. And the most important one is anti cheat. I've enjoyed the game a lot and I'm a top 800 DUO FPP player on NA server I hope the game can get better and better. I still have faith in Bluehole.

review: when i first began this game it was in early access. At the time the lag poor hit box random bullet spread and lack of true RNG was acceptable. Now after the game released i think we all believed this game was going to be great finally. finally optimized. finally registering hits correctly. cheating being taken care of. Rewards for playing the game. instead we got a semi optimized laggy non hit registering random hit points worse rng and now... paid loot crates. ever since the update came out the game has been ridiculous. instead of fixing and dealing with cheaters blue hole wants more money from there fans without rewarding for winning or for having early access. blue hole has taken a play book from epic and decided there fans no longer matter unless they are streamers or forking over all the money. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. make blue hole fix this mess instead of getting away with this because they are a "new game" or it was just out of early access.Update this game. it literally crashes at least 2 to 3 times a day. teleports you across the map for no reason. has no care for making this game any better. fix your god damn game.

review: This is an awesome Battle Royale game. One of my favorite non story stlye Witcher 3 games. But a buddy and I were just playing in duos and it was 3 alive! So it was us and some other guy. We were pumped first Chicken Dinner? Maybe? But alas. It was not to be as PUBG crashed on me just as we were pushing the final circle. Now from a purely shallow perspective as I don't understand what went wrong it's infuriating. But Who knows. Who knows....... sad days.That being said It is an awesome game the event modes are awesome and yeah. Just a few negatives Cheaters/hackers(though the devs are as far as I can tell pretty thoroughly engaged in this battle so its moreover a few toxic community members to blame)More and different maps can make a battle royale game like PUBG a whole different game based on what map you pick(which is a big plus map selection!)Game crashing Its happened to me a few times but never at a key moment until now. Though there are millions of players so I can only imagine the armada that is their server fleet.Keys for skins which are bought through accumulated points from play Really? I though EA only practiced the dark arts of in game purchases.TlDr Good game just a few key problems(all puns intended).

review: I want to start by saying great game!The adrenaline pump you get in this game is crazy.I've played a lot of Arma 3 Battle Royale which is an awesome mod. So good job PLAYERUNKNOWN for doing a standalone game for this genre.I highly recommend this game it's in Early Access so of course it will have some issues. So the big one is of course the performance. This game should at least get a solid 60 FPS where ever you are at all times. My preference is to have 100+ FPS. There are some minor problems as well like getting into cars sometimes is very slow and sometimes it doesn't even register that i'm trying to get in. I have a strong belief that you will fix this as time goes on. I also feel like the pace is a little faster than Arma 3 tho but it's okay. And I can not wait for the first person only servers to come. Because this 3rd person stuff I don't like you are not supposed to have the ability to look around a corner without looking around it physically. When I play Arma 3 Battle Royal I always aim for the first person only servers. It feels like no one have the upper hand when you always in first person. But nevertheless AWESOME GAME!Keep up the good work.

review: Well this is my first attempt to write a review so this by itself says a lot about the game.When PUBG first came out I thought it was just another random indie steam game.I thought is was just another shooter amidst the hundreds of shooters on steam.I rejected it at first glance.The a while later I noticed it was the most streamed game on twitch.I thought myself no way.It looked silly really and I couldnt find the point of the game.Later I saw a bunch of guys playing it at a local internet cafe. I still wasnt sold.And the just a bit later I saw my mates playing it day and night.I told the are you guys serious you cant be spending all you day with this crap.The assured me the game was fun but I dismissed them again.And then at a night of my day off I was getting really bored.I thought about buying the game to kill some time.I thought the game would be a waste of money but then again I was really bored so I bought it.I went for a duo match with my buddy.Long story short by the end of the match I was hooked.Everything about this game makes sence and it is a really tence game that makes your heart beat at every moment.There is no right or wrong way of playing.There is no high score for most kills.You just have to stay alive more than other players.Plain and simple survival.The map is huge with tons of features.Sometimes I think every deatail of the map has a story to say.So for the final verdict I reccomend the game to every shooter fan.I am a really hard guy to change opinion and this game changed my opinion from bottom to top.Its the only game I play since that night.PS Even thought the game is still in alpha I believe it is quite polished and I havent encountered any bugs whatsoever.Maybe a few fps drops here and there but only rarely.

review: Ah Battlegrounds. You are a tempting lady to say the least. I love to love you and I love to hate you. Well hate your maker rather. PUBG as a game is really fun in my humble opinion. Sure it has it's share of bugs (some that are getting more annoying by the day) but all in all it's a great experience with friends.The Good * Overall game play is addicting* Variety of situations you can and will find yourself in are never ending* The pacing of the game is really good for those of us that enjoy both intense and laid back gameplay* Gun play is really fun and very satisfying when you get a kill* New content (maps and loot) are only getting better as the game matures* Cheaters were rampant. Nearly every game I played I saw or was killed by one. However PUBG Corp's initiative to diminish their impact seems to be working as I rarely encounter one these days.The Bad * Bluehole / PUBG Corp. are now starting to treat this game as a cash grab and it's really starting to show. They are fixing bugs which is nice but they are creating more annoying bugs in the process.* Lag is getting worse. It cancels jumps teleports you meters away from where you thought you were and kills you after you've been behind cover for even as much as a second or two.* Can not connect to lobby without several retries* Not being able to see all your friends on the in game friends/team UI is really annoying* Did I mention this game is turning into a cash grab?* Updates are rolled out during North America prime time of play and with very little warning. This shuts down the servers for 3 4 hours and no play is possible. They offer regional servers so why not roll out the update regionally during each regions lowest activity time? Software Deployment 101.* With the exception of the newest map Sanhok testing of patches is barely given adequate time before rolled out to the production servers. Sometimes only a day on the test servers before moved to production. As a software engineer this is bothersome. Especially for a user base as large as PUBG has.* Speaking of Sanhok and testing PUBG stated several times that they are going to be spending lots of time and testing cycles on it so it is as perfect as possible. And for the most part they have succeeded. It's is a well designed and beautiful map. My favorite experience yet. HOWEVER there are very obvious cosmetic flaws in the form of floating assets all over. If this is PUBG Corp's idea of perfect then I'm not surprised the game and company are in the states they are.* They are working on optimizing the game but still a long way from it. I receive FPS drops frequently on my mid range rig. I don't expect to achieve a steady 144 FPS the entire time but going from 110 FPS to 45 FPS just by looking a different direction is jarring and limits my ability to win a fire fightConclusion This game is really fun if you can take it light heartedly and enjoy it for what it is. It is no where near a Triple A title and I suppose it's priced as such but with how popular it was and still is you'd think they would have been able to make it better than it currently is. All in all I will say I recommend it because I still have a lot of fun in it but PUBG Corp is really starting to sour my taste of it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: OK yes there are hackers. they ruin the game. BUT when there are no hackers there is no reason to and moan. This game is amazing. yes there are moments when you wonder why am i playing this? why when there are so many bugs. for me i play this because it is a journey. ive done alo in my life. my childhood on the farm for instanc. but seeing this game come from a mess and startign to actually be a decent and playable game is amazing. vaulting for example. a new feature that is being tested works almost flawlesslley. you cant expect a game like this on this scale with so many different objects from the butterflies that make you think its a perrson to the random airdrops. all this takes time and effort but most importantly it takes patience which alot of people here dont have. Im rating this a 8.7 out of 10 because there are still bugs that need ironing but i have high hopes for this game. for new people comign to this and hearing that its bad or that its good dont hesitate. you can always refund (just say you dont meet specs ) ) try the game make your own opinion on this. another point yes this game is not optimized. i run a 6500t with 1050TI and 32gb Ram. i still take quite some time to load in but again all the testing on the test servers im experiencing increased frame rates and bette performance. please dont listen to the reviews of people review it for yourself. if you have to ask a friend with it to library share it with you. this game can be shared. you have to use theri PUBG account but it atleast lets your try the game before buying.

review: Playing games for 20 years now so i've seen alot but this is one of the worst product i have ever played.Scroll down for comparison with _Fortnite_.Problems with PUBG Terrible inventory system Terrible pick up mechanism Therefor terrible looting experience Terrible perfomance Playing the game on a brand new system made in the end of 2017. Newest drivers everything. Fresh install. Yet the game force crash when i open up the map or the inventory. This is not tolerable. After searching for hours found others who also had this problem the only solution is to delete some cfg files + altering some .ini files.Untolerable. At the same even with the terrible perfomance the game looks rubbish. Seriously its beyond words how ugly every single object in this game. Textures got more jagged edges than a jaw of a shark even on max settings. You think Battle Royal is fast paced action filled? You're wrong in this game you can run in a straight line for 25 minutes never meet a single person then get killed in 1 3 seconds. Cheaters no region lock lack of meaningful updates terrible loot crate system with high price maps are terrible with zero foliage...Fortnite made _every_ problem of Pubg non existent fixing everything. Colod coded items + Chests works much better. Added complexivity layer with the building mechanism. Truely fast paced action orianted gameplay. Zero bugs Runs great even on potato Even the lowest settings are decent And the list could go on forever...Yeah Fortnite got the idea from Pubg so what? It's working just like anything else in the market / economy Got a great idea from someone else Made the idea 100x times better than the original

review: So what can I say. This game is one of those games that you are going to love and hate at the same time. The game is fun and the mechanics are great. For me this is the best Battle Royale out there. Although there is one big problem and is called "optimization." The point is it's an awesome game with a great potential but it's poorly optimized. The devs have been working hard to make this game better but sometimes it feels like every patch gets worse and better at the same time. So yes I reccomend this game because of how fun it is to play it and how intense it gets (winning your first chicken is a blast.) Have in mind before you buy you may experience frame drops or other problems it also depends how good is your cpu and gpu and also it is AN EARLY ACCESS.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Editing my review since my last one was from a couple weeks into the beta. This game blows monkey balls now. Still laggy still bullet lag still unexplained deaths. I hope you can speak Chinese cuz it doesnt matter what server you play on they're all infested by them. A good chunk of them are hacking too and they'll just buy another cheap account if they get banned. Have fun getting full auto sprayed from 400m out by a chinese name or just a name of numbers. Have fun watching a death cam of your killer sitting in yourr molotov before getting shot by an m24 and two point blank shotgun (with choke) shells all while taking no damage. Funny thing about that apparently we're all racist according to Brendan Greed for wanting region lock so we can communicate with our teammates actually hit our targets play with people of similar ping and not get tk'ed by the Chinese for our loot. review: This is an awesome game with major potential but and this is a serious but there are major issues with the game at the moment. and yes it is in alpha but with the size and revenue it has grown at these issues should have been addressed long time ago.Pros Awesome game to jam with your friends. Teamwork is essential and all the random stuff you can do even while playing to win is awesome.Weapon animations are really well thought out and well executedVehicles each have their own quirks and ways to drive them.The entensity of making it to final circle and taking a win in awesome.Cons Hit reg (and this is a big flaw) is absolutely abysmal if you are not local to whichever regional servers you are connecting to and even then hit boxes are about as on target as a idiot with no arms at times _ Aiming for the head is like pulling a slot machine lever as to whether its going to hit or not. Edit Hit reg is even more of a joke now thanks to the 'fixes' weve had. Its now not just a case of hitboxes but whether your damn shot will even register!And you wil be introduced to a whole new form of cancer with the shotgun rng players. 2 shots will almost drop you with armour and without your as good as dead with minimal aim if any at all required unless again you have a bad ping then its less than useless.Rendering is also a serious issue if you are on the end of any scope and not behind a hill or tree anyone with low graphics will see you stick out brighter than a flashbang which makes hiding at a distance next to useless at all times.They introduced micro transactions for what after promising integrity? They had millions already and zero need to add them in especially to not fix major game issues with servers that break daily at the moment.These are the main serious gripes i currently have with the game that i hope will be fixed soon enough and hopefully without a doubt before its 'official release' because as i said its an awesome but extremely enfuriating where half a clip later from an AK and 2 shots from your opponent you're deadEdit Months on (including its auspicious 1.0 release) after my initial review and were sitting with new issues like more cheaters than the devs know what to do with 100 000 and a 'new' auto heal cheat surfaces afew days thereafter. GG but thats besides the fact that full blown serial killers are more stable than PUBG on a good day.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN"S BATTLEGROUNDS is a great battle royale game that not only revolutionized the genre but is a great deal of fun. There is a lot wrong with PUBG and a lot of good in PUBG. The gunplay is one of the best in not only the battle royale genre but in the FPS genre as well. The bullet drop and bullet velocity mechanics provide a sense of realistic shooting that should be important to this type of game. The variety of guns is also great to play with however due to the way the guns are balanced some guns are more favored than others so over many games you will see the same guns being played not because people want to use them but because if they don't then they won't have a chance to win. Besides this the looting meachanics are simple but work and vehicles are nice as the map is pretty large. The downsides of this game is hacking and hit registration. Hackers are a major problem when it comes to any multiplayer game but in PUBG it is a really big problem. Combine with this and the inconsistent hit reg makes the experience a bit frustrating at best and infuriating at worse. But every game has its ups and downs and it's all up to the consumer to decide wether or not these downsides outwiegh the goodsides. In my opinion PUBG is a great game with flaws it is still in development with updates coming out somewhat regularly. If you are able to deal with the frustrating parts of PUBG then you should buy this game. $30 for a game that you can play over and over with variety in engagements weaponry and opponents is a great deal and you should really pick it up if you can easpecially on sale.

review: After installing a counter measure for cheaters.... guess what? Nothing changed. You join a game just to die at the hand of the first autoaim user. Moreover after reporting these cheaters you don't have any feedback report of what became of that player. if they ckecked it or banned... or nothing..Another thing is that this game has one of the worst player base ever seen. Most of the games you start looting for about 15 mins finding yourself only to give what you got to the first cheater around the corner. Wall hacks autoaim and many others cheats are in full use in this game. Don't take me wrong the game is good but the lack of moderation has destroyed a good game. I found myself playing with guys that they found right using cheats just because they don't know how to play but want to have fun. So these players don't care if the destroy others' enjoyment of the game they just want to be there and have "fun" using cheats to get kills. So when every legit player will be gone who will have the Chicken Dinner? Oh right the one with the fastest internet connection between hackers!I decided after so much time waiting for a solution to these cheats users to uninstall PUBG forever. They just can't or don't want to solve the plague in this game.

review: Lets be honest PUBG is great! I got the game a month after it was released on early access and was hooked at the start. I did leave every now and then because i felt like updates were slow and the only way i could hvae more fun was waiting for the next new weapon or game feature. Then 1.0 happened. Not to mention the extra hour delay we had to wair for the servers the day of but i noticed somthing different..... ing Asians. Im not a racist but this bothers me. Other games are region locked so that you can only play within your own servers making the ping super low. In PUBG you can switch to whichever region you wont with the click of your mouse. Hence all these squinty eyed s flooding our servers bringing there hackers and our women! While the game is fun if you hate joining a lobby and hearing chinese 24/7 stay far away from this game.

review: It can be very very fun and very very frustrating thats the beauty of battle royale. There should be a dedicated Team deathmatch style mode "warmode" because battle royale mode and all of its joy and annoyance and heart thumping end game and boring run simulation and hackers and server lag and amazing kobe nades and weird car physics and also great motorcycle flips and bridge camping and not finding a weapon or being the first to an AR can be fatiguing. and custom lobby matches are just...............definitely worth a buy BUT after almost 800hrs I have lost incentive to play no progression of any kind no other game modes really no point to buying loot.......time to step awayIf Black Ops 4 Battle Royale mode "Blackout" is good then say goodbye to PUBGOnce other game engines catch up to the Battle Royale market there will be no need for PUBG whos gameplay mechanics are not stellar and not unique or very stable in any way.But until that time play this game it can be fun!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: If you are looking for a more strategy based battle royale game this is the perfect game for you. Granted there are many issues players have encountered with the game (network lag bugs rubberbanding etc). Although Bluehole Studios is constantly waiting for feedback to fix these problems and they start investigating them asap. This usually takes them an hour to a day depending on how big of a problem it is. They also roll out monthly and weekly patches so the game feels better and better as these get implemented into the game. Overall Playerunknown's Battlegrounds is great and even though it followed the early access t it is quickly becoming a full game. Let's just hope that they fix the optimization of the game so everyone can enjoy it from the same fps.

review: PUBG is a battle royal game. You start off in a lobby where you wait for around a minute mute the voice chat it's just racist remarks and ear Then you are put into a plane with 100 others where you can jump off at any moment. You will start to free fall and after a bit you can parachute. Now you are on the island looting and killing is now what you have to do. This game is a lot better than H1 a lot more polished and realistic but still fun. Driving is amazing and you can pull off crazy stunts. Only complaint is optimization it's got a lot better but for some of my friends with lower end PCs which can still run most games today at high ultra struggle a bit getting between 30 50 frames. This game is very CPU intensive! I recommend this game to anyone wanting to try out some Battle Royale. The development team is very active and with Player Unknown himself as the creator this game will go far!

review: This game has been in full release for a few months now and there are still some glaring issues. The first is that this game is very badly optimized even after all the time in beta and the few moths in release they have made little to no effort to fix many of the problems. I dont have a very powerful system by any means its sort of middle of the road but it still runs other games that are know for having perfomance issues like fallout 4 for example on high settings. other issues include but are not limited to lag server connection issues kill cams are just bad vehicles still dont work properly animations are clunky server tick rate is awful hackers are everywhere toxic community and so on. instead of trying to fix issues like these they decide to add weapon skins make a mobile version (which runs better overall somehow) added pay to open crates and a new map coming.the crate are a whole other issue. they put in a crate drop system similar to other games where you spend in game money that you earn to get a random item. not bad however... most of the time you waste the credits you earn to get a pay to open key crate. the keys cost $2.50 EACH and these crates just pile up in your inventory. then there is also a parachute skin but it costs ***$4.99$*** (on sale) with no extra content. just the chute.I still like the game though and for $30 you get what you pay for. but keep in mind all of the above.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I do know that eventually that fun will fade in time but the feeling I had playing PUBG so far is something I haven't found for years before! The last game that gave me this kind of feeling was Counter Strike like 15 years ago! That feeling of sheer fun the feeling of playing a game cause I'm having a REAL good time and not just to progress learn skills perks gain more life better loots etc... When a game ends I'm getting into another just cause I'm pretty close to unlock that something but beceause I just WANT MORE of it! Just like in CS everyone starts with the same chances of winning it relies on a couple of very simple facts like timing reflexes and PUBG even add a little luck in it cause your initial scavenging can pretty much dictate how the game will go.The fact that every game is different is a blast to me. As I said I know that "passion" will fade a bit but I think that pretty much like CS it'll be a game I'll keep installed and come back to every now and then! It's fun and refreshing to grab a game where you can actually LEARN to get better instead of just leveling up / Getting drops / Perks to get OP. This simple game is about skills and smarts!

review: TLDR this is how you do early access correctly.At LEAST one update per week. Listening to the community on a regular basis for fixes and suggestions. These dev's actually care for a change and are regularily making effective and useful efforts to improve the game on a rediculously frequent basis.The gameplay is unlike any other game out there. It has the tacticality of ARMA but the quickness and frantic pace of some of the most competitive shooters out there. I've never had a game get my blood pumping as fast as this one.10/10 would support again.

review: Unfortunately despite it's release this game is no where in fact a full product I would even call this game to still be in beta due to the several bugs and mechanics that still need to be fixed that were around in the beta phase. It's best to come back and take a look at reviews in 6 months.

review: Everyone knows what this game is and i wont explain that. But the one thing this game does for me is it keeps making me come back a couple times a month. It's no way perfect or even close at times but you will always have an itch to play it. Mainly for me it is because of the varying ways i can play each time i play. Do i want to camp all game? yep. Do i want to run and gun the entire time and get a bunch of kills or die in 2 minutes? yep. Do i want to try and win or play casual and see where it goes? yep. Do i want to do a flip on my bike not stick the landing and die from falling? YEP. Do i want to leave the safety of my building to try and find a redbull but get sniped? YEP. This to me is what makes it fun and want to come back to over and over again even if its just for 1 or 2 matches at a time.

review: A great idea for a game.A couple reasons why I won't be playing again Cheaters are running rampant. Every match I get to the final 10 in one guy picks everyone off in a few seconds.Servers need to be region locked. People playing on NA servers with 3 seconds of lag because they should be on KR/JP is nonsense. People are bouncing all around you can't win a close range battle because they're moving like stop frame animation.And then there is the player themself lagging. If I go into a building and want to pick up the shotgun. I should be picking up the shotgun not touching the floor 12 times with no result while I'm being punched in the head by XiaohaoKang1111 and his 7 teaming cohorts in a solo game.

review: From technical point of view this game is terrible. PUBG has the worst netcode I have ever seen resulting in constant lag and desync. The game can only play a very limited amount of audio files at once sometimes you won't hear people moving around you. The graphics are mediocre but it needs the best hardware to run decently. When you land somewhere it takes a few seconds for the game to load the loot on the ground even if you play from SSD. Even the new features are full of bugs and usually it takes months to fix something.At this point I can't recommend this game. There are already a bunch of better Battle Royale games out there play something else.

review: Was in a small corridor with another felllow he was kinda handsome... was wearing a blue tux and some fancy goggles. He had a freash moto helm and was lookin kinda fly. I turn the corner with my trusty dubble barrel and I see he also has double barrel. I have a nice fresh ( might i say ) level uno vest. He in fact didn't. I laid my first shell directly into his chest. He lived however and laid his FIRST shell into my chest TOO. I went down in dishonor he should of had his face on the floor of our little quiant house. I don't understand the hit reg in the game but I believe he should of went down first instead of me. I could faintly hear him say "Omae wa mou shindeiru" after i laid my shell into his chest and i gasped "NANI?!?!" and he brutally ed me.

review: Game is good but there is problems with the regions. Due to the high number of asian players the devs have refused to lock people within SEA to SEA servers (but claimed that it is somehow xenophobic for us to not want them on NA/EU servers)I don't think that region locks should apply to just SEA I want all regions to be locked to where they come from. If you are from north america you should be on north american servers. If 2 friends are from different regions let them choose what region to go and if your in a squad where the majority is SEA force SEA servers. This should be the standard for ALL regions due to ping issues in a game where this stuff matters greatly. I see NO reason why SEA should be playing on NA servers at all and if servers in one region such as SEA or Oceania are worse than NA servers please just improve the servers over there instead of having them play on NA servers.

review: Game is a lot of fun I am hearing horror stories of the developers panderign to streamers (a la banning people for honking horns near them) but I have not nor do I know anyone who has experienced this personally. That being said i'd be pretty too. As far as microtransactions go Yes they exist ingame no you don't have to participate. There are 2 crates the "locked" one that requires the purchase of a key and one that you can open without making a purchase. Additionally a percentage of the purchases go to charity so it beats the hell out of CSGO or Dota or Tf2 microtransactions.Anyways ..Great last man standing style game with random loot that ensures that no two matches are alike. One of the few games that I legit enjoy solo or partied up.

review: Let me tell you my storySo I'm sitting underneath the stairs of this building cause I know a guy went in it and was upstairs. I had basically set up the perfect trap but I'm still f*ckin scared like you wouldn't believe. I can hear the dude coming closer and closer and my heart just hurts man. So this dude walks down the stairs and I successfully kill him. So I'm calming myself down cause he is dead. I take his stuff and go out. BAMM Sniper outa nowhere hits me Almost causing me to have a heart attack. So i run to the nearest tree for cover but I need to move cause I'm not in the safe zone and the electric wall things are closing in. So i run back to the house sprint to the front door and try to make the run for the safe zone. Sniper still shooting me in my back Me experience a freakin heart attack Make that sh*t with the most itsy bitsy of health. No medkids no nothing At least I lost the sniper But In front of me are 26 men remaining in total war with each other. So I'm trying to sneak by in to this house begging for no enemies and that there are medkits. I find a medkit and I'm like super happy and completely oblivious to the fact that I'm in the middle of an airstrike i sneak out the house. So then death starts raining from above I am basically on life support cause my heart can't take that sh*t. So now I'm running through some epic Micheal bay sh*t to safety. Miraculously I survive that hell and Take cover behind a tree to recover. I slowly start moving towards the remaining 18 dudes. I find a bike and i am thinking hey that's pretty f*ckin neat. So I am now a total badass with my bike crossing through the field but then I hit a bump my bike did a triple backflip and I'm dead So 10 outa 10 best horror game I have ever played.

review: Ok ... so there is a wave on no recomending this game because of the recent add of microtransactions ... as if this will stop microtransactions in the game ... you are not obligated to buy anything to play the game like all other players. The game is fun even to people who dont particularly love PVP like me . This game has issues and bugs that probably will be fixed with time among them the most anoying is the performance that jumps all around and the server lag. Play this with friends if you want a more fun experience play it the way you want ... go tactical and silent or go yolo ... it will be fun either way. I recomend this game it is without any doubt the best BR so far. It seems a bit expensive ... but you have to consider the amount of time and fun you will get out of this ... i even offered it to a couple of friends. So go for it ... it is a must if you enjoy BR styled games .

review: Anyone who has read anything about this crate situation please know that all income from key sales go to charity and to fund a tournament. So not only are they helping out humanity which ya know most people don't they are using this as an opportunity to test crates before they officially release them after the games launch. Which is a win win in my opinion. There's no need to get so personally offended by a company who makes a game you like to the point of raising virtual pitchforks. Take a step back and gain some perspective. No one is out to get you or take advantage of you or force your money out of your wallet into the game developers pockets. They are simply trying to make full use of this oppurtunity for more exposure fullscale testing and donating to a good cause. I'm sure they're fully aware how much money this game has made and will make with the key and crate system. And yet they decided to share it with a charity. That plus the ongoing support for this game they've shown in every aspect from advertising to patches to acknowleding their mistakes and apologizing so openly has proven to me that this team is made up of decent human beings who actually care about the game they're making and the people who play it as well as the people unfortunate enough to not be able to play.Thank you for your time.PS Good luck with your never ending journey devs. We all want this game to succeed. Especially the ones so adamant against the crates otherwise why would they care so much?
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Don't listen to all the nerds crying over micro transactions. They don't have any affect whatsoever on the gameplay and are purely cosmetic items. There also optional!! These are just angry people who are looking for something to complain about. The game is great. It has a bit of a steep learning curve so watch some you tubes or twitch before you jump in so you get the basic idea of it. The Devs have 0 tolerance for cheating which is a breath of fresh air. They update the game often and they are available to chat with on twitch twitter and all social meadia if you just look. Just keep in mind it's an early access game. It's going to have it's problems. But its a hell of a lot better than most AAA titles.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I crap on the naysayers and the complainers about the whole microtransaction system. It really isn't a system either. They are doing a charity even in the month of August during a competition and if you would like to purchase a $2.50 crate for clothes you can put on your character you can. This has no benefit whatsoever to gameplay. Your skill is your skill and that is how you win. I ask what else can you cry about...please get it all out and stop the madness. Evidently your playing the game cause you like it so why dont you just enjoy it and get over it. $30 for the game and that is all you pay if that is all you wanna pay. Now on to gameplay. This game is kickass! Has everything you want in a shooter and brings tons of realistic tactics and tons of suspense. I have not played a game like this that has put me into a nervous wreck since I first played Search and Destroy for COD Modern Warfare 4. Just plain and simple great gameplay. This game is always being worked on and patched. They listen to the community and release content every month. Heck its even in Early Access and it has a huge fan base and player base. That right there speaks volumes for what it is they are doing right.So please think twice about the negative reviews you are giving just because of the pay for a charity event clothing box you get for this month. It has nothing to do with overall gameplay or what this game is. To me that is a huge mistake to give it a bad review based on that merit alone.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The experiences i have had in this game are nothing short of incredible. i've havent been the best player but i still enjoy the game to the fullest. here are some of the moments in the game that i feel really show the quality of this game. while camping in a building i witnessed a teammate phase his jeep through the wall of a house resulting in the near immediate detonation of the vehicle. this sort of freedom is seldom seen in many games. once while storming a house full of enemies i gunned down an enemy. i entered the room which the enemy had fallen upon entering the room i was gunned down by my teammate. seconds later while my teammate was reviving me after his very efficent kill he was gunned down by another one of our teammates. that teammate then fled the house leaving us to bleed out. the ability to formulate effective strategies with your team is another high point of the game. another example of good teamplay is when i was downed behind cover. the enemies couldnt see me allowing my teammate to have an oppurtunity to revive me. however he selflessly focused on shooting the other team while i bled out two feet away from him. my fourth and final experience i believe really highlights the games very solid driving mechanics. while in a dacia with my squad we came across another team and their jeep. they promptly plunged their jeep into the side of our dacia. the jeep pushed us a great distance sideways. after exchanging shots between the two vehicles both detonated catapulting my body a signifanct distance across the map. the game also appropriately gave me credit from the deaths of my teammates. overall the game's focus on realistic combat and physics as well as it's focus on teamplay make the experience a true treasure.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: First of all... I love this game and it blows my mind how much people are playing it right now.. BUUUUUT At the same time it blows my mind that The game is unplayable for people with 8gb of memory card and i5 i myself have problems with FPS on lowest settings with i5 3340 ( not sure exactly if its correct procesor ) 8gb of memory space and GTX 1060 6gb !!! I can run any game without lags even witcher 3 on max settings on 60fps without lag or anything.. Now i know it s not yet finished or at least not in full version but im not completely sure if it s gonna help in any way that i will have stable 60fps with render at start of the game.. So DONT BUY THIS GAME if you dont have enough power in your pc. For me it ruined the game and i hate it.. I really do hate this game for how poorly it is optimized. And dont tell me that go and buy new pc with my PC i should be able to run games for next 3 4 years without problems at max high settings without problems but this unfinished piece of is not able to run properly even on lowest settings.. And i have seen games with much better graphics also not yet released WITHOUT THOSE PROBLEMS AND WITH GOOD OPTIMALIZATION!! Dont waste your time in this game go play something better this game doesnt deserve your attention at least for now only if you have beast pc then you can play it properly but even then physics in this game are also so .. Movement of your character is just crazy when you FLY instead of jump. Running feels like if you were hovering instead of being on the ground like if you were in plane AND IM NOT GONNA TALK ABOUT BLOODY MOTORBIKES!! review: 50/50 review rating and yet it's player count has doubled that of DOTA 2. An astronomical feat that defies the rating system. This review will disapear in a heartbeat under the oceanic stream of hate and love this game is generating. I'd be astounded if it even got one point of acknowledgement. It's skyrocketed to this mainstream status for a reason. Many people are annoyed with the game and give bad ratings but the majority of them got their moneys worth and may even still be playing long after writing their negative two cents. The game has it's low points in many of the fights and you'll die to very unfare situations. But despite this you will crave for another round. It's intense and addicting and few games have matched this consistant and distinct "fear for your life" experience the game gives you. 100 games later and you'll still feel that tension. Especially when you make it to the top ten in a round.If you have a good rig go for it. Otherwise wait till the devs 'optimizational improvments' ceases to be a joke.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: A lot of people are bashing the game right now for its's policy with stream sniping. Plz consider that only those who get banned will ever write a review and the hundrets of thousands of players who just play will never write anything. Also I guess that a lot of the people who were banned "for no reason" in reality actually stream sniped but who would ever admit that right ? The whole things isn't nearly as important in the game as some people in the reviews make you think it is.But now to the game itself Well there is not a lot to say other than that it is a lot of fun. You can play it alone in a duo or in a squad and all of it is great. Performance is not optimal but if you lower the settings in will run well (i7 4770k and R9 290 here). Bugs do exist but they mostly are minor. For a eraly access game this is definitely better than avg. Gameplay can be really punishing and rewarding at the same time. Nothing is comparable to the feeling of being in the late game and getting those sweet kills.Guns feel great and time to kill is well balanced. Better gun balancing than csgo already imo because every gun is at least usable. Meanwhile csgo is able to release 2 stat changes for weapons and hundrets of skins/ year. One of the games I had the most fun with recently was definitely worth selling my Csgo skins for this.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Been playing this game for about 2 months now. Put about 68 hours in and i gotta say I am in love with this game. Such a fun game to play squad or duo with friends. I still have fun playing solo but playing by yourself doesnt give you a chance to be revived when knocked down obviously so i prefer having partners. The team work and strategy involved and the intense interactions with the enemy make this game a blast to play. Winner Winner Chicken Dinner

review: Well in my many hours after not being able to get a refund becasue I waited for the servers to come up for serval minutes and reached my 2hr cap. But in the end this game delievers fun clenching moments from time to time. Other times you have China man over here shooting you across the map not ADS or anything. If thats not an issue for you have fun making friends with the garbage toxic community or try and learn a whole new f**king language becasue you have half othe the foreign countries on your server. Aside from that wonderful note you can also enjoy the many and I mean many unrealistic nonsense bugs. I've gotten stuck on countless things tarps in rocks (which then killed me from falling even though I was on a rock...) even from parachuting I've "Landed" then rubber banded off the building I was on to my death. They still haven't fixed the issue with rubber banding in the begining right after landing. I have issues grabbing ammo and weapons immdeiatly after dropping. Hand motion happens and so does noise but its not obtained in my inv. My main frustration is that amougnst this the Dev's have decieded to release a "Patch" which just place a MICROTRANSACTION system for CLOTHING. So no play to play but after you grind for you BP then blow it on a crate have fun finding out you need a key that costs $2.50USD or sell it on steam for whatever and then get something else...why not fix your game. You have a player count of how many?! Step up and take control Dominate this game. I'd love Dev updates like (Hate to say it don't wanna be that guy but..) Fortnite obviously a whole different game(ish) with a similar concept of BR it has frequent Dev info updates patches issues notification via socail media sources. You can feel the love they are giving out for their game. Could I get some of that with the $30.00USD I spent of this? I spent $30.00USD on the PvE and got EA for the BR for Fortnite Thats way more play time solo (co op) but doesn't have that realistic taste PUBG has and thats why you have me as a player. All together Thumbs Down No Unless on sale.Update PUBG has now been "enhanced by NVIDA GFORCE EXPERIENCE".What I've encountered The game is still full of aim assisted/macro/insta heal hackers and has not gotten any reigon lock what so ever. You play with players around the world who have spiking pings and on death cams you die by a missed shot off by 3 5 inches. Pro jk They added more clothes which are ugly and they still cant optmize their game gotta get that $$$.Update new map coming and they still haven't fixed anything in the game they made optimization worse and it is ing trash. GJ Korean Bluehole devs.

review: After about 65 hours of total gameplay 40 of which has been the last two weeks I can firmly say I'm starting to get decent at the game. It's a fairly difficult game to get good at and I play a lot of FPS/TPS games. Not a lot of bugs left expect for the occational vehicle twitch or your shoot closing early and taking some fall damage. The biggest con to the game right now is all the Asians that flood the NA servers.. I've heard about a region lock (which IMO would make the game 100x better. Not being racist btw) but until that's been put into effect I'd giive the game a 4/5. Very fun challenging and every kill/win feels like an achievment

review: Pro's + Great concept+ Dope graphics+ Awesome gameplay+ A vareity of vehicles and weapons+ Constant updates and patch notes from the devs.+ Lightning fast matchmaking+ Every match is exciting and fun.+ Awesome map design.Con Optimization most computer's will not run this game above Very Low on 60fps straight. Lag dors wont open hard to get into vehicles and most of the time you'll be annoyed because stuff will get stuck. VERY VERY Expensive clothing is it okay to pay 1000$ for some clothes? I don't think so. You'll sometimes get stuck in random objects like chairs tables and such things.For conclusion This is a great game really and I would recommend you to buy it.I think this game has a really great potential and I think in this pace it will be the best selling game of 2017.Don't wait just buy it it's just 30$ and you will enjoy every second I don't promise you a fluent experience and "perfect gameplay" but remember it's an early access game and the devs need more time to solve some issues.Thanks for reading!

review: Awesome game. What can I say I can't stop playing. Already have 418 hours logged at time of writing this review. I can't believe I spent that much time on this game but at the same time it doesnt feel like I did. Maybe that's attributed to how fun the game is or how each game starts off new as opposed to other game where you have to gain experience. The graphics of this game is just right where it isn't all animated or clunky stuffed with bunch of unnecessary visuals. The mechanics are pretty fluid in this game and is very easy to adapt to if you've play any other 1st person shooter on the PC. Updates/patches are coming in just about a weekly basis... adding minor tweaks improving game play. But if I just bought this early access game now I wouldnt have guessed that this game needed any tweaks. In summary I recommend getting this game. Frankly I cant think of a better way to spend $30 on endless fun. Strike that I recommend you having all your friends pick it up since this game is exponentially more fun when you have your own squad to create new shanningans in game and win chicken dinners.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I like this game iam not much good at it but then its still fun to find new bits of the earth that i havent died on. Think i need to get an app done to show all my death locations... going to be one busy map. Good game to play with friends as long as they dont shout at you for getting them killed though this happens less offten now the bikes dont flip up and fly so high to be able to wave at aeroplane pilots when they fall over a blade of grass. I don't get into the anger at the micro transactions i havent made any purchases and more importantly we are not forced to. so if you dont like them ignore them it will make no difference to your game.OK streemers... well i have seen lots of recent reveiws about people getting banned as they "streem sniped" someone. I have a large player base that i play with accross europe and the US and have NEVER come accross this and i have played a few hours more than is healthy for me. I cant see how you can follow soneone on a streem and match that to the Playerunknowns battle you are in. Theres no player list for a start and no surver names to pick its random. I could understand it on Battlefied.... i only learned you could do this today... given it good try and its fun LOL never even occured to me. Sorry to the guy i constantly shot in the back today... even when he changed servers... twice. But i guess if your so stupid that you pubilish your location an actions for the whole world to see you are going to get shot in the bum.To anyone looking to get this game its fun with friends and a bit scary if your going solo. But do not let the negative comments about streemers put you I do not beleive this is happneing frequently and is very over represented on steam reviews at the moment. Developers i think you should ban people for hacking but this streem killing thing is a bit of a silly reason to ban anyone.

review: As a college aged student I can say without a doubt that I have had my fair share of video game experience when it came to my childhood. I used to love playing first person shooters with the friends on console back in the day and after school became more important I started to drift from that unhealthy lifestyle. This platform and blockbuster title of a game has allowed for me to not only rekindle that passion I had for competitive FPS games but wedge some friendly competition in the mix as well. This game will either have you on the edge of your seat ready to jump at the sight of enemy movement or throwing it across the room as you get knocked out by someone from only God knows where. The dynamic enviroment of gunplay in this game is unlike any other I have played. Mixed with character movement such as leaning around obstacles or crawling through thick brush to avoid detection from enemies closeby can make for quite an entertaining exchange of bullets and frustrating callouts such as " He's over there dude!" (As if that helps). This game makes the player feel as though they are legend wether it is saving your teamate from death flying sky high on a dirtbike while sending it over a mountain to make it to the safe zone or even breaking a keyboard because you could have sworn you picked up that gun before the enemy did. Now as for my credibility I have many chicken dinners under my belt as well as some high kill games. Does this mean I still die when 80+ players are alive every now and then? Yes. Does this mean I get frustrated because of latency issues or common bugs? Yes. This game is still an Early Access Title. Don't expect a polished Triple AAA title that can handle any issue at a moments notice. The Devs are working very hard to not only please the player base but entertain them as well. Stop judging the game based off of popular Twitch Streamer's Opinions about viewers chasing them down ingame for an unfair advantage or whatever it may be. The question you should ask yourself is this "Do I want to spend consecutive hours with friends yelling and working together to chase that ever so distant chicken dinner or do I want to go back to the same fps I have invested thousands of hours into with the same guns and boring game mechanics?" Not "man I don't know if I want this game but this Dr. Guy said it is horrible because he died ingame one time" Or "man this grim reaper guy seems really upset that a player honked his horn and drove around his area and got banned so I shouldn't get this game because I don't want to get banned." That is absurd. Judge the game based on the amount of fun you could potentially have or the amount of nail biting heart racing swearing like a sailor victory lap around the computer chicken dinner win streak moments. Don't let controversy over disciplinary actions and judgments handed out by the games developers push you away. Those issues will work themselves out in due time. The fact that I keep coming back to this game and I find the same amount of entertainment as I did when I first started playing it back in may makes me think I will continue to love this game no matter what state it is in. (As long as I find a gun at the start of the round and my latency is fine.) The only bone to pick that I have is for melee weapon balance. If you like close quater melee action this might not be your game. Unless you wield a beloved pan you best run Forrest run because the other melee weapons don't quite fit in to the arsenal just yet. This game could be argued to be unbalanced yet very fair and walking that thin line is what makes it so fun. The player decides his or her fate not the weapon balance or gameplay mechanics. Over time players will learn tricks and tactics to give themselves the advantage no matter what is thrown at them and that is why I believe this game will truly make you a legend. Go try this game it costs half the amount of popular titles now a days and yet in this game you can open the crates for cosmetic items over time for free just based on points you earn from your performance ingame. Nothing feels more rewarding then winning a game and getting free clothes that make you look like a pimp from a different era.

review: 这个游戏 最大的败笔在于GI 非常难以理解拥有极其强大的GI系统的UE引擎 为什么间接光效果可以这么差 后处理效果也都是UE自带的老的那一套 性能低效果差 在光照上如果开发者尽可能使用距离控制的阴影贴图 将远处的阴影使用光照贴图进行模拟 烘焙 在近处使用清晰的实时阴影 即使需要使用更多内存 内存总比1080TI便宜吧 也能大大降低渲染成本 不至于上个山那么卡 同时室内可不可以不要用秘制光照啊 技美大佬走点心吧 窗口用点平面光什么的不好么 您就麻烦一点让我们别那么辣眼睛成不 再贵20块钱也可以接受啊 一句话概括这款游戏 新鲜的主题配上外包般的开发

review: I have purchased several copies of this game for friends. I give it two thumbs and a big smiley face. I have great hopes for this game despite its many current issues. This game has the potential to be a (s)team gaming juggernaut. That being said up until this release there have been many issues including stabilitysynchronizationwildly varied pings in game leading to "pusher favoring" in almost every situationabysmal frame ratesrubber bandingseeming inconsistent weapon characteristics and ballisticscomplete lack of any arena where one might practice combat before facing the hordes of experienced players waiting to eat noobs. h I really like this game and I hope it succeeds. h

review: I bought this game back in august of 2017 when it was full of glitches and bugs and hackers. With the release of 1.0 now it's safe to say this game is worth it now. One of my favorite multiplayer shooters especially in first person mode. Still plenty of hackers and bugs and server lag but massively improved apon by the develpopment team even from a month ago. All I can hope for is that they continue to make new additions and clean it up as time goes on. Well worth the money.

review: The core game is great especially with friends. A few buddies and I all bought the game around the same time and play it nightly together.The game still needs some work but it has serious potential. For a game that has one map and one mode experiences can vary each round. Whenever you win one you'll feel like you truly accomplished something but it's heartbreaking to lose at the end as well.The game is fun and I think you'd enjoy it as long as you're aware that it still needs work and isn't fully optimized which means it may not run smooth. It's getting better after each patch so they're definitely going in the right direction.Yes microtransactions are in the game. It's for one loot box and cosmetic only. Sure it sucks but I don't plan on buying it so it doesn't affect me. It isn't pay to win which is what is truly important.

review: This game was my everything when I first got it. I thought it was a great intense game with a lot of action and I really enjoyed it. But overtime things just got worse and worse. The game is filled with bugs such as getting off your bike and dying instantly climbing through a window and dying to falling and other things that are total BS. The devs of this game dont care about the community of players. They only care about money meaning every cheater they ban they want them to just buy another copy it makes them money. The lack of updates is laughable this game is dead devs dont care what they're community wants. No new guns maps game modes. If you want a good battle royale experience play Fortnite or The Hunt Showdown both are fresh and upcoming and unique.Dont buy this game. Period.

review: For me this game runs pretty well and although it's buggy (UI refresh button even) it's still very fun to play. Even solo can be enjoyable as the game incorporates interesting weapon styles and aspects. Be warned though as it's not for everyone and is still unfinished meaning there are many problems which some may deem unbearable (not kidding). It's fun Battle Royal Makes you feel good if you place well Variety of weapons Big map with interactive environmental structureHOWEVER This game is in early access it is not finished at all Some people will experience horrible and annoying glitches Some people will not have a good server experience There is a lot of camping and annoying sniping There seems to be a problem for others of gettign banned innapropriately Not many of these things affect me but they could have an effect on youSo I'd suggest to wait a bit to see if this game goes on sale and is finished.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

The game is not smooth enough you need double SLI 1080 Ti for this thing to work on more than 50fps on medium.(its a meme ofc).Now lets talk about positive sides! review: Very fun for those who enjoy co op slow to fast pace tactical shooters. Its multiplayer maps are very large making egagements fun and challenging at the same time. While the game has a good core basis the game falls flat with its buggy lobbies. These range from the game randomly shuttting down to just getting kicked from lobbies for no reason. The game also has a very obvious hacking problem. This becomes clear after only about an hour of playtime. While these are major problems that the developers should adress I can not fault the core gameplay itself for these issues. It is a fun to play game and I would certainly recommend to players.

review: Pubg is by far the best survival game. U can solo duo and squads of 4 team players. You start off by parachuting into the island and gathering equipment. Eliminating any enemies that you counter. Trying to reach the spot when your the last survival player on the island. You get rewarded with alot of Battle Points. Battle Points The battle points that you gain from a game depends on what your playing. If your in a solo game then your recieving more points than you would in duo and squad games. Squads If your teaming with friends or online friends into a Q for pubg. Team communications is key. As I reviewed with R6S and CS GO. Team communication and making sure you get the callouts is the most important thing ever. If you have a teamate getting shot at and there not giving the call out then your not able to assist him. Overall this is a wonderful game to get if your into survival games. Make sure you also have friends that will or already have this game. As it will get boring playing by yourself after a while.I do recommend people to get this game. D
