review: It's a fun game but maybe once it moves out of early access (although there's no guarantee these days that dev's fix things once they do). Optimization is probably the worst I've ever experienced really terribly optimized is an understatement. The servers are also extremely laggy (unplayable during peak hours) given the size of the playerbase you'd think they would make something like this a priority but it isn't. If you're ok with spending more time in the lobby trying to get a stable game then this is pretty much the game for you!

review: While a great deal of players are having fun with this game tye fact of the matter is that it has some pretty major lingering issues. The server tick (the rate at which the game world is updated for players) is abysmally low. This is a core issue that will affect litterally everything you try to do in the game. Other issues with object hitboxes and collision have been becoming apparent as well. It's not unheard of to be able to shoot through a fence one way but not the other. Or to be able to crouch jump through some walls of houses.If you're one of the twelve people on Earth that haven't purchased this game yet just wait. Let the rest of us ride this one out for you until these issues get sorted out.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: *Overview*In my honest opinion the game's been going downhill.The streamers have been overhyping it to death ignoring the real problems with the game.The gunplay is pretty great but you'll get the same gunplay experience from the Arma series.The community has major problems including hackers.*More Detail*The real problems with the game are 1. The fact that the game feels extremely repititive when playing solo. This is negated somewhat when playing with friends as you have people to mess with but playing by yourself in any of the modes shows the other flaws. 2. The game rewards camping. The circle while being a good idea to keep players enclosed makes 3 gameplay types possible/relevant. They are either dying super early in a large city going to some place to run all game or just camping for as long as possible. In the community aspect the developers and community staff are more focused on skins new weapons that do nothing to change the game and hosting ridiculous amounts of "professional tournaments" for a game that is casual for many reasons including the fact that practicing a weapon WILL get you killed. Plus the crybaby streamers can get ANYBODY banned by telling devs that a person who killed them in a game is "stream sniping." Onto a more positive note the gunplay is great. The bullet drop feels accurate most of the guns handle well but things like aimduels to test your skills with the gunplay are virtually non existent. Last note about dev team they are quite self righteous they tried to attack Epic Games for making a Battle Royale game.*Glitches*The glitches in this game are either godawful or downright hilarious. You can either get extreme lag and such or you could get a glitch where all of the buildings become invisible and allow you to move through them (even with vehicles!). They can REALLY make the game fun if they happen or destroy the game.*Conclusion*The game has some fun moments but the community and corporation (yes PUBG corp. is a thing somehow) are the main destroyers of the game's fun. Also get this game only if you are going to play with friends. Playing without them makes the game far less enjoyable.If you've made it this far congratulations! You have made it through my incessant ramblings that took way too long to express through text. Thank you for reading.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: OVER 1.5 million playersI'll preface this review by saying Battlegrounds by no means complete not well optimized in it's current state. However that does not mean it is unenjoyable or unplayable. Despite my short amount of time in game I can confidently say is much better than it's counterpart H1Z1 King of the Kill for a number of reasons 1. Its weapon variety is much healthier and (somewhat) balanced in customability strengths and weaknesses (and will evidently grow in number).2. Some central mechanics of the game are much more realistic and less buggy in comparison to its counterpart (you can't jump out of cars that are flying at the speed of light and live weapons actually hit where you aim at least along the vertical axis bullet drop is a thing!). 3. There are tons of servers already and they are more often than not at least playable (I've only had one account of having to leave the game due to horrendous lag).4. Graphically it's a beautiful game at its highest settings although it is nearly impossible to play with said settings effectively due to poor optimization and thus FPS issues/inconsistencies.5. The Steam Market already includes the game's in game skins and items available to characters another thing worth noting here is that it's relatively easy to earn "Reward Points" from simply playing the game. With this you can gradually purchase crates which will randomly drop said skins.6. The game actually feels fun and fair to play. There are a minute number of instances that feel like I was killed due to poor game design or exploitations.

I honestly hate the devs for STILL after several months not introducing the map choice option. ing freaks seriously.The only reason I can think of for not introducing such a feature is that most people will then choose only one of the 2 maps (guess which one) and there won't be enough people on the second... SO ING WHAT the map is a failure imo just live with it and go on make another map or just delete the desert if you're so afraid. Anyway it's just my own speculations. review: This is by far one of the most exciting battle royale games I've ever played! Go in solo group up as a double team or simply as an entire squad. Though the game is still in early access its very much in stable condition. No FPS drops no connection drops though the hitboxing/latency is a bit sketchy as I can sometimes be hit from around a corner before I physically see the character move around the corner. This is a rare occurrence though. A lot of adrenaline moments when trying to survive as a group or even alone. Much better then H1Z1 or DayZ as those games always appeared to be a battle royale type of game to me even though they are zombie survivals. Getting started in the game is easy. No spending hours looking for loot no spending hours trying to group up with your friends. No zombies to get in your way. Also did I mention the map is FREAKIN HUGE!? For 100 players per match the map size is perfect. I do hope to see more weapons in the future as it appears to only have a little over a dozen weapons rifles smgs Assault Rifles shotguns and pistols. Though the selection is great nonetheless. I am glad they have minimized sniper rifles (One bolt action rifle) in the game at least for now as with as many open fields this map has It would suck being taken out without the ability to return fire. I look forward to seeing this game develop. For an early access title its very addicting especially with surviving with a group of friends.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

You dont see people complaining about Overwatch crate system or Call o Duty crate system. As far as reporting and getting banned that doesnt make sense. This is a game where you can do what you want. when you want. If you wanna honk a horn every second and die 1 minute later go for it. Shouldnt get banned for that. Gameplay to me is just amazing i bought this game a week ago and havnt touched a single other game since. It's really addicting it really is. Maybe chinese players can lighten up and grow a pair and have some fun? but again its an amazingly fun game. Again i dont care for the crates who really cares with all the other games having the same thing. Just ignore it. and if you want cosmetic gear the nspend the 2 5$ dont cry about it.

review: Product received for free. I like this game. I really do. But they can burn for being greedy and adding loot crates for cash. Companies these days are all cash grabs after the initial price you pay for the game....and also not just that but they even said themselves they wouldnt add crates until at LEAST the launch of the game. Reasons they added it this early? High player base more potential money to be made while it lasts...I think this game will lose a lot of players soon if they dont stop with this nonsense. They have time to add loot crates but not worry about the more important issues...FIX THE DAMN BUGS FIRST BEFORE YOU START CHARGING FOR CRATES!!! Greedy greedy scums. They are giving themselves a bad name.I love how the reviews for this game were about 90% positive when I last looked. Now it's at a mixed with a meer 68% and I'm sure that will drop even more...Like i said they are ruining their own game and forcing bad feedback from the public.Good job developers way to up something unique that you had.That's all I have to say.

review: As other users have mentioned possibly the best Battle Royale (and possibly best looking) game in it's genre.My only complaint is that view distance is shocking to the point that grass and shrubs don't matter if you're prone within them as anything after a couple hundred metres completely disappears leaving the landscape bare. This wouldn't be an issue if half the map didn't contain frequent cover available in grass/bushes/shrubs &amp wheat but it is... So until either the devs decide to lower all grass to ankle length or make the grass static/lower quality and increase the current view distance as a standard the rule of thumb is if you get a scope and a half decent weapon your life expectancy will triple.Other then that I still think the games pretty awesome and would recommend it but just be prepared for some salty times ahead and remember it's still in early access stages )

review: Masterpiece. I'm fascinated by the sound design in this game from the ambient outdoor noises to distinguishing distant gunshots to hearing people pad around outside the house you're hiding in or thump around several floors above you opening and closing doors. You rely on sound so much and then the rain comes and takes away everything almost like sensory deprivation. Every match is memorable. 11/10

The RNG is pretty bad to say it nicely and the game has just gone down hill. Will you enjoy it if you get it maybe. But you will pull your hair out the rest of the time and think to myself why I am doing this. What is wrong with me. Wait to see if the game ever gets finished before getting it. Maybe then it can match up and have consistent gameplay like other games of the same genre. Even FORTNITE which is trash has more consistent gameplay. That should say something about this game.

review: Playerunknown's Battlegrounds is a fantastic game highly competitive without inducing extreme toxicity due to PvP elements. Matches are fast paced and although the rewards are extremely limited it still feels gratifying to take a shot to the backside only to have it deflected by a frying pan turning around and shooting that attacker down with a pistol.Now for the downside. Customization is more limited than I'd prefer (but that's personal preference and I like making myself bearded and ugly) and the most important part the hackers/botters. Unfortunately there's a hacker/aimbotter in every 8 or so games who are easily noticeable after they take down your squad with headshot after headshot. It's unfortunate since it takes from the enjoyability of the game but all the same the game is still fun when you get people who don't cheat.I can only assume the hackers are doing this for the Battlepoints in order to earn items to sell for actual cash on the marketplace. The moment the Bluehole team get this hacking situation sorted out the better it'll be for everyone. Or at least remove the monetary system making it unprofitable for hackers.If you're a hacker/botter and you're reading this thanks for the memories and the recordings.If you're a good honest and dependable player reading this thank you for being a top bloke/sheila. I love you. Have my children.

review: While this game seems to catch a bad rap for the "hackers" said "hacker" encounters (for me at least) have been very few I typically see less on here than I do many other games. The game can be pretty aggrivating at times and takes a while to get used to certain mechanics there are some crashing issues not all of which I would blame on Bluehole knowing that UE4 can be pretty wonky at times for no reason.At times the game can feel more like a lottery drawing due to the random loot distribution (One house can only spawn a crowbar vs the house nextdoor that spawned a M4A1 and a SCAR with full attachments nearby) but that's not really a huge issue.However with the right group of friends who laugh at you for not being able to hit air it's an enjoyable game with relatively few issues mostly reliant on sound luck and clicky skill.I recommend it.

Even though i doubt that Weapon Skins and Emotes helped the game.Yes the movement still feels unfinished and spongy. The Server is still kinda ... well it's still 17hz.FPS got improved extremely. &gt 1080Ti i7 7700k 16gb RAM 100 144FPS depending on location at ultra preset. (Even though i still recognize some drops down to 60 75 in bigger cities) I highly doubt that Bluehole will learn something out of their mistakes.It's a truely great game but it's way too slow in developtment. review: 28 hours into the game. And i love it!It's a fun game to play alone and with friends.Now an important question H1Z1 or pubgWell besides these games are both in the same genre they are different.H1Z1 arcade/casual kinda game. Does have an "competitve" scene though.But if you are looking for a game which has fast gameplay and is ton of fun too go for H1Z1Pubg casual/competitve kinda game. Also has an competitve scene coming upBut if you are looking for a game with more realistic arma kinda battle this game is right for you.Pros/conscons performance issues cars are glitchy melee is really bad pans are op kappapros fun semi realistic looks great for a battle royale gameAnd last but not least"They said there wouldn't be bought content in game during early access"Calm your guys/girls and gender neutral people these so called microtransactions aren't pay2win or anything like that. Its about boxes like in csgo which you can open with a key and there comes a skin out of it which can be very valuable or not. You are not forced to buy them there is no need to buy them. So all the negative reviews about microtransactions are not fair its doesnt improve your gameplay in anyway.So the conclusion is BUY THIS GAME YOU PIECE OF SHET

review: I'm not a "good" player. I've also only got about 5 hours played in this game (thus far). I've played Rust DayZ and H1Z1 prior to this. They are all similar (genre). This seems to be the "most polished" of the set but YMMV. For me personally I'm sure it would be a blast if you had friends to play with. As a solo player it basically breaks down to this first 1 2 minutes in lobby. Jump out of a plane. Either find a weapon or die within first couple minutes. Next 10 15 minutes you're looting/running...possibly driving if you get lucky and find a ride. Match is now down to 20 people. Run/hide for the next few minutes. Get to last couple zones 10 15 ppl remaining. Be sneaky (or think you are being sneaky) get a kill. Get killed. Rinse and repeat. Best game I've had was 5 kills and down to 11 people. So basically if you enjoy the genre already definitely buy the game. If you have several friends who play the game and want you to play buy it. I'd love to do squad or duos but no friends solo. Good luck enjoy.

review: So...it's finally released and turns out to still be a big dissapointment (not surprising tbh). Even after it's early access sky highs and rock bottom lows this game STILL hasn't keeled over yet. There are so many things wrong with it I'm not even happy to have this stain in my library. The terrible optimisation perfectly timed desync and just purely bad design.If you don't know what PUBG is that is probably for the best because it is pretty much H1Z1 KotK just slightly improved and even that sounds like I'm giving them too much credit than what they deserve.I understand that they're trying to go for that 'realistic' shooter design like Arma 3 (which was originally a mod for) but as far as I'm concerned it just doesn't work with everything wrong with it. It has created more issues than it does trying to fix but since it's PUBG it is technically "fixed".Optimisation. The key thing that should happen in any game to reduce stress on your PC. It took them SO long to actually "fix" that issue and even still it is dodgy. It's like putting duct tape on a broken finger and saying everything will be fine now. Just for a side note I'm not certain for other players if it is still just as bad as before but for me personally I can see the difference from months ago to now. The biggest joke I thought I'd never see in my life was the fact that they were developing a 2nd map when the 1st map is still in a horrible shamble. Okay so the optimisation is bad but what about the desync?Well about the desync.........Sorry I was reconnecting. Don't know if that was the servers or just my terrible Aussie internet. For the poor unfortunate souls that have played this like me the desync is still kicking me from behind. Ever dropped down from a building from a height that doesn't damage you but then suddenly get launched into the ground and then take damage? That's pretty much half of my play time if not from terrible hitboxes. As far as I'm concerned the desync issue won't be going away anytime soon unfourtunately.If you're a person about a good community that is supportive to new players and all about fun. This is definitely not the place for you. Best way to describe it is that is the literal embodiment of the Twitch chat of someone playing this game. Just stale memes and "funny" racist remarks. I only find it funny because of how much of a cluster it is and not what's being shouted out like I'm at a violent riot. It's just toxic and annoying to the point that all of the waste out in the ocean is cleaner than this.So what's my take on PUBG? It's that has been polished. Nothing much more than that. You're better off trying to pull off a fidgit spinner meme or putting up your Christmas decorations than playing this letalone buy it. It really is not worth the time and hassle to try to enjoy it. If I were to give you money and tell you to go buy yourself something nice I'd mean it because this game sure as hell ain't nice.I was originally going to put up my review when the mass negative reviews happened but I couldn't be bothered to put up then until the full release of PUBG which was the final straw.Those are my final thoughts about PUBG that have been delayed for months.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is not recommended. First of all the optimization of this game is very poor. Then many plugins game developers don't have a good way to handle it. In addition to apologizing game developers have no other solution. Finally the ping value is locked and the locked area is disguised so that the player can only match the player in the corresponding area. 不建议这个游戏 首先 这款游戏的优化程度很差 然后很多插件 游戏开发者没有一个好的方法来处理它 除了道歉之外 游戏开发者没有其他解决方案 最后 ping值被锁定 使得玩家只能匹配相应区域中的玩家 Эта игра не рекомендуется. Прежде всего оптимизация этой игры очень плохая. Тогда у многих плагинов разработчиков игр нет хорошего способа справиться с этим. В дополнение к извинениям у разработчиков игр нет другого решения. Наконец значение ping заблокировано и заблокированная область замаскирована так что игрок может только соответствовать игроку в соответствующей области.

review: Why didn't you buy this game already.Are you bad at first person shooters? If so buy this game. This is the one game where being good won't save your skin. Being a tactical genius and getting lucky will. The bugs and mistakes will leave you gasping for breath at how funny they are the kills are rewarding and the multiplayer element is excellent.Every experience from your first punch kill to running through Vietnam Flashbacks I mean Red Zones to looting a drop crate is a pulse pounding experience.Queues are lightning fast fashion is built in via trading or in match pickups weapons are RNG based and fair. If you don't have this game you are making a mistake with your life.

review: I Definitely recommend this game to everyone Let me preface this entire review with the fact that this is an early access game therefore anything that is said is subject to change as of 9.4.17With that said Let's get started with the actual game review. PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS (PUBG) is a battle royale 100 players open world MMOFPS/TPS set on a massive 8x8km land. The game supports solo duo and squad (3 4 ppl) play. Gameplay is very straightforward you hop off a plane loot weapons armors and equipments from buildings and survive the thrilling PvP bloodbath. The Goods 1. This game is an adrenaline dump. You will get into some really heated firefights and when you actually win my god you will just scream. 2 This game is very fun with friends or without (Although I'd prefer playing with a couple friends that I know well. 3. Great gameplay concept. No pay to win and no grind to win. Apparels are only cosmetics.4. Highly Demanding of teamwork. You aren't Robocop able to kill 4 people by yourself (You could but it's very difficult to do so unless you're C9's Shroud). Instead it heavily relies on teamwork and being able to focus down a target. 5. You can play this game in a Third Person/ First Person hybrid mode. Or straight up First person only mode. 6. Performance issues are being resolved with a constantly updated game. Very noticeable that the devs are taking extra time into making sure this game can run well. 7. There are multiple weapons to find Various Vehicles and the gameplay is challenging but also rewarding The Okay 1. The community can be toxic at times. Easily fixed with a simple ctrl+y command though. 2. The Lag is noticeable but it's not so bad to the point where you're going to be teleporting everywhere 24/7. The servers could use some adjusting.3. The game can be repetitive. At the end of the game it's the same thing. You get a gun hope to god someone doesn't have a better one and hide till top 10. 4. AFKers can have a negative connotation towards this game but that gives even more incentive to play your best to get better rewards. (Plus you can always kill the AFK to get even more money) The bad 1. The game is still very highly demanding of your PC. I have a couple friends that have a GTX 1060 but textures still take a while to load for them only for them to realize that they need more RAM. I have a semi old GPU (R9 390X) but I still load faster than them because I have 16 gigs while my friends have 8. The specs they have listed here will barely give you 15 20FPS I'd recommend getting a more updated GPU and more RAM.2. Melee weapons are terribly inaccurate. Aiming also can be a bit off sometimes. Possibly caused by the server lag.3. Vehicles flips too easily and difficult/too unrealistic to drive4. Door and movement bugs seem to be quite prevalent lately. Whenever I move a step ahead the game throws me back 3 steps backwards. Seems to be affecting the entire server whenever it happens. Invisible doors also prevent players from entering a building throwing us outdoors whenever we try to enter a building. Similar to fps spikes these happen randomly.5. The initial drop can be a bit annoying at times The fact is that you THINK you land in a certain spot but you can get stuck on a ing corner of a building then when you finally drop you get thrown across the map.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBattlegrounds Pros and Cons Weapon Opinions items Pros and Cons Pros Fast Paced and Adrenaline pumping gameSkill based/(kind of) easy to learn hard to masterPrefferene style weapons (wide variety/every weapon is good to a limit)Almost perfectly balanced (see cons)Long lasting games (Pro and Con depending on your view)Optimization every dayBug fixes every weekNew content Big optimization update every month Cons Shotguns are currently a little bit buggyHackers (even if they're are not many)Not fully optimized (low end systems such as mine have trouble running the game (see pc specs and my settings)(Personal Opinion) Would be nice if there were more tiers to armor In game items and what i think of them Note that this section is based on my personal opinion and it is not likely that you should agree Assault Rifles M416 Semi auto/Full auto assault rifle short medium and long range.I mostly use it for short range but i will also use it for long range if i feel the need Weapon Rating 8/10 M16A4 Burst fire/Semi auto assault rifle medium to long range short range if you can click fast enough low recoil and if you can click fast high fire rate. Weapon Rating 10/10 AKM Semi auto/Full auto assault rifle although full auto has a slow fire rate medium recoil easy to learn relatively hard to master. Weapon Rating 9/10 SCAR Semi auto/Full auto assault rifle good for any range deadly when suppressed.easy gun to learn relatively easy to master Weapon rating 10/10 Machine Guns Vector Semi auto/Full auto Shred through your opponents with this tiny beast at 13 rounds a mag it c an still destroy you. Weapon Rating 10/10 UMP9 Semi auto/Full auto Machine gun good for short medium range 2nd Favorite Machine gun. Weapon Rating 9/10 UZI Semi auto/Full auto Machine gun good for short range nothing much else unless you can truly master it.My least favorite Machine gun. Weapon Rating 5/10 Tommy gun Semi Auto/Full auto Machine gun good for short to medium range and its 100 round mag makes it worthy enough for your enemies to cower for it or kill you for it. Weapon Rating 10/10 M249 Semi Auto/Full auto Heavy Machine gun good for all ranges best for medium to long range.Easily the favorite gun of many but i dislike it slightly. Weapon Rating 8/10 /h1 Shotguns S1897 Easily my favorite shotgun 5 rounds and easy to use usually a two shot. Weapon Rating 9/10 S686 2nd favorite shotgun double barrel (two rounds)alot of damage. Weapon rating 8/10 S12K Least favorite shotgun 5 rounds shoots about as fast as you can click extremely overpowered and i believe they will nerf it. Weapon Rating 6/10 Pistols R1895 Semi auto revolver slow fire rate good deal of damage but not good in general. Weapon Rating 3/10 P1911 Semi Auto Pistol decent fire rate decent damage my favorite pistol. Weapon Rating 5/10 P92 (basically a peashooter) Horrible pistol in my opinion but many people are good with it i will leave this to you to decide. Weapon Rating 3/10 Yes i saved the best for last! Sniper Rifles! /b Kar 98 (Karabiner 98 Kurz) Bolt action Sniper Rifle Usually a two shot i would take an Assault rifle over it but it is still good if you know how to use it. Weapon rating 8/10 SKS Semi auto sniper rifle very good in my opinion high recoil easy to learn hard to master. Weapon Rating 9/10 M24 Rated the 2nd best gun in the game i believe it to be so easy to use and relatively hard to master. Weapon rating 12/10 AWM Rated the Best gun in the game it is definetly not a good thing to be caught surprised by this gun Extremely powerful and extremely deadly (best used if suppressed )) Weapon Rating 15/10 Armor grenades and Healing items Armor in order of worst to best Helmets Lvl one helmetLvl two helmetLvl three helmet(i wonder if you can guess which one is best) (3rd is in case you didnt know) Healing items in order of worst to best BandagesEnergy Drink (helps you run faster +moderate healing over time)Painkillers (Healing over time)Adrenaline shot (healing and full energy bar)First aid kit (instant healing to 75 HP)Med kit (Full healing) Note that you cannot heal above 75hp unless you use Energy Drink Painkillers Adrenaline Shot or Med Kit. Grenades Frag GrenadeMolotov CocktailSmoke GrenadeStun Grenade Misc Items Choke (longer shotgun range)Compensator (AR S12K Sniper rifles Machine guns.)Surpressor (AR S12K Sniper rifles Machine guns.)Red Dot SightHolographic Sight2x Scope4x Scope8x Scope15x ScopeThis review has taken me some time to write please say that this helped you.

review: The sad tale of the struggle between man woman and time. All told brilliantly through metaphorical symbolism within less than 30 minutes.The moment you jump from the plane symbolizes a new birth (or reincarnation if you believe that dumb stuff). You and 99 others (some you may call friends) arrive in this new world with the same instinct kill and take. This has plagued humankind throughout history as the strong carry out their will over the meek and useless. The beginning was no different as roaming tribes sought others to 'take' if they had the strength or courage to.As time progresses battles turn from fist and pistols to rifles and SMGs. Armor and helmets are slapped on as war for the White Circle begins. Many die in the process some never make it as the Blue Death claims them. What the circles mean I do not know for they could be hunger and fear... or something worse.In the end the last few fight over one simple thing a simple measly chicken dinner. We imagine humanity dying out in a blaze of glory but what if this is the truth of our future? Killing hundreds around you just for food to survive in a sad harsh world as you devour your meal alone (or with 3 friends).... but you gotta admit it's a damn good chicken dinner.

review: My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him "If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate you have to stop immediately." Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me "Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family trough what your Grandfather put us trough ." I agreed. At 28 I have never touched a cigarette. I must say I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it because this game gave me cancer anyway.

review: Don't waste your money on this "full release" of the game. Despite what the dev team claims this is should not be titled a "fully released" version of the game. I've put a little over 63 hours into Pubg and during those hours at least or nearly half of my playtime has been restarting the game/ my computer after it crashes. Pubg has a rediculous amount of bugs issues and crashes for a title that claims to be out of alpha/beta. Pubg crashes way to frequently to the point where it feels like a chore to play and reopen the game. Plus you need a pretty high end computer to run this game smoothly I have the GTX 970 and I have trouble running this game at a smooth framerate sadly I've put too many hours to request a refund for this game Since I cant entirely play the game due to a legitiment lack of optimization this game has it's been sitting in my library for some time now. Point being Dont make the same mistake I did and think this was an actual "Full release" and waste your money on optimization issues and frequent crashes that this game offers. Until the devs better optimize and fix the constant crashing don't waste your time.

review: Dear Bluehole/PUBG I have a suggestions. Match players based on a language selection. I find it rediculous that 8 out of 10 games on the North American server I am paired with people who don't speak english. I imagine this is because their own location servers are over run? Whatever it is not my concern what is my concern is that I am not able to enjoy the gaming experince as I can't work with my team as the game intends.I am honestly surprised a solution for this hasn't already been released. I can only imagine that either what is left of your english speaking staff don't play the game anymore or you just dont care.Haven7952Perhaps this would be better received in a bluehole language (let's go google translate...)亲爱的Bluehole / PUBG 我有一个建议 根据语言选择匹配玩家 我发现在北美服务器的十场比赛中 有八场比赛是和我不搭配英语的人搭配的 我想这是因为他们自己的位置服务器已经过度运行了 无论如何 这不是我所关心的 我担心的是我无法享受博彩体验 因为我不能像游戏那样与我的团队合作 我真的很惊讶 这个解决方案尚未公布 我只能想象 你说英语的工作人员什么都不再玩游戏 或者你不在乎 or친애하는 Bluehole / PUBG 나는 제안을했다. 언어 선택에 따라 플레이어를 매치시킵니다.북미 서버에서 10 게임 중 8 게임 영어를 사용하지 않는 사람들과 쌍을 이룬다는 것은 어리석은 짓입니다. 자신의 위치 서버가 끝났기 때문에 이것이라고 상상합니까? 어쨌든 그건 내 관심사가 아니다. 내 관심사는 내가 게임 의도대로 내 팀과 일할 수 없기 때문에 나는 게임 경험을 즐길 수 없다는 것이다.나는 솔직히 이것에 대한 해결책이 이미 공개되지 않은 것에 놀랐다. 나는 영어로 말하는 직원 중 남은 것이 게임을 더 이상 사용하지 않거나 신경 쓰지 않는다고 상상할 수 있습니다.

review: Brilliant Battle Royale game PUBG stands above the other games/mods due to it having more realism than other alternatives (h1z1 for example). The realism allows for different ways to play in simple terms being aggressive or passive or stealthy. Although you can do this in other games I feel asif playing passive is more effective in PUBG. These options make the game more replayable and make you want to carry on playing. Another thing which is great is the ability to choose where you drop wether thats choosing to drop into a large village/town to get more loot but also have more people to fight or the choice to drop out of the way to get smaller amounts of loot at first but having less risk due to not as many people around you.Overall PUBG is a brilliant battle royal game which gives alot of replayability whether that is with a friend a squad or solo.

review: This is the new version of H1Z1. It's a lighthearted game with friends but if you want to get better you have to take it a little more serious. It's not at all like other battle royales where you're constantly diving in and out of matches almost mindlessly with little reward for achieving #1 9. This game actually challenges you to do better or at least it did when you could sell and trade crates with others. The asking price is also a lot higher than other games in the same genre considering most are free (Fortnite Radical Heights H1Z1) but what you get is a consistent game that's starting to shine with the polish Bluehole (B***hole?) is applying. Aside from the joke it's not a turd although you can polish one... (the more you know!) Oh yeah there are problems with hackers like all online games but they claim to be working on it. Then again the developer doesn't seem to listen to the community still no name changes for those unfortunate enough to choose a bad name or have a friend choose it for them... neither any fixes for old issues but there is an ever increasing amount of greed via in game purchases at least we get a free emote wheel right?

review: I wanted to like the game really did I most likely will continue to "give it a try" until I accept the fact I away my money on this. It's an unfinished game simply put it will never be finished the money has been made and there's few new customers to attract at this point. This is the product of "early access hype" an unfinished game.Pros I love the ideaMatches start up quick and you jump right in if you die no big deal in 2 mins you'll be back inLooks pretty damn good visually.Wide array of weapons/armorCons Horrible hit detection no by far the worst hit detection I've seen ever. Players sometimes must lag a moving target rather than lead them with sights to get a hit reticle on scopes are pretty much for show.Useless items (eg smoke grenade is client side only)A number of hackers/cheaters not nearly as bad as I had heardNo default account region automatically is set to Asiatic on initial startup because it's alphabetical(?)LagPointless lootbox tSave your time and money this game is unfinished and will never be finished it will die before then and theyve already made millions upon millions of dollars on this and won't put out a finished product. The idea they expanded to console before fixing bugs on PC pisses me off the most just another cash grab. Could've been awesome but it's just another stale meme game.

review: The FPS is terrible even with a 1070 and i7 and the animations are clunky and slow. How well you do depends 1/3 on RNG 1/3 on individual skill and 1/3 on whether or not someone snipes you from across the map. If you like spending 30 minutes looting and running around only to be forced towards someone else's cover spot because of bad zone RNG this game is for you. If you like landing in high loot areas and then dying within 30 seconds because the guy next to you found a scar and all you have is a machete this game is for you. If you like having great starts with good loot and then getting shot down 5 minutes later from someone you had no chance of seeing or reacting to this game is for you. If you enjoy dying from randomly flipping motorcycles this game is for you. Otherwise you will probably find this game cancerous.

review: Although getting into a game is a chore for me "Infinite Loading Screen" once i get in to the game after i do my regular fix of restarting my router and verifying integrity of game cache. I face no issuess at all its amazing for an early access game and i never got bored.We were playing as a party of 4 and all landed on the bunker area together but one enemy player was ahead of us and ran in. He had no choice but to find a weapon and try too kill us. We were like Orcs we ran and tried to punch the crap out of him. He grabbed a weapon and managed to get a few shots but paniced as 4 people kept punching him. Anyways if you see 4 people chasing you and your friends abandoned you just run. Dont be like him ) Search on youtube PlayerUnkown Battlegrounds 4 v 1 melee vs gun and enjoy a laughAs for the dev PLEASE FIX THE INFINITE LOADING SCREEN when i join a game. Also keep up the good work

review: Update as of the end of May 2018 It's been a little over a year of owning this game for me and so much has changed in that time. I've read the negative reviews of people comlpaining about there still being hackers crippling lag and broken game mechanics. I'm running an asus laptop with a 950M mobile card a 4th gen i7 and a 256GB SSD. It's a pretty softcore gaming setup to say the least but nonetheless I havent dealt with broken game mechanics(barring your occasional vehicle glitched into the ground but this is pretty rare) performance issues or bad lag in the past several months of playing this game. I haven't encountered a hacker in several months either. Granted there's always things to improve *cough* hard region lock *cough* but for those complaining about this game being the biggest gaming atrocity since DayZ (See first review) I simply don't see it. Perhaps Epic is paying Fortnite players to slander PUBG or perhaps I'm the luckiest person in the world in regards to lag and bugs both of which I doubt I simply don't understand the mob of negative reviews of this game. Theres always more to be done and there will never be 0 Hackers in this game or any game but to those seeing the bad side of this game rest assured it's far from the league of legends level cancer that everyone is whining about...May 2017 Review It's like playing Dayz except there's no zombies the game runs a bit better and you don't have to loot for 3 hours...Really though PUBG is a fun early access hunger games style shooter where players para drop into a large island map that gradually closes in as players die in a huge fight to the death. As an alpha it has a lot of things to be fixed and much more content necessary to make it a complete game. Developers so far have been very active and have communicated well with the community. They've taken good steps in anti cheat mechanics and in the 3 weeks or so I've had the game I've encountered only one cheater even before the anti cheat update. As a disgruntled former DayZ standalone player I love this game and the direction the devs are taking it. It is definitely worth the $30 asking price so I'd reccomend picking it up before the price goes up later in development!

review: Close your eyes and get a picture of what I am saying. A perfect multiplayer game bug free and with new updates every now and then never seen such anti cheat before. Game takes you to the place where you're left with your buddies and the greatest loot ever a lot of different guns vehicles and what not! I remember when this still was early access 10 months ago with so many bugs and almost unplayable due to number of cheaters around. This is the best game I've played so far and o boy I am into gaming for more than 10 years. I almost forgot how great the ranking system is you'll get a perfect sense of your skill upon playing a while. Thank you Player Unknown!Now open your eyes and face the reality. This game is nothing more than bugs in fact there are more bugs ingame than in your bathroom or basement. You are left to fight your own battle with numerus cheaters where noone cares about them now and then you'll be given another update but that only happens on test server and never gets transfered to live. Game is in "early access" phase for a year already and will never get out of it feels like it's stuck there. Ranking system does not exist. The good thing is you can open some crates you get "for free" and earn a ton of money (I.e. $0.01 a week). Thank you Player Unknown!

review: Let me preface this by saying I loved PUBG. I think the game has an extremely fun gameplay loop and in the 7 months I've owned this game I've kept up a love hate relationship. The hatred I'll explain below.The hatred began when I would constantly run into bugs long loading times and poor optimization. For a game that was in early access I forgave it seeing as how given the status it always had room to improve. Then the full release came I booted up the game despite the imense server problems on launch day and managed to get a game in. I was extremely unimpressed. The game did little to fix its optimization problems and somehow at least on my end ed up the loading even moreso. Loading times were long in the early access sure but I always got in and subsequent games I joined loaded faster and faster as the game retained the memory. Which makes sense. However after the full release my game would be stuck on the load screen forcing me to restart the game over and over and over again every day I played it. I could never load into my first game I'd always have to restart after beginning a round. It got to the point that I just said it and gave PUBG a break.Now in between all this and even before the recent controversy I've had a real in' problem with Bluehole and the then branded PUBG Corp. The developers of this game do a pretty damn job if I've ever seen one. I get it when a game explodes especially a multiplayer one like this it can be hard to role out fixes new servers and such it's understandable. But there are three main reasons I hate them.1. Releasing a game from Early Access that clearly needed fixing still. To say this game was ready when it was released was a really REALLY stupid move and whoever authorized it should be ashamed. A game that is "fully released" doesn't mean it's mostly done but has a lot of things to fix. That's still called a BETA and should be in Steam's EARLY ACCESS. 2. The other major reason for my hatred towards these devs has been in regards to how they have been handling the status of their game and the Battle Royale genre. Did PUBG popularize the Battle Royale genre? You bet your sweet they did and they did it damn well. Does PUBG's devs OWN the genre? Hell no and the reason that they are so adamant in believing that they do is what absolutely disgusts me. You should not and cannot ever lay claim to game mechanics that's just insane. Going so far as to consider legal action against some games that have not only copied their formula but created a game that have garnered larger communities because of the additional improvements they made is just crazy. 3. Microtransactions and pricing. 30 bucks for a multiplayer indie game is pretty good price to say the least. However the flip flop nature of this game's stance on microtransactions is as crazy as their claim to the battle royale throne. When the game launched in Early Access they claimed there would never be microtransactions. Summer rolls around and BOOM keys and crates. The community groaned but dealt with it anyway. It was a limited time thing that probably wouldn't happen again right? Right? Nope. Then they continued with the keys and crates system for the game's better skins while making any cosmetic you can earn through in game currency a random chance that's percentage rate is... very very sketchy to say the least. I've opened at least 20 or 30 crates and never NEVER have I ever once gotten anything above a grey level item. Whether that's just bad luck or that's just the game's way of enticing me to buy keys it's either way. With the recent inclusion of emotes I have to wonder how long it'll be before they cave under their competitor's pressure and begin to experiment with other microtransactions.TLDR The game's had a development process that puts indie games early access games and Battle Royale in a bad light. The game is fun however the developers have had such a attitude that has resulted in disgusting business moves.Because of their recent lawsuits against clones with outrageous claims I for now cannot support this game or its developer anymore. Uninstalled moved onto Fortnite. Hopefully the dev will get their egos in check and work on improving the game rather than just copying the copycats.

review: UPDATE &gt &gt &gt This game is getting SOOOOOO bad with hackers. Hackers almost every single game. Ugh.The BEST and most addictive shooter I've ever played. It's absolutely fantastic. I play with another buddy who is a marine and he said it's the most realistic shooter he has ever played. Let's put it this way... you die A LOT and 50% of the time you have no idea where you died from. Strategy is key. Yes there are definitely hackers but they are easy to spot and the reporting system has cleaned up much of the game.One of the only FPS that has kept my attention span for 6+ months. 210 hours in and looking forward to another 210 more! for $30? Are you kidding me? An absolute MUST PLAY!

review: A'ight so good gameplay. I'm about 60 hours in and it's a lot of fun. My problem is that the box drops are rigged If I'm counting correctly I've had 12 total crates since I started playing which was shortly before the Desperado crate was introduced. So I probably got 4 or 5 of my crates before Desperados could be gotten. Desperados require keys which have to be bought with real money to be opened. Since the Desperado crate was introduced I've got a total of 7 or 8 crates and 5 of them have been the Desperados. 5. 5 out of 7 or 8. That's a 62% or 71% Desperado crate drop rate. This game cost $30 dollars to begin with. After sixty hours of gameplay if I wanted to unlock all of the Desperado crates I've earned at $2.50/key it would run me $12.50 to unlock 5 cosmetics. COSMETICS. If I actually spent the money to unlock those crates I'd be only 1 Desperado crate away from spending half again what I paid for the game for stuff that wouldn't even benefit me in game. And cosmetics are the only things you can modify in the game. And it's possibly I could buy a key for a Desperado crate unlock the crate and get a duplicate item. Which would do absolutely nothing for me.Here's my beef if you're going to charge me this much for stuff that doesn't even affect gameplay just start the game at a higher price. It's not like these crates are DLC or some sort of expansion packs. Fix the drop rates or drop the cost to something reasonable like $0.50 or something like that. C'mon. This is just straight exploitation.

review: I just realized that after 1112 hours of playing (and a good number on the test server as well) I still hadn't written a review for PUBG.When PUBG went into EA in March of 2017 it quickly became one of my most played games of all times. It had serious problems (and still does) but wow there's so many things that it nailed perfectly and it has seen some massive improvements since then.Of all the BR games out there that many might call "PUBG Clones" none of them actually feel even remotely like PUBG. It has such a unique feel that is tough to explain. There's a million things that a player can complain about PUBG but before they know it they'll be right back in PUBG because there's no other game that comes close to it.

review: Simply groundbreaking. I cannot stress enough how fun this game is. This game can be anything you want it to be. Want to rambo into the fight solo? Drop into a city pick up the first weapon you find and go kill someone! Want to play stealthy biding your time looking for the right moments to strike? Drop into a remote location on the edge of the map get geared up move from cover to cover and be the last man standing! Want a more mil sim feel? Get a couple buddies or just auto match in squads gear up get a Jeep and role play a little!The devs are great and super responsive and have stated that they expect the game to release fully within 6 months so no infinite early access. Monthly major patches. Recent stability upgrades. Relatively balanced content. Just so well done all around. 10/10

review: I do not recommend this game to friends and am changing my review after my increasing frustration with hackers in this game. There is still an excess of hackers playing on the servers and I did not realize this until I used the replay feature for the first time to look over games I thought contained suspicious players. I have on average played with a player using aiming cheats at least 1/4 of my games in these past few weeks. I can not believe that this is still a problem with PUBG after the initial surge of hackers months ago as it undermines the competitive nature of the game and one would think with the massive amount of money Bluehole makes that they would be able to create software that isn't so susceptible to cheaters. Wrong instead you watch killcams of players snap aiming onto your head and you see 10 20 players left alive when the match still contain 50 players. Absolutely dissapointed with the inability for this company to right these throwaway account hackers.

review: I want to like this game I've tried to like it yet I can't recommend it.Firstly Loot crates I saw a lot of complaints about them before I bought the game yet at the time they seemed like an optional extra that people who wanted to could buy keys for. The game will force crates onto you that require keys to unlock whether you want them or notI don't want to be spending 20 a week on keys yet the only crates I've been given this week for my "battle points" (point rewards for playing the game) have been the new "Equinox" weapon skin crates 10 the game wants me to have spent on keys this week already. 10 a week triple A subscription games don't want that much.So my reward for playng has been not a thing except being asked by a company that admits itself that it doesn't care about any customers outside of China to give more money. No thanks mate cheek to call them "Random crates". Random is not every crate the new weapon skin that requires a different type of key to the keys that everyone already had.They have refused to put a high ping kicker on servers they "don't want to offend their Chinese players" at the expense of everyone else who has to put up with constantly getting put into teams with loud ignorant groups who are quite blatantly trying to farm crates in order to sell them yes you can sell things from the crates on steam OF COURSE PEOPLE ARE GOING TO CHEAT.Cafe's full of people often with the same names with different numbers using voice ativated chat it's a good job you can't understand them because you can't hear anything over the noise this includes in games audio queues such as footsteps gunfire and the like. In a game where communication is critical they've done nothing but make it a very frustrating experience.If you're outside of China you mean nothing to this company except a potential sale and then potentially more money for keys The other side of no high ping kicker is that half the time the Chinese people you think you're shooting at are not where you are shooting at try driving in a car with one of them they will crash into every tree rock and wall there is because they are so desynced with the server they can't not.A percentage of the claims of hacking are exactly because of this They do seem to have been doing a little about it but it's no where near enough and no where near fast enough They've allowed people to make money from playing and the only time it's an issue for the company is when they aren't getting their cut their recent attempts to combat hacking have only been because of third party websites selling their items nothing more nothing less.So why should you buy this if the game is quite clearly against you from the start? Why should you give a company money just to have a frustrating experience looking for that one squad who A. can communicate with you and B. actually wants to play in a squad most folk seem to think that everyone else is a voice activated AI bot that is only their to find weapons and ammo for them That's not the games fault You've probably experienced similar in other games yet with this game the few times that you can find a squad who can talk it's one of those muppets.Yes there is a solo mode yet I like to have people to talk to when I'm running to the next circle because that's what half of your time on this game will be doing running into the next circle.Nothing to do with winning or losing my complaints I've had fun games that I've lost yet when you are talking about that happening maybe 1 game in 100 with an average game time of 15 20 minutes and the other 99 just full of nonsense from what's mentioned above to vehicles randomly flipping themseves people who don't have any recoil people with blatant aim bots people who arent were you see them to be being shot through buildings and walls.It's a frustrating futile experience and by their own admission they won't do a thing to fix it because "China"

review: I uninstalled this game after 120 hours online. There are numerous issues with some valid counter points which have been argued to eternity on reddit and elsewhere. The bottom line is right now The engine and netcode lead to an early 2000s experience that is simply unenjoyable. This was the most successful attempt thus far at capturing the novelty of the "Battle Royale" theme but its technical issues and the monetize first mentality of the game's producers make it unworthy of your time or money.

review: So I got an hour straight of playing PUBG and I came to this conclusion Do not get this game if you don't have any friends. If you play alone all you will do is run around from town to town gathering gear only to bleed out when someone gets a lucky shot 1 kilometer away. The fun comes from playing with friends which kind of ruins the whole "player unknown" part of the game. So do I recommend this game? Ehhhh yeah. But only so you can beg your friends to get it too in hopes you play with them. But if you're a loner boner have fun bleeding out in a wheat field.

review: PUBG is a freah exciting game in which you van play seriously against others in a 100 player survival or joke around with friends and enjoy the fun larts of the game. Neither should be affected by lag or hackers. Right? Well alas most P.C systems have to run it at very low settings with decent fps but at the start of games rubber banding issues can occur. BUT GIVE THEM A CHANCE have you ever had to handle this many players on your servers. Bearing in mind they have over 2 million players usually playing at the same time. As for he settings well im sorry but if you are wanting to play a demanding game get a good p.c maybe 1000 to run it at medium to high and with a fun experience. I can say that after 300 hours in this game i always want to play a new round even after a stupid mistake i have made. The game makes entertaining content for streamers and Youtubers and it has boosted the steam community bringing a newish game mode to become popular. Issues should be expected as we are all humans and making a computer generated game is bound to have issues and bugs. Try to name one game with NO bugs and NO hackers that supports most of the steam community 24/7. I would rate this game highly at about 8/10 and definately worth purchasing.In addition the the above there is a community market for the game where you can sell in game items which you get from buying crates with ingame currency (Bp) or from the market.

review: Product received for free. Now I was gifted PUBG by a friend. This is how I feel about it.PUBG is a good game it has a lot of problems the developers need to look and and fix but the game seems to be improving with every update. Before 1.0 I ran this game at Very Low 900p to get 60FPS. (My GPU is a GTX750Ti) and it ran the game fine. Now after 1.0 the game runs great on medium 1080p at around 45fps with some drops. I like the game but it has major problems with the hackers and people on the wrong servers. I rate this game a 6.5/10. Try it out!

review: After playing 200 hours I am still playing and still enjoying it. Before going in to critiques I would like to address the negative reviews that you will see. A large majority of the one I read consist of people or people's friends getting banned unfairly for stream sniping which is a dumb way to attempt to get unbanned if that's what they are trying. People have also posted negative reviews on the game simply because they added a crate you must spend $2.5 (if I recall) to open it with a key. The crate was only for GamesCon and is not gone so that's just dumb as well. There are even negative reviews saying that Brendan Green has taken his hands off and is no longer working on the game which is a completely false statement. There is a big monthly update that brings in new content (new gun new items etc.) and then 2 3 patches each month addressing bugs and glitches and other smaller things. If you are into hardcore first person shooter's then this is the game for you. Be mindful the game is still in early access so it is poorly optimized and there are still a decent amount of bugs. The main problem is the optimization but IMO the movement feels pretty good and I rarely run in to bugs nowadays. Overall a very entertaining game and look forward to many more updates in the unforeseen future.

review: PUBG is a great game in my opinoin... This game I feel like is alot better than H1Z1 KOTK because this game i feel like has alot more variety and dosent feel arcady. There are a ton of weapons in this game compared to only really being able to use the AK M4 Shotgun and Sniper in KOTK. For example of the guns I have used there is a UZI AK M4 Sniper Shotgun SKS SMGs and Pistols. I dont know all the guns that are in the game.Pros * Better combat machanics.* Cant just jump in your car when getting shot like KOTK there is a time in between when you want to enter and when you get in.* Its easier to kill people out of a car.* Better map IMO* Get to chose were you land so its not random.* Alot more weaponsCons * Still very glitchy.* Black Spots in houses becasue of AMD GPUs* Poor optimization.* Loading into games is laggy and jittery* Air strikes cause massive frame lossTO MANY HACKERS PLZ FIX

review: this game is like hunger games where the walls get smaller and smaller until the survivors are in a circle 10m next to each other. Its very intense and will scare you when u get suprised i guess thats all in the experience of playing this game. Its very fun with friends. I only have 2 cons for this game the servers sometimes lag for 1 3min and its very annoying. Also if u have a pc that is identical to the minumum specs you might as well not get it. Ive heard some ppl with gtx 760s and still cannot run this game. For me i am running this game smoothly at 60fps 1080p ultra with a gtx 1070 and i5 6600k. The final con for me is that i think this game gets repetative very fast. Its just the same thing every game. Loot 1 2 houses find car go to center kill or get killed by a person u cant even see. If you are planning to get this game find some friends to play with. At this current state of the game it deserves a 7.5/10 for me. I hope the devs fix the issues i stated above and add more game modes guns and even maps to spice up the game a little. The devs did a really good job at the game.

review: Now this game at it's foundation is great. Nice gunplay nice map and enviorment and slight variance in all the weapons constant updates bring in new weather variants and weapons. However where this game always seems to go wrong is the connection. Every time I play solo my connection is rather decent and I usually don't get clay buildings or network lag detected messages but recently whenver me and my friend try to play duos my connection is For example my partner will ask "are you loaded in?" I shouldn't be surprised that I loaded in to the spawn island or hope I do. Furthermore when I initially hit the ground my buildings wouldn't be fully loaded in you can see the basic strucure of the house and even sometimes enter it but you end up bouncing off the floor until the building loads in which is always up in the air in terms of when it will load. (hence clay buildings) Sometimes my game will freeze when opening my inventory early on leaving no choice but to end the task which fills my heart with gloom everytime I do because there is a lot of potential in this game. But until the xbox release I don't see this game's connection issues being solved. Great game horrible server connection. Thank god it isn't full priced.... Wouldn't recomend rn
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is pretty fantastic. It can be fast paced or slow paced depending on your strategy. Do you want to drop into a city and fight with up to 20 30 people? Or maybe you want to drop low key into a group of houses test your luck with the loot RNG and hope you get something to help out mid game. Either way you've got the options to have an enjoyable game. The only issue with this game is that depending on your computer it might take a while for the game to render in the beginning. I imagine this will be fixed as the game progresses. I guess another issue could be that campers usually win but that's how these types of games work.

review: Fantastic overall game. I think mixed reviews are mostly the result of people who refused to acknowledge the fact that the game was still in in pre release phase prior for 12 20 2017. I've been playing since April (I think) and have nearly 700 hours played as of this review. My experiences have been great... Yes the game had its problems with servers and client optimization but those things are likely to be entirely in the past with the 1.0 release of the game. This is hands down the best battle royale game out there (I think the numbers speak for themselves). I'm really excited to see what Bluehole/ PUBG Corp. has in store for the future of this game.

review: PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds is one of the best if not the best battle royale games it has a large variety of weapons + exclusive in drop only weapons (not p2w just in game) it has greats elements of gameplay like leaning the game is being updated frequently with new weapons functonalities better UI design ect.. And this game is ONLY in early access and the 1.0 will come out soon with 2 new weapons vaulting ect...Pros Best mechanics so far Weapons are pretty much balanced a lot of weapon variety (melee AR Sniper Rifle LMG SMG Crossbow?) 1st map well designed A lot more to come on the game being updated Duo and Squad mode First Person Perspective servers for those who hate 3rd personCons The game can be very frustrative (bad loot sometimes a little bit of lag and the ways that you can die) The servers aren't this good but handle the job pretty much (heavy lag sometimes) 3rd person can be OP sometimes (If not playing in FPP obviously)Overall A nice game that you can play with your friends in duo or squad maybe hard to have fun in solos but it's always nice to get a chicken dinner D

review: The game is above buggy. The latency is terrible and hasn't been fixed under any circumstances since the beginning of the game. If anyone played Overwatch at launch you'd know the tick rate was awful. Well times that by 10 and you got this game. Horrid tick rate mixed with horrid latency and the game is almost unplayable at times. On top of that we still have to deal with hackers all the time. With them planning to release the game this month all I have to say is they need to get their together because so far haven't been impressed with their server maintenance as a whole because it's been basically non existent. The game idea is great and the guns play and feel ok minus the AK which is horrible but on the Test Server they've fixed that. The game can be fun when the servers happen to be having a good day. The fact that it's been months since Early Access and the game is coming close to full release they need to buckle down and get things going otherwise this game will eventually go down hill.

review: It's got its problems that said it is a game that is tons of fun and has potential to be even more. Lots of people complain about them releasing skins for weapons and cosmetic items instead of improving performance or fixing bugs but don't seem to understand that the guys who work on cosmetic items and the guys who do performance and bug fixing are not the same people. The designers and artists who make the skins won't be working on bug fixing. So if their job is smoother and they are able to produce results a lot faster than the other guys working on bugs it doesn't mean the bug fixing guys are not working they just have a slower more time consuming job and because they haven't released anything yet does not mean the cosmetic guys should just stop their job because the game isn't optimized yet.Also the argument that "they have so much money now" so they can fix it it isn't as simple as that you can't throw money at it and be like ok game fix self. Even a game with a budget of like 200mil takes years to produce a bug free optimized game. Look at EA and Bioware all that money and they couldn't get the bugs fixed in Mass Effect in time.

review: Player Unknowns Battlegrounds does not need a review. It is already highly praised by YouTube content creators and Twitch streamers. You already know it is a "fun adreneline pumping action packed game". You and me both can agree. This game has the best loot and guns out of all the battle royale games out there right now. While you always see the same weapons like the scar and the AKM in the last minutes of the match there is alot of weapon variety. You can modify most weapons to make them more accurate or to make less noise. There is also a neat clothing system in the game. But like i said you already know all that. The one problem i see with this game is this. The test server is more fun and easier to run then the actual game. I know the devs are working hard to let 1.0 see the light of day but come on. You already know the changes you made in the test server are viable. You already know we love the new map and the new weapons. Just give it to us. I reccomend this game for the same reason everyone else reccomends it. But if i had the choice to play the test server or the actual game i'd pick the test server. Buy this game its better than all the other games out on the market right now.

review: Three reasons make me decide not to like this game I rarely dislike a game but this one is extremely bad 1. This game is a highly hardware dependent game but the graphics doesn't look that good. My old PC runs BF3 4 even BF one smoothly but this game only gives me 10 20 FPS which is unplayable.2. Too many cheaters. I play AS usually there are a lot of cheaters there even in test server. The game experience is very bad when playing with those people since a lot of time you don't even have the chance to fight back and you are already our for the next game.3. The game doesn't seem to be completed from UI to gaming content (WTF is this crappy born island? and why is every one suddenly get on to the transporter all of those just doesn't make any sense. This game is merely a shooting game that satisfies the thirst for blood of human beings and consumes you a lot of time. I bought this game only because a lot of my friends are playing it and they wanted me to play with them after 30 hours game time I decide to throw this game into the dump.!!!!! DO NOT BUY this game unless you have a very powerful PC and a lot of your friends are playing it. This game is purely a blackhole for your time and you don t take anything out of it!UPDATE After the so called 1.0 official release they slightly alleviated the frame rate issue it s now playable (barely!) in terms of graphics. But the server is extremely unstable most of the time when you land you will be dragged back whenever you move forward and it means death if you landed at one of those rich resource spots The game is still unplayable for me. Do not buy this game unless you know what you will be dealing with!

review: PUBG is an online multiplayer competitive game which pits you against 99 other players in a 100 man elimination match. Right now there are 2 maps although they do plan to add to those later. The maps are huge and you start off in a plane and then drop down to any location you can get to as quick as possible without dying. Once you're on the ground you pick up weapons and gear and build up your aresenal and get ready to fight. As you play the map begins to shrink and if you stay outside the restricted area's your health will deminish and you will perish. This constriction adds another level of stress and adrenaline to the game. Soon all players left will gather in a small space until only one Man is left standing.. winner winner chicken dinner!!! There are basically 2 games modes solo and team based. Either way you're trying to surivive until the very end. It's extremely addictive. If you've played Fortnight and never played PUBG I will tell you the key differences. The graphics in PUBG are more realistic you can't build in PUBG there are more weapon customizations in PUBG. There are a few other differences but basically both games are 100 man elimination. Highly addictive strongly reccomended!! 8/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have played over 630 hours of PUBG since early April of this year. I used to really enjoy this game however I fear for it's future and it's ability to keep up with other titles. Certain elements of PUBG are exhilarating the rush to find a weapon in the beginning the intense squad firefights and the heart racing adrealine pumping final moments of the game are PUBG's greatest assets. This is an early access game and during the first 4 5 months after it's lauch the developers did a decent job at improving the game. They added new animations game mechanics items and weapons as well as minor gameplay improvements. Recently however the dev's don't seem to be keeping up with the game anymore. Many major issues within the game are still present poor optimization even on high performance PC's cheaters dominate the leaderboards and might ruin some of your matches (cheats are easily accessable online) and dramatic FPS drops (the game will often drop to 30 40 fps no matter how good your PC or internet is). This is what I feared most before buying this game the fact that early access titles have a history of not being well maintained (cough cough DayZ cough). If you aren't one of the 15+ million people who have already bought this game don't. Your best bet is to wait until they release the full version sometime in December (probably even later because the dev's like to delay game updates).

review: First let me say that I have played Arma 3 BR a little Arma 2 and H1 KOTK. Each have their own styles but I like the more tactical style like this and Arma. I got my very first win 4 games in and it was very satisfying. The game is extremely intense most of the time even though it is pretty slow paced. The gameply is great and I can keep playing again and again which most games dont grab me like that.About Performance This game does indeed need better optimization however it will come and runs 50 75 FPS with medium settings on my rig. I have the game on my SSD and my entire build is standard clocked. Some people seem to have worse problems running the game but it runs fine with me. I havent really noticed any bad bugs at the time of this review.i5 6600k16 gb Corsair Vegence ddr4Msi GTX 9701x Samsung Evo 750 250 gb1x Western Digital 3tbAll in all try the game especially if you have similar specs that can run it decently smooth. The patches will come in time to make the game even better than it already is!

review: I honestly love the game. I'm not generally a fan of PVP as I usually find the player base toxic but I'm thoroughly enjoying this game. Although the player base can still sometimes be toxic its easy to just mute the voice chat and for that matter the game itself is addicting. There's something very rewarding about those handful of matches when you do really well knowing everyone starts from the same point. As for some insight on the negative reviews There are two issues I know of neither of which have affected my game play but I guess we'll see.1) There was a huge problem with stream sniping and "stream griping" as I'd like to call it. Essentially there was a time when the public would watch streamers and try to find them in game to get an esy kill. hence "Stream Sniping." When the streamers called them out the PUBG devs would ban the players taking the streamers' side to continue having them advertise the game. This got out of hand hand as streamers started calling stream sniping just to save face when they died. Hence "Stream Griping." This lead to the devs banning a bunch of people who most of the time don't even watch live streams and the game was review bombed. 2)There was and still is an issue with defaulting Asian servers. basically people who aren't in Asia are being defaulted to Asian servers and most of the time even after switching servers they still end up in Asian servers. This may have been fixed but I'm still dealing with it. It's not too aweful besides the fact that your team speaks different languages. It has however been lagging the cr ap out of the Asian servers and PUBG was review bombed yet again.That being said I'd definitely still recommend the game. I'm planning on buying more copies for gifts in the near future. The game is still fun and is still worth the $30 in my opinion. It's just unfortunate because these two issues after large groups of people and the reviews tanked.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It's buggy it's glitchy and laggy. That's just the technical bits that are wrong. Oh it also crashes routinely.The funny thing is it use to be a great game when it was in pre release. What the hell happend?Now lets talk about the maps and recent changes.1. Desert map insanely spread out. I hope you like running most of the time or struggling with the ungoly horrid steering and controls of one of the utterly terrible vehicles in the game.2. Guns? You like them? Awesome get use to handguns and shotguns because some recent patch seems to have removed practically everything out of the game. Places that use to actually have weapons basically dont' have any. Short of hot dropping School or Hacienda you're hosed for a while.I'm leaving this review hoping they fix these issues. The new map is promising. Now please spend some time building in stability so the game crashes less and focus a bit on improving the fun aspects (like the weapons) because right now it's just a frusterating experience. Patch please.

You won't know because you were iced by a guy with radar from 400m out and it leaves you angry and empty.Speaking of empty nothing burns more than fighting for your life only to earn the same late 90's baseball cap over and over and over and....over.In order to customise your character in this era of sad skinny jeaned millennials where appearance means more than personality you have to play and die so much that it possibly might outlive religion. If you are patient enough to do this you may earn the right for different coloured jeans. That sums up the reward system when you survive the netcode dog eaters and stovepipe jeans hordes whose memory goes as far back as 2004.Aside from this it is a very good game with excellent map and fluid dynamic play.The promotional video has no relevance so don't watch it. You'll never get those pants or fur lined jacket (if its important to you you fkn millennial).enjoy

review: Product received for free. Once this game is fully optimized and out of early access it'll be one of the best multiplayer shooter games of the last few years. There's a lot to like but as all early access games go it's hard to play through a lot of it's issues. Vehicles need a lot of tweaking. First person is much more enjoyable but in it's current state can be clunky at times. First person height feels off at times. Servers are usually Smoke grenades grenades and stuns need a lot of improvement. The main menu is awful. Sounds need a lot of work. More accessories would be cool why no binoculars?Overall game optimization is enough to keep most people away until it's in a better state. Pick it up if you have a tolerance for unoptimized early access games that HOPEFULLY get finished.
