review: I really don't understand how this is the most popular game on steam but runs the worst out of anything I've ever played. I understand that the difference between pc and console is that pc lets you customize graphics settings and you're a bit more involved in how much fps you're getting where as console just gives you a game that is designed to run on your chosen console. This however does not mean that devs can just release two fifths of a game and expect you to design the rest of the code. They can however release a game and then expect the player to customise it to their machine's capabilities. This does not however allow devs to release a game with every single aspect of the games code to be adjusted according to the players machine. My pc is above the minimum requirements and it still did not run well with the 40 years of optimization I did to it. I then set everything to the lowest possible setting and adjusted settings in my graphics card to allow the game to run better. I still lag I still get fps freezes Players still shoot me out of nowhere and then appear after their harry potter invisibility cloak runs out or something. Great concept but unless the game is made so that a normal human being can play it without having to be an active member of the dev team then it's not gonna be a good game. I also don't understand the physics of the vehicles in this game. If you're going to have a game where there's a time limit that you need to beat to a certain area on the map or else you die then vehicles are important. You can't just make it so that if I'm racing against the space time continuum to get out of the blue zone and I hit a pebble smaller than an actual 1 1 scale pixel that I flip into the International Space Station and crash from heights of Felix Baumgartner and die. That's rubbish. Every action you do in this game will make you spike out and view the powerpoint presentation that the creator of the game presented to blue balls entertainment. Fix the game and it'll be good. 5 fps lag spikes out of 10.

review: Jak napisać dobrą recenzję gryKażda recenzja powinna zawierać w sobie dwa podstawowe elementy. Pierwszym z nich jest przedstawienie danej rzeczy przedmiotu recenzji. Bardzo ważne jest aby autor pamiętał o niewdawaniu się w zbyt szczegółowe kwestie. Takie recenzje zazwyczaj wiążą się bowiem ze znudzeniem czytelnika. Celem piszącego recenzje powinno być natomiast przedstawienie tematu tak aby po lekturze tekstu czy wysłuchaniu materiału odbiorca miał wiedzę odnośnie danego zagadnienia. Recenzje gier online przykładowo powinni zawierać takie podstawowe informacje jak chociażby gatunek do jakiego zalicza się gra. Pisząc recenzje gier online warto również pokusić się o przedstawienie ich twórców. Szczególnie czytelnikom obeznanym w temacie taka wiedza może się bardzo przydać. Przede wszystkim dlatego że będą mogli porównać poprzednie gry wyprodukowane przez daną firmę czy zespół twórców. Współczesne gry posiadają często bardzo rozbudowaną fabułę którą również autor zabierający się za recenzje gier online powinien mieć na uwadze. Dobrze jest opisać chociażby główne wątki. Jeżeli gra stanowi kontynuację wcześniejszych projektów taki fakt także w swojej recenzji należy naświetlić. Niektórzy gracze lubią skorzystać z różnych odsłon gier aby mieć porównanie. Zatem dobre recenzje gier online powinny dawać im możliwość rozeznania we wcześniejszych dokonaniach twórców danej gry.Podczas omawiania konkretnej gry dobrze jest również zwrócić uwagę na grupę odbiorców do których taki projekt jest skierowany. Inaczej bowiem będzie się pisało o grze edukacyjnej dla najmłodszych niż w przypadku przedstawiania bardziej poważnych przedsięwzięć w branży. Chodzi nie tylko o odmienny język recenzji ale również zwrócenie większej uwagi na pewne fakty. Recenzje gier online mogą również wskazywać komu dana gra powinna przypaść do gustu najbardziej. W ten sposób również można wiele o niej powiedzieć.Na końcu opinia autora. Bardzo często w recenzji można spotkać podział na dwie części. Podobnie rzecz ma się w przypadku gdy autor pisze recenzje gier online. Warto na początku opisać grę w sposób mniej lub bardziej treściwy. Wiele w tym miejscu zależy od ilości miejsca dostępnego na publikację. Po nakreśleniu fabuły i podaniu podstawowych faktów dobrze jest pokusić się o własną ocenę danego projektu. Aby była ona możliwie najbardziej rzetelna należy najpierw samodzielnie przetestować grę. Tylko w ten sposób stworzone recenzje gier online będą kompletne. Czy trzeba kierować się zasadą obiektywizmu czy lepiej subiektywnie podejść do tematu? Autor powinien zdecydować sam. Niemniej jednak bardzo ostra krytyka wskazana jest na ogół w sytuacjach gdy za recenzje gier online odpowiada ktoś bardzo zorientowany w zagadnieniu i dysponujący sporą wiedzą nie tylko praktyczną ale także teoretyczną. W przeciwnym razie czasami warto poskromić język i starać się wyważyć zalety i wady uzupełniając je ewentualnie własnymi przemyśleniami. A ostateczną ocenę pozostawić odbiorcy. Jeżeli po zapoznaniu z recenzją będzie on bogatszy w wiedzę wówczas autor może ogłosić sukces.

review: I want a refund on this game. With every update the game gets worse. The hackers multiply and the t becomes more stupid. Played 4 solo games. After checking my area and the sky for anyone to land next to me no one does so I proceed to loot as the closest person is more than a kilometre away. By the second building I loot someone is waiting at a staircase with level 3 helmet M416 and level 2 vest. Just waiting for me to come upstairs with my P92 pistol and no armour. Game 2. I land at shooting range with 5 other people. I land at what is usually a high gun spawn to find nothing despite landing first. And I am proceeded to be taken out by an S12K. Game 3. As soon as I land I take the nearest car and drive to the furthest possible place inside the safe zone and begin looting. After getting some amazing loot I am then required to proceed to to opposite side of the safe zone to the new marker and then again and then again. Until it's physically impossible for me to get to the safe zone due to the giant mountain in my way and then I am hastefully killed by this updated blue zone.Final game last chance before I uninstall this game forever. I land find an AK begin getting 7 8 body shots on a player running at me with a machete and no armour and I am then killed in one swing. This game is a terrible waste of money time and patience. 35 minutes of looting.2 seconds of being shot in the head by a Kar98k from knows where.TL DR PlayerUnknowns tGrounds. 0/10 game.

review: I love this game.I get tons of fun but literally unplayable if you have a HDD for storage (It takes you 1 Minute to load the map).Before buying this game buy a Solid State DriveI have also encountered blatant hacking on here 4 times...All using speedhacks and aim hacks.(One guys sprayed down my whole squad with all headshots knocking us down instantly we weren't even grouped close together another time I was killed by a guy shooting a pistol while running at a speed faster than someone who is running with boost)Please ban the cheaters or at least introduce a ranking/ match making system so there's less chance of encountering one.Also the nerds over in the Asian servers will teamkill you if you have better loot than them. update Jan 04 2018 I think the updates are on the right track.the game is no longer as buggy as before 1.0 and now I can game smoothly on my GTX 960There are still a few bugs like smoke disappearing and a few server side issues like rubber banding and freezing your game without telling you that you have a bad connectionThe recent update changed my mind do get this game it's tons of fun.

review: Let me give you a quick answer before I go into my mildly detailed review Yes you should buy this game.I have had this game for close to a week now and I can say without a single doubt that this is one of the best game purchases that I have made this yearDo you like constant edge of your seat action?Do you like games where nobody has an advantage over you each round?Do you enjoy survival shooters?If you answered yes to any(or all) of the questions above then this game is for you.Yes I know it is still pre release but the fact that the game is so fun already has me hyped for the final product.You drop in each round with nothing nada zilch zero. Its a race out of the gates to get some gear all while making sure there isnt any hostiles waiting around the next corner. I cannot tell you how many times i have s*** my pants just trying to loot a building. Thats the type of s*** that gets me up in the morning. Then theres that one round where you drop into the perfect area theres no one for miles all the buildings are filled with level 3 gear sniper rifles and ARs. You then proceed to ghost the round until you are in the top 10 only to get shot in the back of the head by a KAR98K. Its all good though casuse I could die #99 or #5 and still have a heck of a fun time playing.Did I mention the f****** circle? I have a love/hate relationship with that thing. Your first thought in a game where the goal is to be the last man alive out of the 100 players in every session is to camp it out in a bathroom on the third floor of an apartment complex. Well good news thats not gonna happen unless you are somehow extremely lucky like I'm talking you're going to win the lotto before you can camp it out in a single spot for the entire game. The chances are the circle WILL close on you if you are not constantly on the move.Overall this is an amazing concept for a game and I cant wait to see what is coming in the next couple months as this game prepares for release.THE BOTTOM LINE 10/10 I HAVE AND CONTINUE TO RECOMMEND IT TO MY FRIENDSBUY THIS GAMESTOP READING REVIEWS AND WATCHING STREAMS ON IT TO MAKE A DECISIONYOU WONT REGRET ITYOU HAVE SPENT $30 ON STUPIDER S***ACCEPT ITCONFORMGIVE INWHY ARE YOU STILL READING THISTHE ONLY REASON YOU SHOULD STILL BE READING THIS IS IF YOU ARE WAITING FOR THIS GAME TO DOWNLOAD.BUY ITTHE END.

review: You haven't lived if you haven't played this beast of a game. Probably one of if not the best Battle Royale out there simply because of the sheer amount of dev support it has. Player Unknown's Battle Ground AKA PUBG is a slow paced but adrenaline pumping and thrilling game. I've played other Battle Royales and though personally I think another one is better than this one it is only because I have played it for longer and it runs better on my potato of a computer. If you can aim have game logic and experience in FPS there is literally no reason for you not to try this game. It is fairly beginner friendly (Though it is rage inducing you have been warned!) but requires a beefy computer to run smoothly. I would personally suggest a GTX 9XX and an Intel I7 at the very least although I have been able to get it to run at 50 FPS on the lowest settings with a GTX 750. With that out of the way go get your chicken dinner. Po i is my city.

review: TL DR CONS * Animations and graphics are far from top tier when it comes to Unreal 4.* Hackers everywhere (or so everybody says) although it's hard for me to tell between hackers and people with sniper rifles.* UI is very spartan.* Control is clancky like old shooters but in a bad way.PROS * Every match starts pretty quick and doesn't last too long (20 30min top).* You can punch people in the groin.* Has random factors to it (like the plane route combat zone and blast zone) and I love it.* Can be very fun at times.IGN 10/10 It's OKFar from perfect and from what I read it's only getting worse. But I have good time at the time of writing this. Also don't believe the trailers the game on ultra doesn't look that good and some of the locals I'm 100% sure unreachable. Better watch streams over twitch to decide if this game is for you. Don't believe the trailers.Also regarding microtransations it's only for cosmetics and you can't pay real money for them outside of buying stuff from other players at the Steam marketplace. Loot boxes are not so quickly obtained unless you're really good but the cosmetics are anyways so who cares? The loot boxes and marketplace are never pushed to the player's face so it's A OK for me.

review: My review for PUBG and why I think it deserves positive reviews.I've got 200 hours in the game. Reached top 10k in leaderboards quite a few times. I play exclusively on EU. Never seen any cheater. My game was always smooth only crashed when I ed up with my windows settings.I run a i5 4590 8/16 gigs of ram gtx 1070. Can run the game at 1440p with no lag.The game is very fun with friends. It has a lot of bugs but most of them are rare or aren't game changing.I appreciate the vehicle system as it is. I play H1Z1 PUBG Fortnite. If I had to choose one it would be PUBG.A lot of variety on weapons. Not as many hackers as fortnite (f2p).Better graphics more realistic than H1Z1 better gunplay than H1Z1.Playing squads in PUBG is way more fun and not as tryhard as in H1Z1's fives.Squads are less of a mess and have way easier/better way to communicate. If you want a fast paced battle royale choose either H1Z1 or Fortnite. If you want more of a tactical battle royal slower paced buy PUBG.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: yeah. PUBG is the beginning of a new subgenre of shooters. This game will be a landmark in the history of gaming.PUBG forces adrenaline through your veins. Down to 10 players pinned down in a building by gunfire from an uncertain direction circle closing in about to cut off your escape forcing you to make snap tactical decisions... you will find yourself stuggling to control your breath and get your mouse hand steady. Those golden moments of gaming that you reminisce about months and years down the line that are deperately rare in most games happen almost every play session in PUBG.This is only going to be amplified by the forced first person perspective something the game really should've launched with and been designed around in my opinion. So much more effective at accomplishing everything I like about PUBG and much much much less cheesey gunfights. We need that first person.If you consider yourself a gamer and you haven't player a round or two of PUBG you owe it to yourself.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I am here to put in a good word for this game. As of recently everybody is jumping on the "no micro transactions" band wagon and down voting this game. THE GAME IS GOOD. END OF SENTENCE.These reviews are not meant to reflect how you feel towards the publisher but rather the product at hand. Everybody needs to just shut up about how butt hurt they are about a developer putting in a micro transaction for testing and paying for an event if you read everything they stated some of the money will be going to charity but i digress. IF YOU DONT LIKE IT DONT BUY IT. These are all purely cosmetic and nobody is forcing you to buy them. If you think you can do better with less then lets see it! OH you aren't a game designer/developer? THEN SHUT UP! But enough about the cry babies.Now on to the GAME itself. PUBG is a 1v99 Battleroyale/ Looter Shooter for those that do not already know. You fly over drop in loot ammo guns meds etc. and go on the hunt. Your goal? Be the last person alive. You not only fight other players but have to strategically navigate the map and beat the ever encroatching circle. If you manage to beat all odds and are the last man standing they are rewarded with a delicious "chicken dinner"PUBG as a whole is a good experience. The game has its quirks but that is also what makes it different from H1Z1 KotK and the OG ARMA mod. Does it have bugs here and there? Yes it does but its in early access. Are they constantly fixing and updating to fix bugs and balance the game? YES they are! Something very few EA titles have been doing UPDATES REGULARLY! Is it "unplayable" as many state on a regular basis? Far from it people like to SEVERELY over exagerate when their game crashed one time becuase they didnt update there 2 year old video drivers for their 6 year old graphics card. The game runs fine I will say that it hasn't been entirely optimized but it is far from "unplayble". (obviously with 500k concurrent players) With that said it does have quite a bit to render all at one time and does take some decent hardware to run well so keep that in mind. (check the system recommendations and min. requirements) To sum it up I recommend this game its far from triple A title price its one of the better EA titles it is very much an enjoyable game have fun all!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Worth every penny spent on this game. Even as a beta (that has some bugs) it is awesome. There is no other game like this.

review: Only played DUOs or SQUADs with friends only 30ish hours on record but I've kept up with the updates and the path they plan on taking the microtransaction was a shocker cause I got the PU Set off the market and was surprised with how easy it was to get but 2.50 for a key isn't that bad (bit of a rip off of CS GO cause it's a gamble) cause it funds the devs and with the game's full release date held back cause of working on optiminzation. A lot of people are upset and are going to down vote this game cause of it but they apparently think devs work for free and make decision like this without having a reason except money. Devs do require payment and dev team leaders make hard decisions to either risk going bankrupt or cutting pay or et cetra (not saying Bluehole is in danger cause of the high sales or at all). So take the microtransaction as you will but in the end of the day it's just cosmetic items it does have minimal effect on gameplay (camoflauge and stuff) but not enough to get the pitchforks and torches and boycott the game.

review: This game is extremely fun and addicting. I have yet to encounter any major bugs and have only encountered one major instance of "Network Lag Detected " and that was when it was a really major issue happening extremely frequently. The game runs perfectly fine on my $300 PC with everything on high. There have been instances of the game being obviously unoptimized but they are few and far between and are actively being worked on by arguably one of the most engaged developers. Overall this game is a must have for anyone who enjoys this genre. For all of its faults (some of which just make the game more fun and ridiculous like vehicles clipping into stuff and flying off) it's a great game. Sometimes you'll get frustrated but it's one of those games that just makes you get right back into it. Plus if you want (and I highly recommend this) you can just mess around and have fun with shotguns or bushes or something. It's a nice change of pace from the typical seriousness and engagement the game has.

review: This game to me is a breath of fresh air compared to other online shooters and it's older brother H1Z1. Everything from the gameplay to the weapon add ons seems very complex and requires a deep understanding to truly play this game. I adore the feeling of exploration and the suspence of "other players can kill me any second" gives me. I think this game currently only appeals to people with at least a mid range pc ( and higher). It is extremely resourceful. I myself own a pc that can play for example games like gta v high settings at 1080p smoothly (60fps avg) but why can't I play this game at at least medium 1080p? I am forced to play it at very low which not only looks a lot worse but performs terribly too. Please remove unnecessary assets and bulk from the game. I will continue to support this game even though my pc hates it. 8/10 for the game. 3/10 for optimization.

review: This game isn't what is was a few months ago. Now the only thing you'll find on the NA server is Chinese people. You can't solo queue and join a squad and expect them to speak English Spanish or even French you know... one of the three most dominant languages in North America. Nope... better speak Chinese. Also you have to now deal with the fact that you're shooting at someone literally on the other side of the world and high ping (them) benefits them much more than it does you. They need to region lock this game because this has gotten out of hand. If I wanted to play with people who don't speak the same language as me I'd queue up on one of the FOUR Asian servers available but I guess that's not an option for the Chinese players.I've resorted to team killing every player that even remotely sounds like their from Asia. Wrong server tough

Which is why I have over 200 hours on it.However I can't currently recommend this game as it's become the new RUST in terms of hackers running rampant.It was scarce in the early game but at this point you can barely play a single game without seeing someone sprinting faster than cards taking 20 30 shots and keep going or spraying with unaccurate but higher SPS guns like vector and all their bullets auto hitting 4 different people in the head 5 times each with 1 clip spray in under 2 seconds. I will gladly change this review once....if ever....hackers are dealt with.Until then steer clear.

review: Even though the game says it's been released and no longer in early access it's still early access quality wise. I feel they only took it out of early access to get more sales. It's still just as glitchy the beginning of the round is a massive lag fest and the luckiest one wins. After the beginning if you can get a kill at point blank while unloading half your clip you are also the lucky one. Half the time the game gets stuck on the loading screen but yet you can still move around and play the game if only you could see what you're doing. This game is just a bug fest and the developers are only after easy money. If this game wasn't profitable they'd abondon it and go on to the next easy money....oh wait they already started another game. Yep this game is not a priority any more. They've already made millions why fix what they started? Save your hard earned money if it goes on sale (good luck) then I'd say get it but not for more than $15. I got mine from CD keys for $25 and it just isn't worth it. Yea it's a fun game but only when it works which is quite rare. In an hour time period you'll probably play 3 4 games because of complete t matches.

review: I have very mixed feelings about this game. On one hand this game is amazing. It keeps you engaged and on your toes every match. On the other hand this game can feel like when you crack an egg into a pan and part of a dead baby chicken is halfway formed in it. A bad start can completely trash your experience. A few bad starts can completely turn you off of the game. The mechanics on this game are pretty meh. Any feature other than shooting feels like half implemented sluggish code. Jumping over simple walls are an absolute pain but shooting people as they try to figure out how to open a door is extremely satisfying. Overall sure it is fun but these types of games need much more polish. If they could take a AAA FPS game and enable these kinds of mechanics in them you would have a winner.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Lots of fun chaos and frustation.Honestly despite all of the negative reviews most of which being about performance it's actually a very solid game. I'd like to start off by pointing out that it's an early access game that actually has direction a release date and isn't stuck in development hell.Here's talking about you DayZ...There are a couple of issues such as being fairly demanding and having a little bit of early game lag but honestly that's about it in terms of my experience with performance. If you have a half decent PC which you should if you're a PC gamer then you're good to go. I do have to recommend that if you haven't already you should upgrade your RAM to at least 16GB since most games require more as of late.I've included my specification and a screenshot of in game settings. The FPS counter hovers around the 144FPS cap for the majority of my gameplay which is what I would like it to be. Computer Specification Intel i7 7700k 4.2Ghz (4.5Ghz boost clock) Gigabyte G1 6GB 980TI 16GB Corsair Vengeance RGB (2x8GB) 3200Mhz ASUS Z270 P Motherboard BenQ XL2411Z 144Hz MonitorHere is the settings I am using. These are mainly for advantage to be honest. Up until yesterday I had everything on ultra but this provides an advantage whilst looking for people.Settings gyazo.com

review: Good fun game full of thrills. Yes it has its drawbacks servers used to be laggy (not anymore in last two weeks though!) sometimes it crashes (rare) sometimes you encounter cheaters (again not THAT often on EU servers in my opinion) people in lobby can be noisy brats (but that's not game's fault) UI still has a long way to go but for your EUR 30 you get hours and hours of intense moments disappointing losses and ultimately extremely satisfying and hard earned wins. You get a lot less than this for this money in most other games. And developers actually do work on this title. So recommended. It's fun even if you lose most of the time.

review: So. You're thinking about getting PUBG but not sure? I would reccommend you get it. If you like Battle Royale it's pretty darn good. I personally perfer PUBG to Fortnite since the maps are much much larger and the overall feel of the game is much more realistic which adds to the stress and realism of crawling around on your belly as the circle shrinks pushing you closer to the 9 remaining players in your game... You can play the game as hardcore as you want but personally i find that PUBG is a great cooldown game. Perfect to sit down and play a match after a long day at work or to blow off steam in between rage filled Dark Souls marathons )

review: So there i was Shivering in the rain a cold breeze sweeps through my deep dark curls as i hear a persons footsteps in the building next to me. I ready myself I've been looting for the past 15 minutes and have rationed my gear out perfectly i am a god. i check my gear. Armour? Check. Ammo? Check. healing items? Check. I change the firing mode on my UMP from "does no damage" to "can kill every other player in the game in a matter of seconds" Done.I'm Ready. Victory is at handthe enemy leaves the house and runs my direction not a clue in the world.i decide now is the time to strike.I LEAP OUT!blat blat blat..... click click "sigh"My weapon the weapon that gave me warmth while i stalked my prey failed on me. i saw my bullets connect at least 3 times to the chest/mid section before the game decided not to register my damage done. i see my ammo count going down..30 29 28 0..........i get at least 3 4 bullets in before the game "decides" i have no ammo left and the hunter has become the huntedhe one shots me with a shotgun from at least 6 metres away shooting through my level 3 vest like its made of the same stuff these servers run on.i'm dead.i uninstalli re installand so the cycle begins again.

review: I've had this game since the beginning and I've always enjoyed it but there are a few problems with it. This didn't used to be the case the in game content that you can earn now almost always requires you to buy a key to unlock. What's the point (aside from making more money) to charging for literally everything in the game. You can however get that occasional box that you can unlock for free but I still have yet to get that. Keys for this game cost $2.50 not much for one but every box you get will require you to buy another one. I sure as hell am not going to put that much money into the game. The only problem now with in game currency is that it has pretty much become worthless since the game is just going to require you to buy more products. I'm going to continue to play the game and get boxes but i'm not going to pay to open them. I'll just go and sell them on the community.

review: I cannot recommend this game in it's form right now because of some issues that I'm going to adress shortly but first I am supreme in CS GO I'm saying this because some bois are going to say I need to git gud instead of just saying the thruth in that this game is simply not skill rewarding (compared to a game like counter strike). I've also been playing since august last year.I have decent aiming skill but really when playing solo's in this game it doesn't matter because if you drop somewhere with some other people the server lags so bad you it depends on who gets lucky enough to get the window to pick up a gun because it just lags so bad you have to swipe items over 2 5 times before you actually pick it up and even if I pick up a gun and kill 2 3 people I can lag out for 2 seconds and in that time someone comes behind and shoots me which sounds logical but on my screen I just die in 1 tick and never hear or see anything. Especially on the new Savage map this is an issue because if you want an ar and semi decent gear you will have to drop in a place with at least 5 other people.Another problem with early game is that the items take a while to spawn in meaning that if you've practiced parachuting and basically outskill your opponent by beating them to the ground you will get ed over because you think you've cleared a space and then seconds later you die to someone who looted that exact floor but parachuted in later and found a gun.Here's a small intermission with some bugs and things I don't like about the game 1. If you drive a car and a motorcycle into each other the chance of you randomly flying into space and another universe is very big.2. Sometimes guns ignore armour (even tho devs said they fixed this) resulting to umps 2 shotting you with level 3 armour.3. Getting stuck you can get stuck in some houses and you'll be there for the rest of the game.4. Not hearing sounds I've had a lot of times now where I simply dont hear my enemy reloading their gun or any footsteps but when I watch the deathcam they're just sprinting around. This happens mostly early game.5. The spectating system is extremely bad to the point where If i spectate a teammate or watch a game back it's so inaccurate it becomes useless.Back to the reviewBefore going to the next topic being duo's and squads lets talk about cheaters in PUBG.For me I haven't seen a blatant cheater in 200+ hours of play but the ones that aren't blatant are invisble because of the bad replay and spectating system. The spectating system sometimes doesn't show recoil and it's too inaccurate to see if someone is cheating or not.Duo's and squads are another story and for me the most enjoyable part of this game. In contrast duo's and squads do reward skill and any game you play with friends are more fun then playing with randoms. The knockdown and revive system are a blessing but at the same time very annoying because you can knock someone super far away but they will get revived can you cant get that 800 meter kill you worked so hard for steamsad . But still the looting problem persists and is just a wall between you action and combat. For me the best solution to solve this is for everyone to be able to have ar's and snipers anywhere and reserve high level gear and the best attachments to hot drop places making it so if you want that kar98k with an 8x you will have to go for the risky play of dropping hot and challenging your skill instead of not finding a gun when looting 3 building on the military base and then dying to someone who looted the smallest house there and got 2 ar's. The system they have now might be good for the casual player but for someone who caters to skill and wants to win consistently it's a burden to have this very frustrating mechanic in the game.And lastly they have added weapon skins which to many people says a lot about what the developers are doing at the moment but I know that different teams work on different things and that those people that worked on weapon skins dont work on fixing bugs or adding more event modes.My final thoughts on the game are that the speed at which it changes is very big but it just isn't a full game or 1.0 as they call it to me it's still very far away from that and it's still in early access in my eyes. Solo's are a nightmare Duo's and squads are fun but that doesnt compensate enough to make this a positive review.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The modern day 100 in 1 game Leg day Simulator Wanna know what its like to do cardio and step outside your house into a Crimean post soviet island and do about 5km of Cardio on average with 25kg of loot in your backpack? ISIS simulator The game has an inbuilt feature where you can talk to other players in any semitic Arabic dialect you prefer and if they have the same function enabled they can hear you scream allahu ahkbar at the top of your Shisha foaming lungs before you toss a nade the size of an apple that will inevitably impale their life with the full force of the holy f*cking Jihad.GTA VI The game itself is basically what GTA VI should have been before it has even been released. Drive the latest vehicles ranging from the Dacia UAZ and buggy all the way to your 2 wheeled stunt c*nt bikes that automatically enable you to do the sickest f*cking tricks since David Copperfield sucked himself off inside a tank of Pirahnas before flipping the 20 000 odd audience the bird and dissapearing. Shooting range Save your cash irl and just hit real people in this game. Any gun ranging from a VSS crossbow all the way to your mums crusty frying pan she stir fries your dad's testicles with are all within your reach. review: With a little over 90 hours in PUBG I feel its time for a review. In the little time (month and a half) ive had the game ive seen it go through some pretty drastic updates. Each update has been a drastic improvment on the game and shows that the publishers do indeed care for the game and for the most part listen to their fans or atleast care about what the fans are looking for. Theres several ways you can play the game and an infinite number of strategies to help enjoy the game. PROS * Consistent updates* Earnable cosmetics through gameplay or tradable on the steam market* Multiple employable strategies* The ability to play with your friends in 3rd person mode or even 1st person!* Large map that encloses on the playerbase as they kill each other (this map and playable area is also influenced by players depending on where they drop from the plane)CONS * Not very well optimized for lower end PC's and few high end PCs (recently added or are adding 6 core support)* Rage inducing deaths (youre going to die A LOT)* 3rd person mode adds a bit of a handicap because you can peek over walls and keep an eye on people* Community is pretty hit or miss (youll hear a lot of racial slurs and people yelling about Chinas position on a leaderboard of countries in the lobby)

review: So far the game in it's current state is pretty fun the variety of guns and items you can obtain and get is a lot of fun. I really enjoy the fact that they added attachments to this game. Which is something I was looking for in a "survival games" type of game play.Some people may be asking the question... "How is this different from H1Z1 KOTK?"well there are a few things like...1. The customization of weapons and mods to go with those weapons is a big one.2. Graphics are a lot better in my honest opinion.3. A wider variety of weapons to choose from.4. I like the fact that i can hit play and it starts up the game no need for a launcher.Things I would personally like to see 1. Maybe a single player added where we can play against bots/AI for those who may not have internet or stable internet.2. A lot more loot would be nice too(I'm sure they will add more)3. I think the idea of adding a couple more maps would be interesting.(change up the gameplay every now and then so we are not all stuck to one map all the time)Issues I have one major issue when I spawn into the game and land in a area the buildings or objects do not generate right and i am forced to wait a good 30 seconds or minute for it to show up correctly. While I'm waiting I can't grab objects or open doors so im in the open and pretty much in the open to be attacked.So all together this game has great potential and I hope they keep this game up to date fair and fun for everyone.I would definitely recommend this game to people and friends.

review: While I have not put a hundred hours into this game (yet) I've enough experience in video games (40 years near enough) to see a games good and bad points this does have both (it's early access deal with it). So far it's content lite but very promising I'm sure with more maps and new modes like the Zombie co op mode due soon it'll eat up a lot of my time. although support for 150 players is pretty impressivePROS A nice variation on last man standing borrowing ideas from ARK and ARMA games and a fairly quick round game. Nice loot system pretty good gear range sound fx are pretty good. Co op and team modes offer a bit more fun over the standard solo lone wolf mode. Lots of new features due in the near future. CONS Typical early access issues such as not being optimised yet. I've seen cheaters due to lack of anti cheat methods but heopfully that will be addressed before it kills off the fun graphically dated looking (Very similar to ARMA2) but does the job. Vehicle handling is very basic. I'd like to see vegittation forced to ultra so cant be reduced as it's too open without much cover in a lot of places.EDIT Latest patch 3/8/2017Broke the game framerates plummiting to sub 40 from 80 minimums laggy servers and the biggest insult PAID cosmetics on a ALPHA grade early access game... seriously? top selling game on steam and devs are cashing in before it's even running properly.

review: Fun and competitive. Mechanically the game feels like what DayZ should have been. It is clear this is a competent dev team that values a smooth and polished experience. Putting aside the typical optimisation issues early access titles have this game plays like a dream. Too often these EA titles are muddled with 'quality of life' issues where your character can't seem to properly executed the most mundane tasks eg. walking uphill driving without serious desync climbing a set of stairs and so on. You will see none of this in this game.I was at first worried at what seemed to be copious amounts of loot I'd see when watching videos of the game. As someone who comes from game's like 'DayZ' and '7 Days to Die' I am used to good loot being hard to come by. And I enjoyed it. It made the impending confrontations that much more intense and weightful. But in this game you can come out decently geared in matter of minutes if you're just a little lucky. After my first few matches I was happy to see that every confrontation is in this game is indeed intense and most of all fun as hell. The variety of weapons vehicles and terrain makes for a battlefield with limitless potential for pvp shenanigans. The only bad things I can say about BATTLEGROUNDS are all things typical of EA titles. BATTLEGROUNDS is up there with some of the most polished EA titles almost every aspect of the game feels good and works right. The asking price may be a little steep for an EA title but if you like PvP BATTLEGROUNDS easily justifies it's asking price. Simply this is a well made game where you're dropped on an island with 99 other people who want you dead. And yes it's as fun as it sounds. 8/10

review: A few things. One. Everyone plays in low res mode because it gives people an unfair advantage by negating all of the foliage and natural cover afforded by the game. Which is kind of lame. I like how the game looks in Ultra mode but if you want the edge that everyone else is using than you're forced into using it almost. The game is buggy but it's also early access so this is to be expected. Despite the fact that things will occasionally freak out on you this game provides a seriously addictive pvp experience that I've not had the likes of since I was big into MOBA's. Really this may be the future of online competitive gameplay.Now the downside. This game has sold an insane amount of copies at 30bucks a pop in early access and whatever the cost was for preorders. So the method in which they are instituting the f2p monetization tactics is a little . For one there is no reason to make me earn a bunch of ingame points at a ing trickle only to than charge me real money to buy a key to open the damn thing. This is unneccisarily complicated and kinda bs. In fact i do not understand why they do not take the approach of a company like Blizzard and offer an ingame solution to lootboxes and a paid solution for those who don't want to wait. And if that isn't enough maybe offer outfits you can buy sans the loot box RNG bs all together.Really I enjoy this game and I can certainly continue enjoying it without blowing money on cosmetics. However i wouldn't mind supporting the game but they really need to find a more graceful way of implementing the monetization.

review: Initially I gave this game a positive review since it filled a void I had. After putting more hours into it I can better see it's worth.First of all it has too much randomness involved over skill which is why it probably won't ever be an esport. Randomness is especially noticeable near the end you're likely to get screwed by the circles if you're not in the "right" spot essentially wasting 15 20 minutes of your time.Still laggy as heck with poor hit registration. You would think those are priorities but I guess not when they make polls on what type of looting to implement...Paid crates... You would think that by selling millions of copies and an earning as much they would fund the tournaments themselves nope. They still want us to fund it even though they could easily do it greed ladies and gentlemen. I would understand if they game wasn't as popular then the need for crowd funding would make sense (see the newest Mortal Kombat). But when you have the collateral and are not willing to advertise the game yourself (which what tournaments essentially amount to) then there's something wrong there.I say pass unless you want a ticket on the hype train...

review: Do you wish to relive the 90s and the joys of 56k modems? Or maybe the 00's when game developers didn't bother to finish their games. Maybe you're nostaligic for the release of every MMO ever and want to experience the bottom of the line in server reliability and constant bugs! Or perhaps you just love the fun of putting quarters in a slot machine that's not even plugged in. Or you fondly remember the days before anti cheat methods in video games and wish to harken back to those simpler times. Have you ever said to yourself that Truck Simulator would be better if you were just WALKING? Well then PUBG is the game for you. If however all of that sounds like the flaming pile of garbage it is maybe you should wait until an actual competent developer steals the idea and executes it in a moderately acceptable way. Don't support unfinished games.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Neat concept awful optimization clunky gameplay.On the fence for recommendation. Get it if you're really into the survival/battle royale genre or just want to jump on the popularity bandwagon. It's not a terrible game but it's not really good either. Some fun to be had with friends a lot of frustration to be had by RNG and running across a field to get to the zone for 10 minutes just to get shot in the back. The shooting is what you're supposed to be doing most of the time and the main gameplay mechanic tho you'll find yourself looting and chasing the zone more often unless you luck out. That being said shooting feels pretty garbage tbh. It's functional I guess but not really fun and shoddy hit registration is frustrating as all get out when you lost a 1v1 by luck more than getting outskilled. One of the worst optimized games of all time. Runs like garbage devouring all resources available to it. Bugs of all sorts abound. You've likely seen some of the fun ones already. Also not a fan of the Twitch things laying around in game or the product placement. Feels very.. artificial and produced. Like I'm not playing a fun game a guy made because he thought it would be fun but like I'm feeding into the corporate machine of profit or something. Just gives me really weird and hokey vibes I guess. Whatever. So meh. You probably already have this game anyways everyone on steam has bought it.

review: I enjoyed playing PUBG with my friends for a while but we quickly got fed up with it. The clunky controls and awkward physics put new players at a serious disadvantage until you get used to working around them and even after many hours of play they sometimes get you killed. The cosmetics are very underwhelming and overpriced. There's also controversy over streamer favoritism from the developers and adding microtransactions in early access. The overall quality is certainly of an early access alpha but the game costs far more than most early access games.The massive success of PUBG makes it very likely that other Battle Royale games will be released in the near future from more experienced studios and one of them is bound to be a more refined and enjoyable entry to the genre for a better price. I suggest waiting for that game to come along and saving your money.

review: One day you wake up. You were born from dust but here you shine like a star. Entering a lobby of slithering snakes stream sniping shroud you question everything as is life. A flash of black. A hum of an airplane enters the scene as you watch from afar. "Is this third person?" Everyone in your squad questions "China number one!" is heard over your comms. Next thing you relize someone screaming "DROP NOW!". You smash your eject button and dive face first into milly still questioning every action. Lv 3 armor and full kit M16/UMP comobo leads you to the last circle. You're sitting in a bush like a pleb but forgot it's still third person. You accidentially toggled FP mode when slithering with your squad but there all dead. You're vulnerable. A few shots pop off in the distance. Closer. Closer. Closer. The circle is small you and 1v1. You sit there waiting this isn't any other big name title on the makret this is PUBG. "PC Master Race" you mumble under your ghillie covered breath. The chicken is baking simmering waiting. "sssSSSsssSSS I'm a snake! sssSSsssSSS" *Whack* "SssSSssSS I'm a SSSssslithering sssSSSsssnake!" *Whack*. The chicken fades dignity missing you find yourself alone surronded by thoughts emotion hunger. Confused. *Whack* The scene falls back third person and fades. In the distance a ghillie a slithering snake sluggin through the weeds. You've lost it all. Your time effort house wife kids assets. You're GTX 1080i humms in the background. It's all over for you now. The scene fades in a hum some yelling "DROP NOW" and you've lost track of time once again.

review: EDIT for all the people complaining about lag or bugs. I play on an Alienware R4 and can play on ultra with no lag aside from a handful of moments that don't last long. i have ran into a couple bugs like doors every 20 games or so but nothing that has hindered my game play or been anything more than giving me a little chuckle or minor annoyance for a few seconds and its rare. So these people must be on very low end computers or exaggerating because they have a problem with the devs or something other than the game itself.Awesome game! I definitely recommend it. I usually only play MMORPG's I just came from console playing ESO to PC and I got PUBG and now its all I play! I'm not used to shooters but this is a whole new type of game being the battle royal style and with the realistic gun mechanics and physics it makes this way better than any shooter i have played in the past. its enough to keep you interested and wanting to improve also there are different ways you can play depending on your style/mood.

review: + Well thought out game mode+ good vehicle control+ nice weapon arsenal for start. Early acess (so now devs can hide behind "it's not ready" argument when bugs arise) the game constantly loads in something ...constantly. In cities just turning around fast the game lags because of this 1st person is horible aside from aiming poor animations (just seing where the arms move at the sholder I think the character is breaking bones) constant need to RELoad the main menu instead of returning to it (from programming prespective there is diference) 30$ for this...as inky rose would say "yeah NO" for unreal engine VERY poorly looking. constant network lags &amp poor connectivity a lot of times RIPE for micro transactions... and I predict this will be put in game sooner or later! Poor MENU design especially for OPTIONS part Jumping is just bad if this was done as fps first and foremost this would not be such an issue! Physics in general are weird off or broken (try ramming 2 vehicles together and you'll see!) EDITED after 1.0 release +actually came out of early accesss+vehicles are even better+map design instead of resuing 90% of the assets actually has work put into itwith new models etc+character movement is quite good disregarding that it's built from 3rd peson modein the first place! jumping is ...meh animations thou lacking are a bit thingter FPS mode still sucks quite a bit Menu still kind of sucks physics still suck optimization still needs work visuals are undervelming stillNow that the game is out from the hellhole of early access it's actually competent and enjoyable from time to time!A decent pick up and play game that can be taken further too!Again Get it KNOWING what it is!

review: This "game" is a sorry excuse for a shooter. It's unfinished and riddled with bugs. Hackers run the game rarely will you get killed by anyone who isn't blatantly and shamelessly hacking. Just today I was killed at least a dozen times by obvious hackers. My last death was to a hacker who had not only an aimbot but also an instant health regeneration cheat. Even if it weren't for the major problems (bugs and hackers) even if this "game" was flawlessly executed and perfectly coded conceptually it still isn't very compelling. Almost every "game" element is governed by random chance from loot placement to circle constriction. Strategy is a major element and it is something that might be fun to play if it weren't for the aforementioned game breaking flaws. Skill is not a major element so if you are looking for a truly competitive shooter stick with CS GO. To the developers credit they do make an attempt to update the game with regular major patches but as of 2/16/18 the "game" is still broken and practically unplayable. True it is only a $30 game and you might be inclined to say that I am expecting too much of it but considering the millions of sales this "game" has had since it's release I'd say the developers should have plenty of resources to fix what's broken. I honestly cannot comprehend the popularity of this bloated dice rolling sim ah... I mean "game " but I'm sure it's day in the sun will soon fade as people move on to better things that is unless the devs can pull their heads out of their dark smelly crevices long enough to fix some bugs and ban some hackers. My advice is to save yourself the $30 and look elsewhere for your gaming needs.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Many people complain about hackers but recently I havent seen any. It seems they have actually gone down. However i do have something to complain about. Whenever i load into a game it takes me about 1 minute to load in. Sometimes i will only load in when the plane has just dropped everyone. If the game is taking up almost 100% of my GPU when in the main menu atleast make it have the maps loaded. Also if i start running when im reloading with a sniper please make it where i can run at full speed. I hate when the game thinks i still want to zoom in even though im running i wanna be able to run full speed. Also bring back the guns at the beggining of the game or make it where everyone has one to practise shooting. If i had a shooting range i could find out how much bullets actually drop. Instead of wanting to test in game but knowing that if i test i will alert everyone around me.It may seem like i dont like the game but its the opposite. This game is an amazing game and everyone should give it out a try.

review: I don't write reviews often or at all but my experience with this game is something I wish to share. As a game Player Unknown's Battlegrounds is the very epitome of "great potential". It has a fun and immersive combat system with amazing sound design and visual quality. The map can look incredible if you have the right specs and even without a super computer it can look very nice. It does have its issues with running smoothly both client side and server side but most of the time the experience is smooth. I would say with a little more time and content this would be a game worth its 30$ price tag.In it's current state however it isn't. From what I can see it's current state is going to be it's only state for a long long time. While the devs are trying to constantly update and optimize the game I haven't seen a significant change in a period of around 6 months. Extra guns get added in but the bugs and glitches that broke up my otherwise fun games remained. The shootouts went from being fun to being incredibly annoying with people's guns being either incredibly loud or releasing no sound at all and random frame freezes making sniping a bigger risk than advantage. I find myself playing for hours at a time to get around 3 minutes of heartpounding action before getting taken out by someone who just happened to be nearby when I started shooting someone else. Seemingly random drop speeds make it impossible to predict who will get to a house first. One moment I'm cleary falling faster the next the guy zooms past me as I automatically pull my chute. As a 10$ game I would be fine with it but for 30$ I'm sitting wondering what made this game as good as Cuphead. I may have 150+ hours but I have only been truly playing and enjoying the game for about 15. All of which are on the same map with the same weapons and the same format(except the extremly rare weather changes).The fact that there is no custom testing map makes me nervous. It implies the devs don't want the players to actually test their game. They just want you to raise their daily player count to drag in more people. Most people are just guessing at what the weapons stats really mean and what shot distance does etc. Furthermore it has become increasingly obvious that the devs don't stick to their word. From pushed back release dates(at least somewhat understandable) to completely BS purchasable loot crates their word becomes less and less trustworthy. A game with the player count of PUBG should not have trouble funding ANYTHING let alone a tournament. Streamers make the game seem more fun that it really is with smooth gameplay and clean kills you almost think your looking at a good game. But the second you get in you realize that without a supercomputer the glitches become to much and the gameplay becomes a nightmare of repetition.In the end PUBG just feels like a borderline scam. I feel robbed of my time playing both with friends and alone. As a game it's something I could see being fun in the future but not anytime soon with it's current developement process. It's like a gilded turd a piece of lightly coated in gold paint. I won't say anything like "I'll change my review when the game gets better in the future" because I don't believe it will. I will say however that if you want a 30$ cheap thrill this game will give you that but I think it might be better just to watch IT in theatres and play Fortnite after. It gives you roughly the same feeling and half the cost.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: UPDATE While the game concept and model is really fun it crashes and freezes more than ever since this last update. I was happy but not anymore. They're making the game crashes more consistent.ORIGINAL REVIEW Things to know BEFORE YOU BUY The graphics are sub par and frame rates are similar to DayZ where 30FPS is a blessing. The Servers and or gameplay seem very laggish especially when others are near by or in close quarters combat. So prepare for a "How did that even happen?" question when you die. There are hackers in the game. There are already a handful of hacking sites selling their product. Here is one video for proof https //youtu.be/81XJS buB2M?t 13s There are many more if you search. I CANNOT recommend this game just yet even though I am having fun regardless of the cheating.

review: I really wish I could enjoy this game. Some things about it are really fun but it really fails in the end. I feel that playing with friends is just about one of the only thing that keeps me playing. Now about the things I dislike. The combat system is fun with cool weapons but some are totally broken and more powerful than others. An example would be the VSS a totally sad a broken gun and the UMP 9 a PDW that uses the same 9MM but is far better than the VSS. The damage model is all over the place. Another thing is that the map is way to big. I love how open it is but I feel that sometimes games go way to long and without dropping in a big town you will not find many people until the end. The last thing is the optimization. From many hours i've found that whoever has the better PC will win. The fact that the game can barely run on anything that isn't a monster PC is sad. In conclusion I feel that this game has a lot of potential but Bluehole and PUBG Corp don't seem to care about fixing the game but would rather work on meaningless things like a new gun or a map or whatever they feel best. I will come back to this game sometime in the future but for now I will stay away and tell others to do the same.

review: This game is very good. In comparison to H1Z1 its a lot less arcadey but a lot more fun. The combat feels a lot more responsive and unless theres server lag (Which happens quite a lot sadly) the gunplay feels great. For an early access release the game has a lot going for it and I hope the devs dont lose sight of their goal to make a great battle royale game that doesnt take advantage of its users by releasing a plethora of crates and no updates to back it up. EDIT (4/2/2017)I forgot to state something and that is that AMD GPU's dont seem to fare well in this game for now. You get strange artifacting when certain graphical settings are higher than very low. An example of that can be seen here https //www.reddit.com/r/PUBATTLEGROUNDS/comments/626812/artifacting_issues/EDIT2 (5/25/2017) The issue with AMD GPU's has been resolved. May have been a driver update because after updating to the latest drivers the issue was gone. I think I even gained more FPS. Cheers!The only thing this game needs now is to continue the daily and monthly updates that will help with FPS and other optimizations! )Thanks devs and thank you PLAYERUNKNOWN!

review: As of Sep 23 it's very obvious that this game is still in Alpha. Character creation is a sad three choice system that makes other much much older games feel luxurious by compare. The menu screen (where you create and select your character) has zero UI sound effects to supply feedback instead relying on their sweet music score to distract you from the disjointed UI experience.You will always need to re select your region before each match.You will always see the loading screen credit text after each match.Default graphics settings are a confusing mixture of potato and supercomputer. Windowed full screen ultra? What?But to get back to bagging on the UI yeah it's not been implemented yet. The in match UI is .. to be nice .. functional. Inventory management is worse than 2007 WoW. You can't right click or double click attachments nope you have to drag them from right to left across the entire screen to the field you think they go ... and nope doesn't go there. Repeat. Repeat. There is no visual queue of where you are being fired upon from. Not a direction or even a flash from the weapon itself (unless you're really really close). What you do get is really good sound queues which is shocking considering the entry level CS course quality UI. What takes that bright spot and wipes a turd all over it is that the sound of your blood splattering covers up any sounds you would have used to determine where you're being sniped from.Speaking of snipers how is it that I can only ever find weapons with immense spread or wide cross hairs but I run into sniper after sniper? Engaget says they've banned 150 000 cheaters since March. I'm guessing that they haven't gotten around to actually implementing any anti cheating tech .. you know because the UI kinda signals their level of software development skills.Ultimately I cannot recommend this game to my friends (already warned them off it) and I probably wouldn't suggest it to people I don't like either. I think there is an awful lot of promise for this game and this genre and I look forward to another software house picking up the rights to this on the cheap after it finishes crashing and burning in the coming months.Hopefully the lone developer that they have working on this will be able to find another job just not in software development.

review: This game is amazing. 100 Player servers. The map is huge but game has mechanics to drive players towards a shrinking zone or take damage. The goal is not to get frags but to simply try to survive until the match ends since there is no respawn. You have to constantly make decisions. Should I check this house to find a decent gun and some armor but maybe run into a guy who is using it as a shelter who is waiting for me to go in so he can blast me with his shotgun? If I don't check the house I have to make do with this pistol. I see a guy running in the distance if I shoot him I'll expose my position anyone within 1000 meters but if I let him go he might come around and blast me later.Do I get in this jeep? I'll be able to cover some serious ground instead of running out in the open but everyone is going to hear my engine and try to get some shots off on me while I'm driving. The weapon handling is pretty tight the guns feel powerful but you can take quite a few shots at range before going down.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Filfthy game polluted with hackers and toxic players that induce more toxicity. Poorly optimized and don't take my word for it go to twitch or youtube and watch some of the top players with super computers have to run this game at medium or below for 60 fps of course counting what ever software is used to stream the game. I'd recommend you test out your own specs on this game theres a million websites for that.The game lacks any sense of reward. I'd feel rewarded if I got some sort of status or item from the game when I won. What is given to you its in game currency that can only lead to cosmetics often leading up to a "Woah I just used raw skill to win a game when I had a 1 in 100 (although in most games its 90 players instead of it's advertised 100) chance to succeed! I'm going to really enjoy this 6 cent cost cosmetic i already owned as a reward for winning!" Which is how it works once you celebrate the fact that you won a difficult game you realize you've won nothing else out of it besides crushed satisfaction.The game is too long. I get it it needs to be this long or else you dont have enough time to prepare (although I still think you need more time to prepare) and the game moves too quickly for players to keep up before dying. Nonetheless there must be something that can be done with the fact that I'm playing for 20+ minutes and then I get shot faster than I can react most times to hackers but that's just rubbing salt in the wound. Worst case scenario you either spend 25 minutes running in circle and trying to live (but die no matter your success) you die in top 30 when circle is too far and your guard is down or you die in top 10 to a suppressed single shot killing sniper. You can also win but like I said earlier you won't be satisfied with spending 30 40 minutes to win 700 minimum credits translating into depending on how often you've played the game 20 50 cents. When I said "depending on..." It could also maen that you've already redeemed your first lootbox and you got nothing but a mild sense of satisfaction from your win.Glitches. You'll struggle to land in the map sometimes because of a mouse lock and god forbid you alt+tab because your screen will usually get stuck or something else will go wrong. Vehicles have barely seen improvement not enough for certain.Mirimar vs Erangel. Everyone hates Map #2 came out late December and even after being reworked for player mobility and looting convenience they screwed it up by adding more cities no one will ever go to and the vehicles not in random places where people would end up eventually checking and primarily in big cities people like to avoid for obvious reasons. I personally like Mirimar instead of Erangel just because of the change Erangel's repeatitive military island circles (which Mirimar was assured to not have the same mistake done and make the "military island" 1/8th the size and less likely.) has worn me out just as much as the next person and it's refreshing to have genuine random circles yet just as frustrating to not have any travel.Long story short greatly flawed game that is only attractive because no one WILL do it better not to be confused with "cant" although there are games that fail to mimic PUBG's characteristics. I'd recommend you see it yourself but don't exceed the 2 hour mark unless you're that committed I'm sure you can find something wrong with it between the settings adjustment and 2 3 games don't waste your times on pointers until you're again committed. I might be a moron for still playing this game anyway I fail to detach from this game despite knowing it's never going to be an enjoyable outcome win or loss.

review: This is my first BR style game. I considered getting into DAYZ or whatever other big ones are out there but I'm not a huge fan of zombie games so I never really got into it.So far I have only played solo I'm trying to get some friends to join the game because the tactical aspects of this game are great. While there are a ton of pros and this game is a must have for any tactical gamer (if you like old school tom clancy games or ARMA etc) but there are a few flaws present at this stage of development. Here is a big list of Pros and Cons I've seen with the game so far.Pros +Decent graphics... not revolutionary but good enough to not get in the way. +No bullet sponges! One shot kills feels like I'm playing a rainbow six game... This is what I dreamed the Division would be like i PVP...+ Huuuuge map all the buildings are fully exploreable some of the bigger sprawling complexes would be big enough for a lot of FPS games out there. It really feels like you are on a sizeable island that is rich with exploration. + Abundance of weapons and tools at your disposal taking the time to explore and loot is really important and when you find that awesome upgrade you need it makes you feel good. There is a sense of progression throughout each round. Looting another player is like winning the lottery! + Wepon modifications are meaningful+ Limited carry capacity and weapon capacity. + No observing the game means people cant teamspeak and be "Eyes" for someone (I admit I used to do this in Counter Strike)+ Speaking of Counter Strike Sound is crucial... you should wear headphones for this game. + Hitboxes seem accurate so far... haven't noticed any packet loss missing or rubberbanding etc. + Huge tension with the high damage mechanics and one life.+ No spawn camping everyone starts on the same footing I like the spawn idea to keep it fair. +Voip+ No "Spotting" or "tagging" enemies... your camo actually matters and works really well just like in the trailers No minimap with enemies on it either!+ Bullet drop AND being able to zero in your weapon.+ No micro transactions but active player driven steam market of clothing items... nothing that changes stats. Clothing DOES matter in this game though! Camo is huge! + Taking out an enemy feels great! Even if you only get one kill during a round they are always memorable... there are times where you get that "only in battlefield moment" which sticks with you and makes you go "that was freaking badass!" With a few more tools/toys at your exposal this would become even more prevolent. Neutral0 Destructability is present as far as blowing through doors etc or destroying things in houses but it would have been nice to have a bit more destructability in a game where you can hide behind some invincible cover. There aren't many explosives available anyway at this point. 0 Throwable weapons seem pretty useless at the moment but this is likely because I'm playing solo I definitely see them being useful in team situations. 0 I have read and seen videos of aimbots in the game... I am sure the devs are working on stopping this but given the fact that you can't see where you got killed from there is no instant replay or kill cam and the realistic damage model it is difficult to tell if you got taken out by a hacker or if a player just got the drop on you or had a good shot... It makes me hopeful seeing that there is no p2p servers so the opportunities given to hackers is smaller than it could have been. Cons (I know it's in beta this is as it stands now May 5th) The progression system needs work... It takes a while to unlock a new 'box' and when you do you end up getting like one item like a t shirt or something... it doesn't really drive you to work towards earning them. The aiming mechanic seems wierd and takes some getting used to. Single click to bring up sights not hold. There is no way to change this. I wonder why they chose to go a route different from most shooters/action games? I wish they would add the ability to customize this. Aiming from 3rd person and 1st person don't match. If you put your crosshair on something in 3rd person it shows no sign of being blocked by a wall or doorframe etc. but when you go into first person you are clearly blocked. When you are in third and aim far enough towards the blocking object it will show a red circle but it isn't always accurate. One of my first games I was in a house by a window and opened fire on someone across the street and hit nothing but the windowsill. Funny thing was the other guy ducked under his window and did the same thing we both emptied clips into walls and ran away from eachother to reload. There is only one official game 'type' by that I mean one official way the settings are adjusted. I wish I could join a game where there were variations to some rules... specifically starting player count and how fast the play area shrinks. It is important to have the play area shring so it doesn't become a camp fest but it's a bit too quick sometimes I think. You get into these great situations where you know there is a guy on the hill over there sniping there is someone in this house you are approaching while crawling through a corn field you hear someone else nearby the tension is tight.... but then everyone has to bug out. I do like how the map shrink time accelerates as the game carries on but I might say extend the time for the first few segments. The game could use some more toys... especially explosives. Due to the nature of the game the one shot kills the fact that stealth is paramount weapons like RPGs etc. wouldn't be over powered since giving away your position puts a bunch of hunters on you. Also C4 could be great too for ambushes etc. Lots of potential. I would say NO to any sort of mines though since there is no re spawn etc. Maybe a claymore that is activated with a clacker or something like that. Remote controlled IED for ambushing the roads.... maybe you even have to gather the materials to make the explosive so that it isn't anything that happens early on in the game. you can pick up gas for vehicles but I've never needed to refuel a vehicle since the play area shrinks so quickly... why not allow players to be able to dump gas around and light it? It would be awesome if you could start brush or dry fields on fire too like the Far Cry games to burn people out of cover cause a distraction or make a smoke screen. No in game clan support. I see this being a huge team game with potential for a big e sports potential etc. It would be great to be able to be recruited to clans in game etc. like other competitive FPS games. I have a suped up rig geforce 1080 32gb ram and sometimes there are some frame dips... I'm not sure if this is due to so many players on screen at once (parachute spawning or if it is some sort of optimization) it doesn't really play a big role except for the beginning... and sometimes the beginning is pretty intense! Mele weapons seem pretty useless past the first 5 minutes of the game... although the fact you can hear footsteps is awesome it makes sneaking up on people for the melee kill almost impossible. Even slow creeping (walk toggle and crouching) you make noise when you get close to the target albeit not as much and not broadcasted as far. perhaps if this was made silent when armed with a melee weapon? It could be super useful to take out an enemy quietly as to not give away your position. Ending notesI love this game I love the directions its going and the devs seem to be really listening to the community by what I have seen/read. I have really high hopes for this as it continues through development towards full release. I'd love to see some more customization to game settings on dev hosted servers. A better progression system and an in game clan community area seem important for keeping the attention of players in the long run.

review: This review was updated 2018 08 02. TLDR at the bottom.The gameplay itself is interesting. There is a little luck involved but it also rewards skill and strategic thinking and there is quite a rush as a match reaches its climax with lots of tension.The game is also routinely being updated which gives me hope that it will get even better as time goes on!Unfortunately when it comes down to it there is a bigger issue that pretty much ruins the experience for me for now making me disinterested in playing any more. I am basing my decision of whether or not to recommend on the feeling I get when I think of playing again.The community has an extremely toxic element that has found a safe space here where they can yell racist slurs and other forms of verbal abuse with effective impunity. PUBG Corporation's rules of conduct prohibit this and I support those rules but they lack some credibility when one only has to just start playing for a couple of seconds before being bombarded with blatant overt violations of these rules. You can report people from within the game but the group chat in the waiting lobby makes it difficult to determine who is generating what sounds.UPDATE In the previous version of this review I went on for a while complaining about the toxic behavior from other players. That is still an issue but I decided to just play solo matches with chat muted to avoid that and see to what extent I could appreciate the rest of the game in its technical aspects. Unfortunately I still do not recommend this game.Again the ultimate question I am answering with my recommendation is whether or not I enjoy the game and I just do not enjoy it. I do enjoy hard games. I started playing Dark Souls only because it had a reputation for being hard. I enjoyed the punishing difficulty and also that I always felt that I was making progress that my failures were due to my own mistakes that I was always learning and getting better.Since then I have played a couple of other games that are also extremely hard but not so enjoyable. PUBG is one such game. I have played it as of this update for over 26 hours and I do not feel like I am getting better. I have been playing shooters since Wolfenstein 3D back in 1992. I have watched numerous tutorial and guide videos on PUBG trying to improve my strategic thinking and situational awareness. I have tried myriad strategies.One of my matches generally consists of me collecting a bunch of loot at the beginning moving around to keep within the playzone and then suddenly dying without a fight from a player I never saw.It is difficult to see any value in the loot that I collect initially when I rarely get to use it before getting shot. When I die I often cannot imagine anything that I could have done to avoid that fate. I do not feel like I am making progress or getting better. I do not feel like I can accomplish anything in this game so it just feels frustrating rather than fun.To my surprise when I checked my statistics on the leaderboard at one point I was listed among the top 20% or so of players according to their rankings which seemed very strange to me because I felt like I had to be among the bottom with a kill to death ratio of about 0.15. Part of my "success" comes from my ability to stay out of sight until near the end of the match. I have snuck my way to the top 10 in a match a few times but almost always die as soon as anyone spots me which is almost always before I ever spot anyone else.If I am in the top 20% as that ranking seemed to indicate then that suggests to me that all but the most dedicated hardcore players at the top have a pretty similar experience of just wandering around to get killed randomly. This seems supported by what I have heard from a couple of people with whom I randomly teamed up.I have actually had a much more enjoyable time playing PUBG Mobile surprisingly. I am not sure exactly what makes it so different. Maybe the player base is different maybe the league ranking system helps put me in matches with other players of similar skill. People have talked about PUBG Mobile being full of bots at lower levels but I have gotten up to a level in my 20's I am in Silver league and I am still having lots of fun there.TLDR PROS PUBG has a fun concept with a detailed interesting and exciting implementation.CONS There are plenty of toxic abusive players. One can play solo &amp mute chat to avoid them.It is extremely difficult to feel like one is making progress or accomplishing anything even to someone like me who enjoys games known for being very hard. The player base is extremely skilled and VERY competitive.RECOMMENDATION I would not recommend this game to any of my friends. I WOULD recommend this game if you are an especially hardcore gamer with a lot of experience with shooters willing to invest many hours of practice and study into developing skills in this game and if you are looking for an extreme challenge right out of the box against many extremely skilled players.If you are NOT so hardcore but you like the concept then I strongly recommend the mobile version instead which I find MUCH more enjoyable.
