review: You should hope and pray that most game's developers are as transparent as with this game. Promises are continuously fulfilled players are listened to and the response time for patches/bugs/optimizations are way faster than expected. After the previous month's patch the foliage alone as dramatically increased the quality of gameplay. I mean I'm sitting in a field where I'd just crashed my jeep started getting fired at and dropped down for a game of wait for them to move first. We had fire fight that attracted more people from other areas. Suddenly a vehicle runs up on me I fire at it only to realize they'd bailed a moment before. The guy I was waiting for killed him right as he spotted me but I saw my real target fire his gun and quickly mopped him up. Seconds later I got shot in the head and about jumped out of my seat. These kinds of nerve wrecking experiences are so addicting! Please keep it coming!

review: While I understand alot of the negative comments. All I can think of is get gud kid!!! This game is a load of fun. It has continued to show great improvement on the test servers as opposed to the days of dropping into crayon houses. This game has a great mad max feel to it. A friend and I were playing duos and had just gotton back to the circle and posted up in a small group of 4 houses. Thats when the honking began. ALL of a sudden 4 vehicles breach the forest edge and start circling our houses honking away. My buddy and I opened fire in a panic and proceeded to have every grenade in the game thrown at us to. I was laughing in tears after we had just got oblierated. On a recent separate occasion we found two mini buses on a hill and had the first pink vs blue pubg minibus race to Saint Martin. 10/10

review: I caved to the hype and bought this game thinking it may be fun to play with friends. It is the opposite of that. The matches take way too long to start so in my 11 hours I think I may have spent most of it in loading screens and pre game match area throwing apples at people. because I die about 30 seconds in after touching the ground. I have watched videos on how to play the game better and I still have only two kills one I got from shooting an unarmed person who was standing still and one I got from camping in a tiny building staring at the wall for at least 10 minutes straight. After 11 hours I realize the game takes time to learn and adjust to just like any other multiplayer game. But I figured by this point I would at least have had fun at one point. The investment of time spent to learn this game is unreal. There is no tutorials. No singleplayer. No bots. No other modes than battle royale to get used to the mechanics. I would not hate this game so much if I had a way to casually learn to play it either with bots or a casual mode with respawns on a smaller map. I realize battle royale is the flagship of this game. And it does improve on open world mmo combat games in a lot of ways. I did not expect to go into this game and immediately dominate everyone. I went in expecting to die. A lot. What I was not expecting was the wait between deaths. The process goes as such Start game. Select modes. Quickmatch. Load screen. Waiting area (throw apples at people). Load Screen. Airplane. Spam F to jump. Still get beat to the ground. Open first door you see. (Die if you don't find a gun). Find a gun. LOAD THE GUN. Take two steps. Get shot in the head from an unknown position. Die. Click back to lobby. Loading screen. Click start match. Rinse. Repeat. I really do hate this game.

review: I really love playing this game but it has it's issues.Honestly it gets pretty intense and awesome the more you get into it but playing alone is increadibly boring.There's also ALREADY a ton of hackers. I only play for 2 3 hours a night and I come accross atlease one cheater every day. Really frustrating to have a game that isn't even stable yet and people are shooting your entire team from the first floor of a bulding and through a wall.Speaking of stable it's not. There's a lot of maintence still happening and the game lags quite a bit. I honestly don't have too many issues but I don't have a lot of games on my system. I don't keep things I'm sick of playing but my friends with some good specs have major lagging issues.Overall I personally love the game. Be aware it's nowhere near stable. They really do need to do something about the overrun of hackers. For a game this new it's kind of insane.Also why so many Tommy Guns? Stop it.

review: When you look through the other reviews you'll see a lot of "game has bugs insta hate" or "no support on OCE servers." I've played this game for a fraction of a lot of the hateful reviews and I can say I absolutely love it both playing alone and with friends. The game gives you a certain feel of terror and when i heard my first distant bullet shots i though "oh this aint so bad" until they hit you where they scare the ever living out of you and i love it. gameplay is relatively smooth for having almost 100 players on a massive geographically diverse map. Added realism like bullet drop and lead give a whole new effect to the game. This game does have a fair amount of downsides though even for early access streamers are their main crowd to please. Dev's have gotten a lot better at accepting the fact that streamers will not win every match so you wont have to worry about getting banned for it.The game used to be fairly patchy and still is but its gotten better since the games release.Hitboxes are a little iffy a helmet shields the face as well even though it's exposedAside from other downsides to be expected like framerate drops and lag spikes the dev's work has been paying off and I REALLY hope this game makes it past the early access name.

review: Just under 100 hours in not exactly playing a lot but really enjoying playing the odd game. Some people have said that it gets frustrating which I can agree with but changing your playstyle from one match to the next really helps to be an all round player and knowing how to conceal yourself when moving and being aware of hill cover is when you start getting Al lot better. It feels a lot like Arma 3 but with a he'll of a lot less clunky character movement system and with the addition of vaulting this game should feel amazing when running around in the urban environments. If you are familiar with Arma and the more pvp rather than pve elements this is very similar but with better sound system and great visuals. I would recommend watching videos for best FPS ingame as I have changed mine after around 50hrs of gameplay and I'm getting better frames and better quality. All round great game with awesome mechanics and a great flow. Definitely replayable and great to play with friends or solo

review: While the game certainly has its well documented flaws it's still an enjoyable experience in my opinion. The gameplay is addictive and engaging and the battle royale model is still fresh and can provide some pretty intense firefights. Personally I have only encountered a hand full of players in my hours of gaming that may have been cheating but overall I feel that issue is blown out of proportion (at least on the NA servers). The game does require a beastly rig to run smoothly but if you've got the hardware and a good internet connection then you're probably set for a good gaming experience.

So he went home determined to one day create his own game and make Battle Royale games great again.A few days later he was visiting his grandmother in hospital and out of the blue said "Nan do you know anyone who can code?""Yes my neighbour's grandson had a BTEC in IT!"And thus PUBG Corp was born.

review: This would be such an awesome game if not for two things 1. Cheaters everywhere and so little is done about it. Player highlight hacks headshot snaps etc.2. The optimization is horrible. When you have people on Reddit that can throw together optimization guides better than what's released by the company itself there's a problem.Don't get me wrong this game is awesome. I'm not good at it myself but that doesn't stop me from enjoying it when there aren't cheaters and horrible optimization.Overall if you're going to buy just know this is what you're going to run into.EDIT My first two complaints were eventually resolved and I have no more optimization issues and I rarely see cheaters.I now don't recommend buying the game because of the paywalls and "Event Pass" system. If it was more like Fornite's Battle Pass system I'd be okay with it. I might not buy it but I'd at least be alright with it. Paying monthly for something that disappears if you ever stop subbing is an easy way to say "We want money not to please our customers."

review: So honest truths in a Pro Con list.TL DR The gameplay and the graphics are decent depending on the map BUT the loot box system and its random PAID CRATES in a $30 game greed of the developers and lack of meaningful updates have ruined the game and forced it to become bitter experience.Pros 1. The gunplay is pretty satisying.2. The core gameplay focus that is make it to be the last one standing is fun3. The baseline graphics are pretty goodCons (aka the long list) 1. Horribly unoptimiized for being in full release (if it was still early access this would be negligable)2. When they added in the new map at full release they removed the fun fog and rain variants of the original map3. Referring to #2 they have not added back any kind of Constant Weather variants to the maps despite the Sanhok proving that it is possible.4. There are spikes of Hackers whenever they release a new loot crate.5. Constant security updates that do little to deter hackers6. A horrendous loot crate system that doesnt give you a decent return for duplicate items7. Duplicate items from crates8. Lack of feeling of progression/reward outside of matches9. Locked Loot crates IN THE STANDARD LOOT CRATE POOL that require you to pay upfront for the CHANCE to get a cosmetic item.10. Recently the new battlepass is another example of greed with fewer permanent rewards compared to temporary rewards11. The sheer presence of all of these pay to open and pay to earn systems in an already THIRTY DOLLAR GAME

review: First of all I'm at this game. I haven't won a solo as of yet and the only team win was with me dying 10min in yay team!. And yet I still cant get enough and crave for that chicken dinner that has evaded me so. Battle Royal has all the great elements of survival games without all the tedious grind bits. This game gives me more adrenaline rushes than any game of recent memory. Its not polished yet but mechanics are as good as a ton of full released open worlds.PUBG may not even be the best Battle Royal around but the player base makes it the only real option.+Its not pay to win.+Devs still working hard.A neg would be that there's still no vaulting system but they have shown demos of it and it looks slick.Overall just prepare to die a lot and you'll be fine. Ps Way better than NMS. )

review: Very fun game. Its a Battle Royale similar to Arma 3. If your looking for a free roam game where there are different servers made and customized by users I think this game is not for you and if you don't have it yet (You really should have it by now...) you should get Arma 3. Yes this game is a little buggy but its not bad for an Early Access game. Sometime the game can be a little laggy but that is eather 3 reasons. 1 your internet is not working. 2 Your computer can't handle the game. or 3 which is that the game is in Early Access its not gonna be perfect. But if you want a Battle Royale game with 100 players stranded on an battling for life and death this game is for you.I rate this game 5 stars.11 out of 10 would buy this game.

review: Its a camp fest. It intrigued me at first but as I played more and cared less about winning its just not as fun as it use to be. If you like camping in a building for 30 minutes or can shoot like shroud (and have 20 stream snipers that let you kill them) it might be fun for you. But im just done with it. Once I had won enough times there just was not enough incentive for me to play casually. At least they are adding more maps unlike these other titles which is what has brought me back to try it again.After killing the initial guys that land by you its just so hard to find encounters and usually its people hiding in a building which all have 1 stair case leading up to the second floor. When I first heard of PUBG I heard they were going to add a "hardcore mode." Well it turns out all the "hardcore mode" entails is being in first person. Unless they just scrapped the idea? But for some reason Im under the impression the first person mode is the hardcore mode. I really hope they just scraped the idea and will come back to it or add a true hardcore mode later on because If they think changing the game to first person makes it hardcore.... thats kinda sad.To me hardcore is no revive 1 shot head shots increased bullet damage Things like that.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Honestly few games can mix the tension and excitement with anger like this game can . having played it or getting on to 100 hours heres what i can say. its not a finished product but it is in no way a broken game etc the devs have worked both quickly and effectively with updates giving me the confidence that 12 months down the line the game will be even better honestly cant express enough love for the game. now thats not to say that there arent issues such as game crashes every now and again etc but truth be told most of this has been erradicated with updates . so all in all i would give this game a 10/10 i think its amazing and really tests friendships haha ps if you like cod or just on the rails linear shooters where there is little tactics involved this is not the game for you .
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS commonly known as (PUBG) has lots of pros and cons. But all things considered keep in mind that the game is still in early access so a lot can change now lets start with the pros.+Very realistic simmulation of a battle royal in comparison to H1Z1+Not exceedingly difficult in comparison to H1Z1+a lot of new items to the gameNow lets go onto the cons of PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS (PUBG) added micro transactions Not Optimised well Lots of Lag extremly long games Need a high end computerAll in all I conclude that PUBG is a very well rounded that will need updates in the future but still a good game. I would recomend this game.

review: Alright people finally need to understand that it clearly says "EARLY ACCESS". This means that things in the game are not finished. First off people have trouble with servers. Now if you were a game developer and made a game you wouldn't think the game would become the most popular game on steam of almost all time? Servers arn't exactly easy to run especially with 100 people connected to one game with 1.9 million at most. Also people are having issues with their performance. There are plenty of tutorials to help improve performance online but it is still early access. Again trying to get 100 people in a 8x8 km map isn't easy to optimize for all systems. The develpers are aware of server issues and optimization issues and most likely they will be fixed by the time the game actually is fully released.If you are looking for a game to get laughs out of with your friends and mess around and have the chance to win a mass survival game PUBG is the game for you. Remember it is EARLY ACCESS

review: Game has immense potential however it has a few key things that ruin it atm. About 1 in 3 people you run into is an obvious hacker. The leader boards are full of obvious hackers and many of the highest viewed streamers are known hackers. 20+KDA in a FFA game with 100 people in after hundreds of rounds blatent hacker. Game is horrifically optimized unless you have a beast pc expect major FPS issues and stuttering even after running all the potential fixes. As a west coast player you will also suffer terrible ping resulting in you missing shots you hit and you being killed through walls as those on the east coast see you at locations you are not at. With that all being said I cannot recomend the game to anyone in its present state. Fixing at least one of the 3 huge issues would go along way to fixing the game but it appears they are ignoring them atm.Leader board full of hackers and lots of hackers in each match.Game is horrifically optimized.Servers give horrible ping to west coast players.I do know that many ex mormons will LOVE this game and also anyone from the east coast! I have a friend who is named Imago who would LOVE this game too.

review: I remember buying this game during early access. It was a very janky yet highly enjoyable and addictive experience. But ever since the official 1.0 release I have practically stopped playing this empty husk of a game. Why you may ask?Greed.Bluehole are a bunch of greedy scumbags who used this game as an excuse to nickle and dime new and ravenous players. And what did they do with the new found constant cashflow? They took it and did nothing to fix the game. Even after the start of the FIX PUBG campaign (which was a false promise to begin with) the game is still a laggy bug ridden cheater infested mess. The game is literally dead and Brendan Greene is the one responsible. you Bluehole. You ruined one of my favorite games and I hope Blackout takes over this market.
